El Banco D. Emprendimiento SURTIDITAS es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, la mayoria D. las participantes trabaja en el comercio informal.

La Sra. TANIA es una D. las fundadoras del banco, esta a cargo  nuevamente D. la presidencia y se dedica al comercio D. diferentes productos, ya sea viveres o ropa, tiene una familia numerosa y con su negocio a conseguido hacer estudiar a sus hijos, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. mercaderia al por mayor. 

La Sra. ALEJANDRINA Es una joven participante y ocupa la secretaria, ella esta a cargo D. su hija D. 5 años, se dedica a la venta D. calzados con el prestamo a podido aumentar su capital y sus ingresos.

La Sra. MARIA MAGDALENA es la tesorera del banco , tiene una familia numerosa y con el prestamo a comprado lana para realizar mantillas que son comercializadas en las ferias , a parte que tambien se dedica a la venta D. comida, todos estos ingresos le ayudaran aumentar su capital y producción con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos mantienen el hogar solas, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento (Venture Bank) SURTIDITAS is a bank that has worked with our Institution since 2007. Most of its participants work in informal traD.. Tania is one of the founders of the bank. She bears the responsibility of the presidency once again, and works dealing in different products, whether it be provisions or clothing. She has a large family, and with her business she has managed to see to it that her children have studied. The money from the loan will be used in the purchase of wholesale merchandise. Alejandrina is a young member, occupying the position of secretary. She is responsible for her daughter, who is five years old. She works selling footwear, and with the loan she was able to increase her capital and revenue. Maria Magdalena is the treasurer of the bank. She has a large family, and with the loan she bought wool in order to make mantillas (light scarves) which are marketed during the holidays. Moreover, she also works in food sales. All of this revenue helps her increase her capital and production. With the money from the loan, she will purchase merchandise. All of the members are responsible people and hard workers who, in many cases, maintain their households on their own. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust afforded to them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Santos Epifanio

texts.es:
Este cliente se llama Santos Epifanio R. M., tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos, dos menores y uno mayor, los tres está en edad escolar, é junto a su familia vive en una comunidad rural llamada Ronald Altamirano etapa III. 

El trabaja para la Alcaldía de esta municipalidad, con nuestra institución es el quinto crédito que está solicitando, en su mayoría los créditos se la han otorgado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, pero este último lo quiere para visitar a un médico especialista, ya que está presentando problemas de salud.
texts.en:
This client is Santos Epifanio R. M.. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children. One is an adult while the other two are dependents who are in school. He and his family live in the rural community of Ronald Altamirano Etapa III.

Santos works for the municipality. He is requesting his fifth loan from our Institution. The majority of his loans have been designated for making improvements to his home, but this latest loan will be used to pay for a visit to a medical specialist because of health problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a visit to a medical specialist

loans.name: God Will Provide - Dios Provehera Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento DIOS PROVEHERA es un banco que ya está en su segundo ciclo y el Banco está conformado por 11 Integrantes 9 Mujeres y 2 Varones y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta de comida y otros, 

La Sra. CELSA es la presidenta del Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de comida y con el prestamo lograra comprar más mercaderia y aumento de su capital de trabajo,

La Sra.ADA  es la secretaria en el Banco y ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y tarjetas para todo tipo de acondicimiento y con el prestamo comprará más mercaderias para su negocio de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos economicos y aumento de su capital de trabajo.

La Sra. EUNISE ella es la tesorera del banco y tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y su negocio se encuentra en la Av. Baptista y el prestamo se invertirá en compra de mercaderias y de esta forma mejorara sus ingresos, y su calidad de vida y aumento de capital de trabajo.

Todas las socias son personas responsables, dinamicas y trabajadoras que quieren mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Dios Provehera [God Will Provide] communal bank is in its second loan cycle and is made up of 11 members. Nine are women and two are men; the ladies are business people who manage their businesses selling food and other products. Celsa is the bank president and makes a living selling food. With the loan, she would be able to buy more merchandise and increase her working capital. Ada is the bank secretary and sells clothing and cards for all occasions. With the loan, she would buy more merchandise for her business and in this manner, increase her income and her working capital. Eunise is the bank treasurer and has two children. She sells clothing and her business is located on Baptista Avenue. The loan would be invested in buying merchandise and in this manner, she would improve her income, her quality of life and increase her working capital. All of the group members are responsible, dynamic people and hard workers. They want to improve their quality of life and their families' quality of life. They appreciate Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in extending them a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel P.-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Ramona de la Concepción O., tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio Roberto González, tiene alrededor de ocho años que empezo su negocio teniéndolo fijo en su casa ya que antes la señora O. caminaba vendiendo ambulante en las calles todo tipo de mercaderia.
La señora Ramona O., empezo su negocio con C$ 2,000.00 que fueron ahorrado con la ayuda de su esposo, abre el negocio a las nueve de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche aprovechando que ahí esta en su casa y poder vender un poquito mas, ya que ella es una señora luchadora y  se esmera  para mantener a un sobrino que es como su hijo que esta estudiando en primaria, su esposo le ayuda a vender y a colocar barriles vacios con los compañeros de trabajo de el ingenio  lugar donde el  trabaja.
La señora O. tiene dos años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y ella nos manifestó que se siente muy satisfecha con los financiamientos ya que ella ha superado bastante y su negocio a incrementado bastante ahora vende barriles y le saca mas ganancias a este nuevo producto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona has a business selling used and new clothing in her personal home located in the Roberto González neighborhood. She started doing business permanently from her home about eight years ago because before she was a walking vendor on the streets selling all types of merchandise. Mrs. Ramona started her business with C$ 2,000.00 that she was able to save with the help of her husband. She opens the business at 9 AM and stays open until 8 PM, taking advantage of the fact that it is her home and she can be open a little bit later. She is a hard working lady who also devotes herself to supporting her nephew, a primary school student who is like a son to her. Her husband helps her place and sell empty barrels with his co-workers from the factory where he works. Mrs. Ramona has been working with Ceprodel for two and a half years and tells us she is very happy with the financing because she's moving forward and has improved significantly in her business. Now she sells barrels and her earnings are higher with this new product.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pack of used children's clothing

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Juana Vilma T. Garcías tiene un tramo de venta de productos varios tipo montón en el mercado, ubicado en el callejon del Masaya, La señora T. saco este financiamiento para comprar pelotas, shampoo, cremas, ya que casi no tenia en existencia, y es un producto que se mueve bastante ella espera venderlo ya que se aproxima semana santa, vacaciones, playa.
Abre su negocio a las siete de la mañana y lo cierra a las tres de la tarde tiene seis años de tener su negocio anteriormente ella era ama de casa, y empezo su negocio con un ahorro de C$ 10,000 ahorro y aporte de sus hijos ella tiene un tramo como toda su familia es madre soltera de dos hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, tiene 5 años de trabajar con ceprodel y nos manifestó sentirse muy agradecida con nosotros  por que su negocio a crecido bastante  y con las ganancias que le quedan de estos ella ha podido ir mejorando su casa y cubrir algunos gastos personales
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Vilma T. Garcías has a vending post at an alley market in Masaya where she sells a wide variety of products. She is requesting a loan to purchase balls, shampoos, crèmes, and other items that she does not have in stock. Juana experiences high product turnover, so she hopes to sell more since Holy Week is approaching and more people are taking vacations at the beach.

She opens her business at 7am and closes at 3pm. Juana has six years of experience working in her business and was previously a homemaker. She started her business with savings of 10,000 NIO and decided to have a sales post so that she could support her children. Juana is a single mother, but her two children are no longer dependent on her. She has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and says that she is very grateful that her business has grown and provided her with income to improve her home and cover a few personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Cándida Rosa M., tiene un tramo de productos varios en el mercado ubicado del almacén mundo elegante 75 vrs al norte sobre la acera tiene 35 años de tener su negocio ella alquila y su negocio lo empezo con C$20,000.00 ahorro  propio, tiene cinco hijos solo dos dependen de ella actualmente estudian en la universidad. La señora M. solicito el crédito para surtir con productos de verano aprovechando que ya viene la semana santa lo cual ella espera tener mejores ventas, es una señora luchadora que poco a poco a sacado adelante a sus hijos ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos, desde las siete de la mañana ya esta vendiendo hasta las seis de la tarde diario, sus hijas le ayudan a ver su negocio tiene varias trabajadoras tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel con once créditos de los cuales les ha sacado buen provecho por que los sabe administrar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candida Rosa Mendez has an array of various products in the market located 63 meters north of the Almacen Mundo elegante on the sidewalk. She has had her business for 35 years. She rents and her business started with C$20,000.00 of her own savings. She has five children, and presently only two are dependent on her; they are in college. Mrs. Mendez asked for a loan to offer summer products to take advantage of the fact that Holy Week is near and she hopes to have more sales. She is a fighter and little by little she has been able to get her children ahead. She has been both mother and father to her children. She sells from seven in the morning until seven in the evening every day. Her daughters help her tend to her business; she has several workers. She has been working with Ceprodel for three years with eleven loans. They have benefitted her becasue she knows how to manage them.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for my business: pools, sandals, summer clothing, shoes, notebooks.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Pedro José R. I., tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una comunidad rural llamada Sirama Sur, él habita con sus padres, trabaja para la Alcaldía de este municipio desde hace dos años, en la casa de sus padres es el único ingreso que percibe su familia.

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de algunos artículos de necesidad que s le están presentando en su hogar.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los dos anteriores fueron para hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
This young man is Pedro José R. I.. He is 27 years old, single, and lives in the rural community of Sirama Sur. Pedro lives with his parents and has been working for the municipality for two years. This is the only source of income that his family receives.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a few necessary items that will be used in his home. He has received three loans from CEPRODEL. His two previous loans were used for improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furnishing for his home (stove, bed, and television)

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Gloria G. G.  es comerciante del mercado central desde hace 25 años tiene su tramo de venta de ropa para niños por tal motivo ella solicita los financiamientos para surtir su negocio y para salir adelante con sus hijos que estan en edad escolar no cuenta con ninguna otra ayuda abre su negocio de lunes a domingo de de ocho de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
  
Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 3,000, estos los ahorro, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la costura  tiene de trabajar con ceprodel tres años manifestando que en todo este trayecto de su record crediticio le ha servido de mucho porque su negocio a incrementado sus ingresos de igual manera y las mejoras en su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Gloria G. G. is a merchant at the central market where she has been selling children’s clothing from a vending post for 25 years. She is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business and succeed on behalf of her children who are in school. Ana does not have any other help. Her business is open from Monday through Sunday, 8am to 4pm.

When she started her business, Ana had capital of 3000 NIO that she accumulated through savings. She previously worked as a seamstress. Ana has been with CEPRODEL for three years and says that in everything she has done, her credit record has served her well. She has been able to increase her business sales as well as make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Maria de la Cruz M. N. es casada tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene un negocio de venta de tortilla de puro maíz en su casa. Tiene mas de 10años de tener su negocio con este negocio ella ha salido adelante con sus hijos y con la ayuda de su esposo.
Tiene seis años de trabajar con ceprodel de los cuales ella se siente bien agradecida por que a mejorado su casa y su negocio lo ha acondicionado mejor.
La señora M. N. es trabajadora se esfuerza para darles el sustento a sus hijos y su estudios trabaja desde las cinco de la mañana pone a nizquezar el maíz para luego mandarlo a moler para palmear toda el día una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender sale a vender con una pana tortilla a los lugares aledaños de su casa y al mercado central vienen a vender
texts.en:
Sra. Maria de la Cruz M. N. is married, has two children who are of school age, and has the support of her husband. She manages a business selling pure corn tortillas from her house. Maria has more than ten years of experience in this business, which has helped her succeed for her children with the help of her husband.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for six years. Maria feels grateful because her home has improved and her business is better equipped. She is a hard worker who strives to support her children with their studies. Maria starts work at 5am to go acquire the corn that she sends to have milled so that she can spend all day forming tortillas. One of her daughters helps with making sales by traveling with a bundle of tortillas to sell in the surrounding areas near her house and at the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & firewood

loans.name: Josefina De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Señora Josefina de los Ángeles J. R. es cliente del mercado central, ubicado su negocio a una cuadra aledaña del mercadòn su puesto es venta de electrodomésticos para el hogar, relojes.
La señora J. R. tiene tres hijos en edad escolar por los cuales ella lucha para sacarlos adelante su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 15,000.00 aporte de su esposo tiene de estar en el mercado 15 años.
La señora J. R. tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nuestra institución y según ella se siente bien agradecida ya que su negocio ha incrementado y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. Su esposo le ayuda a administrar su negocio y sus hijas también le ayudan a vender a veces la señora J. tiene que salir a vender a los ingenios y sus hijas quedan al mando de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina de los Ángeles J. R. is a client who works in the central market. Her business is located in the section of the market that sells home appliances and watches. Sra. J. R. has three school age children for whom she strives to get ahead. She started her business with capital worth 15,000 NIO. Sra. J. R. has the support of her husband and has been working in the market for 15 years.

She has been working four years with our Institution. According to her, she feels grateful that her business has increased and her living conditions have improved. Her husband helps with managing her business and her children also help occasionally with making sales. Whenever Sra. J. R. leaves to make deliveries, her daughters are in charge of looking after her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her home appliance business

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia P. O. es comerciante del mercado Santa Ana ella trae el marisco desde jiquilillo para venderlo a las comerciantes de los dos mercados solo viene a entregarlos. La señora Karla P. empezó su negocio desde hace 15 años este negocio es familiar toda su familia entrega marisco su jornada empiezas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las diez de la mañana tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar la señora P. lucha por salir adelante para sus hijos y para ir acondicionando su casa. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con estos financiamientos y los ha sabido administrar ya que ha salido adelante con su negocio y en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla Patricia P. O. is a trader at the Santa Market. She brings in seafood from Jiquilillo to sell to the merchants of the two markets that she supplies. Sra. Karla started her business 15 years ago. Her entire family begins their work day delivering seafood at 5am and continues until 10am. She has three children who are of school age. Sra. Karla strives to succeed for her children and provide them with a suitable home.

She has worked with these loans for four years and has been able to manage them so that she can get ahead in her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood to sell to the market vendors

loans.name: Presentación Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Presentación Yadira M. es comerciante ambulante su negocio es de vender bajillas platos, vasos, cristalería y todo lo que se ocupa en los restaurantes tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esto ella ya tiene sus clientelas y solo por medio de pedido es que ella entrega.
Tiene tres hijos pero solo uno de pende de ella y una nieta es casada su esposo la apoya en todo. Anteriormente ella tenia un restaurante pero decidio alquilarlo para tener ese ingreso ahora ella vende ese tipo de productos decidio dejar el restaurante y venderles ese tipo de chinería y cristalería a sus clientes.
Tiene dos años y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y manifiesta que gracias a ceprodel y al apoyo que su esposo le ha dado ya hasta  término de construir su casita porque con los financiamientos que he obtenido con ceprodel me han quedado muy buenas ganancias y al suave he venido terminando mi hogar.
texts.en:
Presentación Yadira M. is a dinnerware, pots and pans, drinking glasses and restaurant supplies peddler. She has been in this line of work for 18 years and has a regular customer base to whom she sells based on prior orders. She has three children but only one of them and a granddaughter depend on her; her husband supports her work efforts. She used to run a restaurant but she decided to lease it out and earn the rent income; now she sells restaurant supplies and stopped running the restaurant – she’d rather sell dinnerware and glassware to her customers. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for two and a half years and she states that she is grateful to Ceprodel and to the support she’s gotten from her husband. She’s managed to finish building her little house and thanks to profits from Ceprodel’s loans she has been able to comfortably finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dinnerware, cutlery, coolers, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Este joven se llama Manuel de Jesús J. Chávez, es casado, mecánico, tiene un hija que es mujercita, ella está pequeña y esta cursando la escuela primaria, su esposa trabaja en los que haceres del hogar. 

El trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace 8 años en la cual se desempeña como mecánico “A”, en su hogar este es el único ingreso que obtienen. 

En la mayoría de los créditos que se le han otorgados han sido para mejorar su vivienda. 

Es bueno hacer mención que todos los créditos que ha este joven se le han otorgado, ha presentado una muy buena cultura de pago.
texts.en:
This young man is Manuel de Jesús J. Chávez. He is a mechanic, married, and has an elementary school aged daughter; his wife is a housewife. He has been employed by a private firm for 8 years as a Class "A" Mechanic; this is the family's sole source of income. Most of the loans he has been granted have been used for home improvements. It is worth mentioning that all the previous loans this young man has had approved he has repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Este Señor se llama Carlos Olivas, tiene 54 años de edad, trabaja para una compañía donde se fabrican Rones, empresa en la cual tiene 26 años de laborar, él se desempeña como Blendificador, su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, incluyéndose él, sus hijos ya están cursando la escuela de secundaria. 

La esposa de don Carlos trabaja en su casa en un pequeño negocio que ellos decidieron establecer (Pulpería), en este sentido ella le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.  

En la mayoría de los créditos que se le han otorgado a este cliente han sido para el mejoramiento de vivienda. 

Es válido mencionar que este cliente ha sido responsable  con los créditos que le hemos otorgados.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos Olivas, 54, works for a company that makes rum, work that he's done for 26 years now. He is a Blender at the company. He is the head of a family of four. His children are in high school. His wife operates a small business--a corner shop--at home that the couple set up jointly and her earnings contribute to the family's income. Most of the loans that have been extended to Carlos have been used for housing repairs and improvements. It's important to mention that this client has been responsible with the loans that he's received.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for home construction.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro L. G. es un joven soltero y trabajador que adquirió su vivienda, con este crédito será el segundo que tomaría ya que en anterior realizo su proyecto de reparar las paredes de las habitaciones. Ahora Isidro se ve en la necesidad de impermeabilizar su casa ya en temporada de lluvia se trasmina y es por ello que el quiere estar preparado ahora que lo días están agradables para arreglar su hogar.
texts.en:
Isidro L. G. is a single young man. He is a hard-worker, and he has acquired a house. This will be his second loan. With the previous loan he completed his project of repairing the walls to the rooms. Now Isidro sees the need to waterproof the house because the house leaks during the rainy season. That is why he wants to be prepared now that the weather is good for making house repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 32 year old gentleman.  He sells paints in retail from his shop and he has done this in Naivasha town for the last 3 years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid well his first loan of Kshs 50,000 which he used to buy more paints for selling in bulk.  He plans to use these funds to diversify his paint products and add a range of oil based paints since the paints he has now are water based.

He plans to start manufacturing paints in future, set up his own company, buy the necessary machines and start manufacturing paint for sell in Naivasha and surrounding towns.

loans.use: To buy more oil based paints for sale

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
Wilberforce is 36 years old, married to Eunice O. and they have four school going children.  He has run a successful business where he sells electrical goods in Naivasha town for the last seven years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid the first loan of Kshs 40,000 well and on time and he plans to use cash from this current loan to add more TV sets in his electronic shop for sale.

In future he plans to build his own building where he will operate from as this will increase his income by saving on rent and increase his sales as he will have expanded to include variety.

loans.use: To buy more more television sets for sale

loans.name: Lopur

texts.en:
Lopur is a 60 year old man who is married to Catherine Simiyu.  He operates his green grocer shop in Naivasha town and this he has done for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the proceeds of his loan to buy seedlings for carrots, which he will plant and sell later at his business point.  

In the future he plans to start selling cereals along with the vegetables in his shop.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for vegetables, which he will plant and sell on his grocer shop.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 31 years old, married to Beatrice Wanjiru and they have a two year old child.  He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for five years now and he sells his farm output in Nairobi, Kenya’s capital city in bulk.

He has been a client with KADET for more than four years now and this will be his fourth loan. He has paid all his previous loans well and on time.  This year he wants to buy more farm produce from other farmers which he will add with the produce from his farm and sell in bulk.  This will increase his income.

He plans to start selling clothes in future, which according to him is more profitable.

loans.use: To buy more bags of carrots, potatoes and maize for sale

loans.name: Teresia Wangui

texts.en:
Teresia is 32 years old and is married and the mother of three children. Her husband, John, is a farmer.

Teresia sells charcoal and sawdust as her primary business and she has been doing this for six years now. She operates her business just next to her home compound and her customers are mainly her neighbors in the shopping center who buy charcoal for domestic use as fuel. She also sells to hotels within the center.

Teresia was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan. She doesn’t have a previous credit history. She plans to buy charcoal with Ksh 20,000 and sawdust with Ksh 10,000.

Teresia hopes to better the living standards of her family. She considers herself as a very hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and sawdust

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old, married and the mother of five children. She sells her farm produce to locals who buy and sell in the retail market. This is her primary business and she has been doing it for 20 years. Her husband, Patrick, is a farmer.

Nancy was introduced to KADET by an existing member. This is her first loan with KADET though she has borrowed from her farmers’ society.  She plans to rent some land for farming so that she can get extra income for the upkeep of her family. Her current land is one acre and she wants to get more for a period of at least two years.

Nancy considers herself a very hardworking person and she believes this new investment will increase her income stability in future.

loans.use: To rent some more land to plant tea, kale, spinach and maize

loans.name: Comic

texts.en:
Comic M. is 32 years old and is married to Bernard Wasike who is 39 years and an employee of Kabarnet Museum. She lives in Kabarnet town with her family and she has two children: Joy (7 yrs: Class 2) and Peace (2 yrs).

Comic runs a retail shop and she started this business eight years ago. She earns a monthly profit of Ksh 6,000 and has an additional income of Ksh 5,000 from other sources. Her business is situated in Kabarnet Town and most of her clients are residents of the town.

Comic was introduced to KADET by existing KADET clients and, apart from KADET, she has also taken a loan from another micro-finance institution in Kenya.

Comic has obtained a loan of Ksh 40,000 from KADET of which she will use Ksh 20,000 to purchase stock for her retail shop, Ksh 10,000 to purchase maize to sell, and Ksh 10,000 to pay rent for her shop. If this loan boosts her business, Comic will use the money to expand her business from retail to wholesale.

Comic hopes and dreams that one day she will be able to purchase a plot and develop rental units on it. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store, maize to sell and to pay store rent

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is a committed micro-business entrepreneur and is married with three children. His firstborn is in third grade of secondary school and the last-born is 9 months old.

George runs a clothing business at Migosi Estate in Kisumu City where he stocks clothes for all genders. His clientele are mainly from the nearby settlements. He has been in this business for the last nine years while his wife, Leah, runs a grocery in the same estate.

George is a very enterprising man with a wide experience working as a vendor and is full of business ideas. He believes in client-friendly services and has always put this as a priority in his business.

This is George’s first loan from KADET. He hopes to use the money from the loan to purchase more clothes for sale and also to help his wife accumulate a good stock of groceries. Therefore, George is optimistic that he will get Kiva lenders to enable him to achieve his business targets.

George harbors a dream of scaling the heights in his business and to ultimately open a big clothes stall in the city centre. There, he believes he can get more clients than his current business location. He also plans to assist his wife in her grocery business. Together, they have a dream of becoming prime suppliers of fruits and vegetables in the city.

George also aspires to seeing his children get a good education because he feels that this is the best gift he can give them.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell and more groceries for his wife's business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo comarca el guasaule la señora Juana H. se dedica a actividades agropecuarias las que desarrolla junto a su esposo ya que ella no tiene ningún hijo, los principales rubros que desarrolla son la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino y aviar, y establece ciertos cultivos como maíz y sorgo con los que asegura su mantención y de sus animales para el verano, también desarrolla ciertas actividades comerciales como la venta de carne de cerdos y nacatamales con que obtiene ingresos para su mantención familiar, la señora Juana H. ha tenido tres créditos con los que ha comprado parte del ganado que ahora ella tiene sin embargo ella espera seguir aumentando este rubro productivo pues según ella esto a mejoardo su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Guasaule region, Sra. Juana Hernandez makes a living farming, a business that she was able to build shoulder to shoulder with her husband because she doesn't have children. She raises livestock: cattle, pigs and chickens. She also cultivates crops such as maize and sorghum, a source of income for maintaining both herself and her animals. She earns extra money by selling pork and nacatamales (a local dish), money that goes to supporting the family. Juana has used three past loans to buy some of the cattle that she now owns. She hopes to continue developing this line of business because, she assures us, it has improved her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and supplies for livestock business.

loans.name: Norvin Antonio

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca las mesitas sector casa banca, el señor Norvin Antonio C., ha dedicado su mayoría de edad al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias, las que le proveen los ingresos necesarios para el sostén familiar ya el tiene su pequeño hijo y esposa, dentro de las actividades productivas principales del señor Norvin C. se destaca la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino y aviar, también establece cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que le aseguran una parte de sus ingresos y parte de sus alimentación, el señor Norvin C. realiza sus actividades de 6 a 2 de la tarde todos los días de sus vida, ha tenido tres créditos los que ha invertido en la compra de ganado ya que no tenia nada al momento de iniciarse en los créditos, actualmente cuenta con 6 semovientes los que quiere seguir aumentando ya que le han provisto mejores ingresos a largo plazo.
texts.en:
In the Las Mesitas area of Somotillo, Sr. Norvin Antonio C. has spent most of his life farming, work that provides him with the income he needs to support his wife and young son. The main source of Norvin's income is the rearing of cattle, pigs and chickens. He also grows maize, sesame and sorghum, crops that are a source of both the family's income and their diet. Norvin has worked from 6:00 in the morning to 2:00 in the afternoon every day of his life. He has used three past loans to buy cattle, indeed all of the cattle that he owns since he had none before. Now he has 6 head of cattle and he wants to continue adding to the number because he believes it will increase his income in the long-term.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock for livestock business.

loans.name: Dorca Elena

texts.es: En el municipio de san Pedro del norte, la señora Dorca Elena G., se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y ganado bobino así como también a actividades comerciales como la venta de comida y bebidas las que desarrolla en una jornada laboral de 10 horas las que realiza con su hermana y mama quienes le colaboran con el negocio, la señora Dorca Elena G. provee de alimentos y lo necesario a sus dos hijos de 4 y 5 años cada uno y su esposo quien le envía remesas de un país vecino provee lo necesario para el pago cumplido de sus cuotas, por tal razón ella solicito este crédito para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción dentro de los que se incluyen bloques, hierro, alambre de amarre, zinc etc entre otros con los que pretende terminar de construir su casa, con la que espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ofrecerles un techo a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
In San Pedro del Norte, Sra. Dorca Elena G. makes a living farming and raising cattle. She also earns extra money selling food and drinks, a business that she developed, working 10 hours a day, with her sister and mother. Dorca Elena supports her two children, 4 and 5 years old. Her husband, who works as a driver in a neighboring country, pays the installments [on a property of some kind?]. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy construction materials--cement blocks, iron bar, wire ties, roofing, etc.--so that she can finish building her house. She hopes the house will improve her living conditions and provide her young children with a roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for house construction.

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
LUZ D. SAN ANTONIO
Los doce integrantes D. esta alcancía comunal son personas muy emprendedoras y responsables esto lo han ido demostrando durante los IX ciclos que están trabajando con EDAPROSPO, darles lo mejor a los suyos es su objetivo primordial entre otros. Esforzarse cada día en sus negocios para alcanzar sus metas, tal tenemos a continuación la historia D. Nancy.
Nancy a la edad D. 31 años es madre D. tres hijos, y con un esposo que le brinda todo su apoyo, comenzó en el mundo del negocio desD. muy joven vendía tripitas D. forma ambulatoria y preparaba comida para algunos choferes D. motocar, fue por medio D. estos choferes que se informó del negocio D. los motocar que era rentable; decidió entonces en obtener una motocar con los ingresos D. sus ventas y el sueldo D. su esposo que pudo ahorrar y D. esta forma alquilarlo, y cuando vio que este negocio era rentable decidió comprar una motocar más llegando obtener dos más mas tarD.. 
Cuando se vio con la necesidad D. un préstamo inmediato no sabía entonces a donD. recurrir y fue por medio D. una vecina que se enteró los beneficios que brinda EDAPROSPO. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en el mantenimiento y funcionamiento D. sus motocars, gracias al préstamo D. EDAPROSPO le apoyó mucho y fue D. gran utilidad su ingreso fue mejorando; pero al transcurrir el tiempo y sentir la competencia D. este negocio optó por vender sus motos para D. esa forma invertir en un negocio nuevo el D. alquiler D. habitaciones en su domicilio. En la actualidad cuenta con un motocar que lo obtuvo D. la venta D. sus anteriores motocar que fue vendiendo D. a poco con un año D. funcionamiento. El próximo préstamo que le brindará EDAPROSPO piensa invertirlo en la construcción D. su casa para brindarles comodidad a las personas que deseen alquilar habitación. Los planes que tiene en mente es que tengo una buena comodidad en su casa para brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean buenos profesionales y que aún siendo planes para un futuro está segura que lo logrará.
texts.en:
Luz D. San Antonio The 12 members of this communal bank are very enterprising and responsible. They have demonstrated this during the nine cycles in which they have worked with Edaprospo. Their prime objective, among others, is to give their loved ones the best. They put forth great effort everyday in their businesses in order to reach their goal. What follows is Nancy’s story. Nancy is 31, and she has three children. With a husband who gives her all of his support, she started in the world of business. Since she was very young she has sold tripe as a traveling vendor and prepared food for some of the “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicles) drivers. It was through these drivers that she found out that the motocarro business was profitable. She then decided to get a motocarro with the income from her sales and what she could save from her husband’s salary. That way they rented one. When she saw that this business was profitable, she decided to buy another motocarro. She later came to have two more. When she saw the need for an immediate loan, she did not know where to go. It was through a neighbor that she found out about the benefits that Edaprospo offers. She used her first loan for the maintenance and operation of her motocarros. Thanks to the loan with Edaprospo, her income was improving. It was a big help and of great use. But, as time passed she felt the competition in this business. She decided to sell her motocarros and invest in a new business, renting rooms in her house. She currently has one motocarro that she got by selling her previous motocarros after about one year of use. She plans on using her next loan from Edaprospo on the construction of her house in order to make the people who want to rent a room more comfortable. What she has in mind is having a comfortable house to give her family a better quality of life. She also wants to give her children a good education so that they will become good professionals. These are plans for the future, and she is sure she will accomplish them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rooms

loans.name: Suneetha

texts.en:
Suneetha R. is a 39-year-old woman who is married and living with her husband and one child in the town of Dickwella in the Matara district of southern Sri Lanka.

Suneetha runs a paper bag business independently, while her husband is in the fishing business. She started this venture two years ago, and has since seen success. She works very hard and also attributes her success to being a very honest woman.

With this loan of 40,000 LKR, Suneetha hopes to buy more paper bags to sell to her customers. As the only paper bag provider in her particular location, she has established a solid base of customers and hopes to expand even further in the future.

loans.use: To buy more paper bags to sell

loans.name: Wasantha

texts.en:
Wasantha is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children in the town of Dickwella in the Matara district of Sri Lanka.

Wasantha is in the food production business, making small treats and food products to be sold to local markets. Her husband is a day laborer, and her daughters work in a supermarket and making sweetmeats.

This is the second loan for Wasantha from BRAC; with her first loan she started this business. Now she is requesting 40,000 LKR to help further expand her business.

Wasantha has seen success because there is very low competition in the area. She also considers herself to be honest and hard-working, to which she attributes her success as well.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ruchika

texts.en:
Ruchika is a 27-year-old woman living with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 5, in the town of Dickwella, in southern Sri Lanka.

Ruchika has a coir-making business that she runs independently, while her husband has his own fishing business. She has been in the coir making business for three years, which consists of extracting the fibers of a coconut to be woven together into different forms of rope or yarn, which can then be woven together to make products such as floor mats.

Ruchika is a hard-working woman who is very knowledgeable about her business. She is asking for a 30,000 LKR loan in order to purchase more raw materials in order to extract the coir. Eventually, in the future, she hopes to purchase a new coir machine with her profits.

For now, Ruchika hopes to expand and develop her business further as there is low competition in the area and she sees room for expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Abigaël Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernadette M. is the director of the group “Abigaël Plus” made up of thirty-nine members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Bernadette’s main business is selling clothes and pairs of shoes in a market to the west of Kinshasa. Since 1990 she has acquired solid experience in her area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a clothes shop.

Bernadette would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $160 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals.

Bernadette is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying clothes and pairs of shoes and reselling them at a profit.

45 years old, Bernadette is married and has five children whose ages vary between 5 and 15 years old. All of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cloche Plus Group

texts.en:
Mike T. is the leader of the Community Bank named “Cloche Plus” which means “Bell” in English. It is composed of twenty-seven members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mike has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2006. He runs a general store to the north of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his location.

Mike would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him $280 per month. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals.

Mike is a trustworthy client of the MFI (micro-finance institute) HOPE DRC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit.

34 years old, Mike is married and the father of four children.

loans.use: To increase his store’s stock by buying cans, sacks of rice and sugar and milk

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.en:
Serge K. is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Bien Fait Plus” (which means “Well Done” in English) composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Serge, 40, became a micro-entrepreneur in 2007. He manages his own general store in the southwest of Kinshasa. He works hard, using his good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business brings in $150 per month. Serge is a trustworthy client of MFI HOPE RDC, having two times received and correctly repaid loans. With his next loan, he will increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing soaps, cans, sacks of beans, sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Serge is married and the father of four children, three of whom attend school.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 50 years of age. Her husband died of senility many years ago. She has earnest financial partners in her two daughters, who help support the family by working in a garment factory. In order to generate a daily income, Mrs. C. sells chickens that she buys from her wholesale supplier, earning about $3 each day. Recently, Mrs. C. received many orders from her customers who need a lot of chickens for their ceremony parties. Mrs. C. does not have an adequate supply of chickens for her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more chickens, in order to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Mrs. Bin C. is a 47-year-old cake seller. She usually makes the cakes at home and then walks around her community to sell them, generating approximately $5 per day. Bin C. has another income earner in her husband, who drives a motorcycle taxi. The couple has a child who goes to school. Recently Bin C.’s husband has hardly been able to find new clients since his old taxi is unattractive. Therefore, Bin C. has requested a loan which would enable her husband to replace his old motor.

loans.use: To replace an old motor

loans.name: Leak

texts.en: Mrs. Leak P. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Chruoy Pisei village, in Kandal province. She is a corn farmer and also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sary Srei, is a goldsmith, a business from which he can receive a small salary to support his family. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Leak P. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and the rest of the loan will be used to support her farming crops. This couple has two children, one of whom is a student in the local school while the youngest one is only 4 years old. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and the rest of the loan she would use to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Sam Ang's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Ang C. is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Pred Ta Keo village, in Kandal province. She is the leader of a group loan, consisting of 4 people offered by AMK. The members of this loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items for different businesses.  Mrs. Sam Ang C. makes snacks for consuming with alcoholic beverages. Her husband, Mr. Rattana Yun, is a chef. In this business they now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their business. Thus, Mrs. Sam Ang C. is requesting for 200,000 Riels to buy extra food for her snacks business. Mrs. Sam Ang C. is a mother of two children who all are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy extra food for snack business.

loans.name: Nouern's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Nouern is the leader of this group loan which consists of eight people located in Prachum Ank village in Kandal province. The members of this loan hope to increase their incomes to improve their family living conditions.

Mrs. P. Nouern and her husband are vegetable sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family living. Since this business is going well, Mrs. P. Nouern wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables to enlarge her business.

This couple has four children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Moth

texts.en:
Mrs. E. is a 49-year-old fish merchant. She leaves home in the early morning to where fish are sold in bulk and she buys fish from her suppliers. She then brings the fish back to sell in her village for a profit. She has been operating this business for five years and earns $5 a day.

E. is married with eight children, seven of whom are married and have already started new homes, and the other one is single. Her husband earns his daily money by driving a taxi.

E. will use her first loan to enlarge her fish-selling enterprise and to repair her husband’s taxi that often has broken down.

loans.use: To enlarge her fish-selling enterprise and to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Despite the burden she is carrying upon her shoulders, being a single parent and a sickly woman, 59-year-old Lorna U. remains strong and determined to reach the dream she wishes to attain for her three children and one grandchild.

Lorna’s eldest, 22 year-old, son got married at an early age and without reaching a higher level of education. She thought that maybe this is because he realized how hard his mother worked just to earn money for their needs. He goes fishing to have his own income for the needs of his own family.

Being a mother and a grandparent, Lorna cannot seem to ignore the feeling of guilt when she sees her son and his family suffer from shortage of food and other basic needs.

When Lorna joined ASHI, the loan she requested was used to support her son’s fishing business. She sells the fish caught by her son by going house to house to the people in town, particularly in the neighboring village. The profits of this business are shared with her son and his family. This provides their cash flow and provides them with their basic needs.

The income, however, is just too small to support their need to improve their standard of living. Thus, Lorna is now requesting a much larger loan to put up her own businesses which are a variety store and hog/pig fattening. With an inventory in her store of items most needed by people like rice, charcoal (used to cook food), soap, and beverages, she will gain more customers from around the village.

The hogs she fattens can be slaughtered after four months and the meat sold in her store. If not, the pig can also be sold live to a meat vendor in the market.

Lorna is hoping that her envisioned businesses will help her in supporting the financial needs of her two children so that they are able to graduate from college. By then, she thinks their lives would be changed and she will have her dreams fulfilled.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her variety store, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok I. is 60 years old and the leader of this group loan, which includes eight other members, all located in Kork Romiet village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For her portion of this loan from AMK, she is requestI. a loan of 800,000 Riels for her farm. She hopes to purchase a water machine to support her crops' growth, and to hire someone to fill the land. Aside from farmI., she also sells vegetables, and can earn a small amount of money to support the family. Mrs. Sok I. is a widow with two children, one of whom works as a seamstress in the garment factory while the other attends the local school.

loans.use: Water machine for crops, hire someone to fill the land

loans.name: Malang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Malang M. is a villager who lives in Boeng Krom Kraom village in Kandal province. She is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by AMK. With this loan, the members will use it to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support each of their own different purposes.
Mrs. Yalang M. and her husband, Mr. Yornn By, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice, but their farm struggles because they do not have enough money to support their crops. Thus, Mrs. Malang M. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides and gasoline to help tend her farm. Mrs. Malang M. is 25 years old and the mother of two children, who both are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Mr. Sorn Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan extends to seventeen people who are villagers in Krarng Roluos village in Kandal province. The group members will use their portion of the loan for many different purposes, and they have selected Mr. Sorn S., a village bank president, as the group leader for the loan. 
  
Mr. Sorn S. and his wife, Mrs. Sor Oriem, are farmers who own 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family. In the rice field, they have some problems because the field has infertile soil and is far from irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mr. Sorn S. is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline. Through their farming, the couple supports five children, four of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the fifth helps the parents with the farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kheng C. is a villager who lives in Trapeang Chrey village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Oeun Long, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. They face a problem because the field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Kheng C. is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Riels to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide to support her crops. Mrs. Kheng C. is 50 years old and a mother of four children. One of her children sells clothes, two attend the local school and the youngest one is five years old. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Sreimoa

texts.en: Mrs. Sreimoa K. is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Theng Sorn, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Right now, their soil is infertile and they do not have enough money to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Sreimoa K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her crops. Mrs. Sreimoa K. is a mother of four children, one of whom is a farm laborer and the other three are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Mrs. Pol A. is a 50-year-old merchandise trader. She has a store in the market where she stores many sets of grocery inventory to sell. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods and canned goods. Almost of her clients are middlemen who buy her products to retail in their village. Pol A. is married to Touch Bori, age 50, who assists her in the business. The family has three school-aged kids who are dependent on their income. Pol A. wants to accumulate a larger amount of inventory but she has no capital to make that possible. So, she decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. She will buy different types of plastic goods and cooking ingredients for her store. (Mrs. Pol A. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy different types of plastic goods and cooking ingredients for her store.

loans.name: Thileung

texts.en: Mrs. Thileung B. is 32 years old and a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. She and her husband are fishermen who can earn a small income to support their family. With this business, they do not have enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Thileung B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets for fishing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. This couple has two children who attend the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Kov

texts.en: Mr. Kov K. is 52 years old and a villager who lives in Kor village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Vy Sam, is a grocery seller who owns a store. With this business, he can earn a small income to support the family. Since his wife's business is going well he wants to enlarge it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries (white sugar, garlic, peppers, and so on) to expand his wife's business.  This couple has three children, one of whom is a scrap seller while the other two are dessert sellers and support their mother's business. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Auntouch Koy Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people who live in Boeng Khpob village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Auntouch K. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan to buy something that can expand their businesses. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Chhorn, is a fisherman. They have some problems because their farm is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Auntouch K. decided ask for a loan to buy a water machine and taro root to grow. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and taro root

loans.name: Soart

texts.en: Mrs. Soart O. is 68 years old. She is a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a grocery seller who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. Mrs. Soart O. is a widow with a child who is a farm laborer and who supports his mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. S., age 37, is a modest villager who has been living in Phnom Penh for years. Presently she owns a few rooms that she rents to garment workers for a fee. In addition, her husband works as an internal staff member for an embassy. The family takes care of three children who are attending the public local school. S. wants to buy a small farm but does not have enough money saved. S. decided to ask for a loan, which will enable her to afford to purchase the land. She will rent the new land to farmers for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy a small farm

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Y. is 56 years old and she is a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a Khmer cake seller, where she can earn a small income to support her family.  She tries to work hard with her business but she still does not earn enough income to support her family. Thus, she is now requesting a loan of USD 400 from AMK to buy rice to sell. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. Mrs. Sam Y. is a widow with two children who are farm laborers and support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Mrs. Khon Chum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people make up this village bank loan. They are villagers in Boeng Khpob village. Mrs. Khon C. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Besides this, she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Chhou Hieng Sorn, is a construction worker. They have some problems because they have some piglets that are too small to sell. Thus, Mrs. Khon C. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and rest of the loan she would like to buy gasoline and fertilizer for farming. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is an iron welder, and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Mak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang M. Village Bank Group is made up of 10 members, who live in Heang Kong village in Kandal province. Together, they are seeking a village bank loan. They will each use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Neang M. has been selected as the village bank president by its members. She and her husband, Mr. Ping S., are farmers. They own a plot of land where they cultivate rice to support their family. Although they work hard, they are only able to produce a little rice, because the soil is infertile and their field far from the irrigation system. Therefore, Mrs. Neang M. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for farming.

Mrs. Neang M. is the mother of six children. One of her children is a mirror cutter; two are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Claridel's Group

texts.en:
Claridel L. is from the village of Lucban, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Claridel is the leader of a nine-member group requesting a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Claridel is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products to the local community. She has done this for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Claridel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claridel has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Claridel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya R. A. is 30 years old. To earn a living, she buys chicken in bulk at a reasonable price and then slaughters and sells the birds. She hA. a solid  financial partner in her husband, who is a military policeman. Ya R. A. hA. two school-aged children who are dependent on her income. For a long time, Ya R. A. hired a taxi to deliver her chicken to market. She is requesting a loan to purchase a used car so she can supply the transportation in her business and also reduce her costs. Any remaining money from the loan will buy more chicken for her customers. (Ya R. A. wA. not available for taking a photo so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a used car to transport chicken to market

loans.name: Mrs. Sum Loav Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Pou village in Kandal province, 12 people are requesting a village bank loan. Mrs. Sum L. has been selected as the leader for this loan.  All of the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sum L. is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Oruol S., is a fisherman. They have had some problems with their rice field because it is located on infertile soil, far from an irrigation system. Mrs. Sum L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel for her farm. This couple has five children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the others are too young for school or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel to do farming

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette B. is from the village of San Isidro Talakag Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Jeanette is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeanette makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Jeanette has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jeanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 45-year-old married woman. She has a life partner in her husband who is a disabled person from the civil war. She is a Khmer professional teacher in the public high school located in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. S. relies on other income from her two single daughters: one is an employee in a casino and one has a cloth sale shop. She also has a child who is married and lives away from home. S. finds it hard traveling to the school or anywhere else because she has no vehicle. She is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike and the rest of loan will be used for her daughter’s cloth sale business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Expedita is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Expedita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Expedita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her store. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Being a member of Kiva's first field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, Estrella L. had been receiving loans since 1996. Loans she received then have enabled her to have several businesses managed by her husband, her children and herself. Fishing gear she purchased for her husband’s fishing business has increased the volume of fish she sells, while the motorcycle she bought for a transportation business has been one of her son’s regular means of income. 

Estrella’s four children have not gone to college. They all live with her because they don’t have their own families for now. Her eldest is 4o years old and is working as a part time construction worker, the same as her 30-year-old son. Her youngest and only girl works as a domestic helper in Manila.

Despite being poor and frustrated because of her failure to graduate her children from college, Estrella is still determined to provide them with a better kind of life through the loans she can access through ASHI and Kiva. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase another motorcycle to be managed by one of her sons. Through this loan, his income will be regularized to support his own needs. Estrella also wishes to purchase more fishing gear for her husband so that they can increase their profits and will be able to purchase appliances for their small house. This is because she wants her children to experience a more comfortable kind of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and fishing gear.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Mr. Ka S. is a machinery repairman in the garment factory and he gets a specific salary of $120 a month. By doing this, he is able to cover all the needs of his family. He now has five teenage children who are no longer in school. They are working at different occupations and provide their little incomes to solve the financial crisis of their family. Ka S. has a life partner in his wife who sells a few groceries in front of their home. The family's living conditions are not comfortable since some parts of their house came to decay. To resolve the problem, Ka S. would like a loan in order to replace the broken parts of his house.

loans.use: To replace the broken parts of his house.

loans.name: Mrs. Shunri En Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The seventeE. people who make up this village bank loan live in Prek Doung village in Kandal province. Mrs. Shunri E. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. Each of them will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Shunri E. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell for supporting her family. Aside from this she is also a government worker.  Through these activities, she supports two childrE. who attend the local school. She is a widow. She has a problem because whE. it was time for farming she didn't have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Shunri E. decided to seek a loan to start a late crop this year.

loans.use: To start a late crop this year

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia L. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old. Alicia is a widow and has three adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp and sometimes dried fish, in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Germilina

texts.en:
Germilina P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 41 years old. Germilina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Germilina owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Germilina has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $158 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Germilina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Germilina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Germilina is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield and to buy fertilizers as well. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people are villagers in Prek Doung village in Kandal province, and they make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Navy E. is the village bank president who was selected by all the members. Each of them will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns more than one-hectare of land to grow rice and vegetables for selling to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phorlla Sim, is a construction worker. Their rice field is ready for farming, so Mrs. Navy E. decided to ask for a loan to do a second planting this year. She is the mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To do a second planting this year

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Math A. is a widowed mother of fifty-three years who is blessed with four children: two are single and two are married and live separately. Math A. is currently buying and selling used goods to earn a living. One of her single children is assisting her in the business operation. Math A. uses a trailer that often breaks down to serve as her business transportation. She proposes to use her loan money to purchase a new trailer to replace the broken one. This will allow her to transport more used goods more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of Baybay, Liloy. She is 46 years old. Virginia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase land to raise additional livestock. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC.
