She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Mrs. Pacita G., from the village of Upper Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental, is 58 years old, married and blessed with four adult-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of grocery items in the local community. Engaged in her business for more than five years, she earns a monthly net income of 3,000.00.

In 2001, Pacita joined PMPC to access its programs and services. She is now requesting her 14th loan in the amount of 12,000.00 which will be used as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong C., a 33-year-old single man, works as a security guard in a small firm. He currently resides with his mother and two siblings who work at a variety of jobs. His mother (appearing in the picture above) owns a few rooms that she rents out to garment workers for a monthly fee. In the past, Kong has always paid a great deal of money to take taxis to work because he doesn’t own a vehicle, so he is now requesting a loan of $600 to buy an old motorcycle for commuting to his workplace. The loan will help him to reduce his traveling expenses.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle for commuting to his workplace.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Bich T. D., a 34-year-old farmer, lives with her husband and child in Dai bi village, where she grows vegetables to sell in the market and breeds pigs.  She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND and loves participating in Seda because she can save money. She has taken part in Seda for 5 years now, always repaying her loans on time. This time, she is requesting a loan 6.758.000 VND (375 USD) for her  business.

loans.use: Capital for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. She and her family live in Vehari, Pakistan. 

Nasreen’s customer base is 80% from the community and 20% outside of the community. Her business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. Once a month she travels to the neighboring city to purchase new clothes to sell. Her business helps to meet the financial expenses. She also has a sewing machine which she uses to earn additional profit.
 
Today Nasreen has requsted a loan of Pak Rs. 15000 to purchase new clothing.

Nasreen is also the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shamim baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Another lady named Shamim baji wants  a loan to buy a sewing machine for her  clothes-sewing business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun S., 38 and his wife, Mrs. Botum Um, 29, (pictured together) have been married since 2000 and just have a young son who attends school. Besides his son, Savoeun also has his elderly mother living with him. They live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The couple has two lines of business: (1) raising pigs and (2) producing rice wine. Savoeun hopes to expand his business to make it bigger so that he will be able to generate more income as well. So, he is asking for his first loan of $300 to purchase rice to produce more rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase rice to produce more rice wine

loans.name: Sharifhocha

texts.ru: Зоиров Шарифхоча проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шарифхоча имеет высшее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У него торговая точка на рынке "Саховат". Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. До этого преподавал в школе. Шарифхоча хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большую прибыль. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sharifhocha Z. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 50 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Sharifhocha has a higher education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years and has a retail outlet at the "Sahovat" market. He primarily sells food products. Previously, he was a school teacher. Sharifhocha wants to expand his business and make a large profit. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua T. N. ( id: 010117090057) is 50 years old. She is an active woman and a group leader. She lives with her husband and two children in Dai Bi village. One of her children is married. Her husband is a builder and usually works in the village.

Every day, Lua T. N. gets up early in the morning to go to the market where she sells pork. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

Lua T. N. has taken part in SEDA for five years and has always repaid on time. This time, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng S., age 50, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Yin, age 46, (pictured together) live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of their sons has full-time employment, two daughters are garment factory workers and another one stays at home.

Cheng and his wife have been farming for twenty years. Besides farming, they also raise pigs and produce rice wine. Cheng is requesting his first loan of $250 to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar is a 38-year-old married lady. She lives in a city called Vehari, Pakistan with her family.  Her family consists of eight persons including her five daughters and one son. Her eldest daughter has completed her education up to 10th standard. Then, she decided to start a clothes-sewing business with Shamim. The other kids are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Shamim's husband's name is K. H. and he has a timber-selling business. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. She has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). From her first loan she increased her sewing business by buying her sewing machine. She took out her second loan for her husband’s timber-selling business. Now she is requesting a loan again to enhance his business by buying timber in bulk.

Shamim is also the group leader for three other women from her locality. Zubaida Khanum baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits, bread, butter) for her bakery. Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To enhance timber-selling business

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthou C. is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Liheang Nhoek, is 49 years old. Liheang has been driving a taxi for twenty years.

They have been married since 1984 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and the other two attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthou has been running a grocery store since 2003 and buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase more grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Janankan Jumaeva Group

texts.ru:
Жананкан 45 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Она вместе с мужем занимается строительными работами. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 200 долларов. За счет собственного труда они смогли построить себе дом. Кредит будет использован для закупа одной коровы, который позволит увеличить их семейный доход. 

Абидахан 44 года. Она вдова, ее супруг умер в прошлом году. У нее 5 детей. Из за смерти супруга ей пришлось на время приостановить бизнес: торговлю продуктами питания с собственного дома. Кредит будет направлен на возобновление бизнеса. 

Альфира, 48, змужем. Она мать 7 детей. Ее супруг работает трактористом, сама же занимается реализацией продуктов питания. Кредит будет использован для расширения ассортимента продукции в ларьке. 

Мелисбеку 34 года. Все 4 сына клиента учатся в школе. Он совместно с супругой арендует буфет и торгует там товарами повседневного спроса. Все 4 сына клиента учатся в школе. Кредит будет использован для увеличения ассортимента товаров. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Janankan is 45 years old. She is married and is raising four children. Her oldest son is now working in Russia. She does construction work together with her husband. Their monthly income is around $200US. They were able to build their own house by working hard. They will use the loan to buy one cow which will help to increase their family income. Abidahan is 44 years old. She is a widow, her husband died last year. She has five children. Because of her spouse's death she had to put her business on hold which is selling food products from her home. The loan will be used towards starting the business over. Alfira is 48, she is married. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband works as a tractor driver and she sells food products. She will use the loan towards expanding the variety of the merchandise in her stall. Melisbek is 34 years old. All his four sons go to school. They rent a buffet together with his wife where they sell every day necessities. The loan will be used to increase the variety of products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow, expand business and variety of merchandise

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Ny, 49, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters, all of them in school.

Thol has been a farmer for twenty years while her husband has been a wooden-house builder for ten years. She does not have a water pump to spray her farm and she wants to purchase one. So, she is asking for her first loan of $400 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Malima's Group

texts.en: Ricky M. is from the village of Matugas Bajo. He is 30 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ricky is married and has one school-aged child. He owns and operates a hog-raising business. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ricky joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey R., 48, and her husband, Mr. Kam Kem, 53, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have four daughters, two of whom assist their parents in their farming business and two are in school.

Srey and her husband are farmers; they grow many kinds of vegetables on their farmland in the village such as papaya, tomato, eggplant, wax gourd (winter melon) and so on. When the harvest season comes, they take their produce to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Srey is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to add to her own money to buy a van to carry her vegetables to market.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a van to carry her vegetables to market

loans.name: Lumombong's Group

texts.en: Ricamar L. is from the village of Culpan. He is 51 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ricamar is married and has eight adult-aged children. He owns and operates a vegetable business, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ricamar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Ricamar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Razia Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Razia maryam is 51 years old and has only had elementary level education. She and her family live in a city called Vehari, Pakistan. She has been living there for the past 29 years. Her husband's name is A. and he works in a local factory on monthly wage. Razia is a mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son works in the same place where her husband works. Her daughter runs a  clothes-sewing business. The others are enrolled in school and getting an education. 

Razia is a very hard-working lady. She makes bed sheets and sells them at markets. This is the fourth time that she is applying for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Since she become a member of Asasah, she never was late for a repayment. Today she is again requesting a loan to enhance her bed sheets business by buying the required materials such as cloth and thread.

Razia is the group leader for two other women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cotton to sell. Another lady named Parveen Ara baji wants a loan to buy wood and nails for her furniture-making business.

loans.use: To make bed sheets for sale

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. and her husband, Mr. Sarum Seng, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five sons. The couple are farmers: they grow vegetables and flowers. They depend on farming so they want to continue the business and hope their business will continue to do well. Mom has obtained one previous Kiva loan. Now, she is asking for her second loan of US$150 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her vegetable and flower farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Mrs. Marife J. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and is blessed with two school-aged children. Marife owns and operates a business selling of variety of food products in the local community and earns 2,000 PHP monthly from her business. In 2009, Marife joined PMPC to access its programs and services. She's obtaining her first loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Sovannary

texts.en: Miss Sovannary T. is single and lives with her parents on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been a silk weaver since 2002, a skill she learned from her sister. Sovannary has repaid two previous Kiva loans. She now wants to create a new business selling finished silk fabric, so she is requesting another loan of $600 to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabric to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T., is from the village of Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, is married, and has nine adult children.

Lolita owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feeds supplies of her pigs.

Lolita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds supplies of her pigs

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan T. N. (id: 010117090054) is 45 years old and lives in Dai Bi village with her husband and three children.

Luan T. N. has a business breeding pigs and poultry. She is a dynamic women. Sometime, she also does casual work in order to have more income. Her husband is a builder and her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND.

Luan T. N. has borrowed loans from SEDA for five years. This time, she wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND as additional capital for her business breeding pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business breeding pigs and poultry

loans.name: Turdiali

texts.ru: Бозоров Турдиали проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 62 года. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Клиент пенсионер. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Turdiali B. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 62 years old, married and has one child. Our client is retired. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years and breeds cattle at home. His wife helps him with this business. Turdiali primarily raises and sells livestock. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda S., 50,  is from Rizal, Santiago City. She is the leader of a 12-member group requesting a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Yolanda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling food. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over two years earning approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP — the first loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saydakul Karazakova Group

texts.ru:
Сайдакул 51 лет. Она замужем и мать 5 детей, из них, только младшая дочь проживает с ней. Остальные дети взрослые и проживают отдельно родителей. Ее супруг крестьянин, а также занимается животноводством. Семья клиента начала заниматься животноводством 4 года назад с 1 теленка. Сейчас у нее есть 4 коровы и 1 лошадь. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 теленка для последующей отправки на пастбище. 

Бужамал 45 лет, замужем. У нее 5 детей: 4 сына и одна дочь. Она совместно с супругом занимаются сельским хозяйством. В основном они выращивают рис. Этим бизнесом они занимаются уже 14 лет. Кредит будет использован для закупа сена, 500 кг удобрений и 50 лт солярки. 

Тамаре 49 лет. Она занимается сельским хозяйством: выращивает подсолнух, рис, кукурузу и овощи. Кредит запрашивается для закупа КРС и семян риса. В бизнесе ей помогает ее супруг и дети. 

Гульжан замужем. У нее 3 сына. Старший сын работает бухгалтером в банке, остальные два сына работают в Бишкеке. Она проживает вместе с мужем. Они занимаются разведением и откормом КРС. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 2 овец. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Saydakul is 51 years old. She is married and is a mother of five children of which only their daughter is living with her. All other children are grown ups and live separately. Her husband is a farmer and does animal husbandry. This family started animal husbandry four years ago with just one calf. Right now they have four cows and one horse. The loan will be use to buy one calf for grazing in the pastures. Bujamal is 45, she is married. She has five children: four sons and one daughter. They do farming together with her husband. They grow mainly rice. They have been doing this business for fourteen years. The loan will be used to buy hay, 500 kilograms of fertilizer and 50 liters of diesel. Tamara is 49. She is in farming and grows sunflowers, rice, corn and vegetables. She is asking for a loan to buy large cattle and rice seeds. Her husband and children help her in this business. Guljan is married, she has three sons. Her oldest son works as an accountant in the bank and two other sons work in Bishkek. She lives with her husband. They breed large cattle. She is asking for a loan to buy two sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one calf, two sheep, rice seeds, fertilizer and hay

loans.name: Ermatova Pati Group

texts.ru:
Пати 57 лет. Она замужем и мать 7 детей, из них, только младшие сын и дочь проживают с ней. Остальные дети взрослые и проживают отдельно от родителей. Ее супруг крестьянин, а также занимается животноводством. Сама же ППати занимается розничной торговлей товаров народного потребления в собственном магазине. Кредит будет использован для закупа товаров для магазина. 

Лайли 52 года, замужем. У нее 7 детей: 3 сына и 4  дочери. Она совместно с младшими детьми занимается сельским хозяйством. В основном они выращивают подсолнух. Этим бизнесом они занимаются уже 19 лет. Кредит будет использован для вспахивания земли и закупа 2 МРС. 

Шайыргул 33 года. Ее супруг работает строителем в селе. У нее по два сына и дочери. Все кроме кроме младшей дочери, ходят в школу. Клиент занимается выращиванием кукурузы и подсолнуха.  Кредит будет использован для закупа семян подсолнуха. 

Куттубеку 21 год. Он самый младший участник группы. Проживает вместе с матерью и братом. Он вместе с остальными членами семьи занимаются животноводством и растениеводством. Кредит будет использован для посева риса и подсолнуха.   


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Paty is 57 years old. She is married and is a mother of seven children. Only the youngest son and daughter live with her. The rest of the children are grown up and live separately. Her husband is a farmer and does animal husbandry. Paty does retail sales of every day goods in her own store. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the store. Layli is 52 years old, she is married. She has seven children: three sons and four daughters. She does farming together with her younger children. They grow mainly sunflowers and have been doing this business for nineteen years now. The loan will be used to aerate the land and to buy two small cattle. Shayirgul is 33 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker in the village. She has two sons and two daughters. Everyone besides the youngest daughter go to school. The client grows corn and sunflowers. The loan will be used to buy sunflower seeds. Kuttubek is 21 years old. He is the youngest member of this group. He lives with his mother and brother. He does animal husbandry and agriculture together with other family members. The loan will be used to sow rice and sunflowers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store, seeds, cattle

loans.name: Janeth's Group

texts.en:
Janeth M., 40, is from the village of Guibang, Gamu, Isabela. She is the group leader of a six-member group applying for a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Janeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a business making and selling food. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. Now she is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Janeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale

loans.name: Bonie

texts.en: Bonie P. is from the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Bonie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bonie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Bonie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jumabaeva Aynur Group

texts.ru:
Жумабаева Айнур вместе с остальными участниками группы солидарности проживает в г. Узген. Группа получает кредит в этом составе во второй раз. 

Айнур замужем, проживает вместе со своей семьей в собственном доме. У нее 4 детей. Супруг занимается строительными работами, он также активно участвует в семейном бизнесе. Они занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культур. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 50 лт солярки, 50 кг сена и на вспахивание земли. 

Ойбарчину 35 лет. Она разведена и воспитывает двоих детей. Она совместно с старшим сыном занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, а именно риса. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян риса и вспахивания земли. 

Назира, 34, вдова. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и одна дочь. Все сыновья учатся в школе. Она также выращивает рис и подсолнух. Кредит запрашивается для весенних посевных работ. 

Бегай 51 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг работает наркологом. У нее 2 детей. Она занимается животноводством. У нее имеются 1 корова, 2 теленка, полученное молоко она реализует на местном рынке. Кредит запрашивается   для закупа КРС. 

Саламат 76 лет. Она вдова и мать одного сына. Она занимается откормом и разведением КРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 5 овец для дальнейшего откорма. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aynur J., along with the other participants of this solidarity group, lives in the town of Uzgen. This is the second loan for this group. Aynur is married and lives with her family in their own house. She has 4 children. Her husband is a construction worker and also actively participates in the family business. They are involved in growing agricultural crops. The loan will be used for the purchase of 50 liters of fuel, 50 kilograms of hay and for plowing the land. Oybarchin is 35 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children. Together with her oldest son, she is involved in growing agricultural crops, specifically rice. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of rice seeds and plowing the land. Nazira is 34 years old and a widow. She has 4 children: 3 sons and one daughter. All of the sons go to school. She also grows rice and sunflower. Nazira is requesting the loan for the spring sowing work. Bagay is 51 years old. She is married, and her husband works as a narcologist. She has 2 children. Bagay is involved in animal husbandry. She has 1 cow and 2 calves. She also sells milk at the local market. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Salamat is 76 years old. She is a widow and a mother of one son. She is involved in feeding and breeding cattle. The loan will be used for the purchase of 5 sheep for further feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Land plowing

loans.name: Mehanbidi

texts.ru: Адинаев Механбиди проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает в России. Сам Механбиди занимается живоноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит скот. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mehanbidi A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Their son works in Russia. Mehanbidi is involved in animal husbandry and has a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. He has over 20 years of experience in this field. Mehanbidi is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Aynagul Baychuraeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Айнагуль 45 лет, она замужем. Ее супруг и старшая дочь находятся в России на заработках. С ней проживает младшие 2 сына, которые помогают ей в бизнесе. Она занимается откормом домашнего скота. У нее имеются 2 коровы и 2 барана. Кредит запрашивается для ремонта дома. 

Айгуль 43 года. Ее супруг также находится в России, работает водителем в Тюмене. Она воспитывает одну дочь.  Она занимается животноводством. У нее есть 3 голов КРС и 20 голов МРС. Кредит запрашивается для закупа баранов для последующей откорма. 

Назгул 32 года, замужем. У нее трое детей. Супруг работает сварщиком в Тюмене. Дома у нее имеется маленькое хозяйство, где она откармливает живность. Кредит будет использован для весенней посевной, а именно она собирается посеять рис. 

Тургун, 48, замужем.  Супруг занимается частным извозом, а также работает строителем. У нее 3 детей: 2 дочери и один сын. Дочь и сын находятся на заработках в России, а младшая дочь учится в школе. Клиент занимается торговлей продуктов питания с собственного магазина. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 2 МРС. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aynagul is 45 years old. She is married. Her husband and oldest daughter are in Russia for work. Aynagul’s youngest 2 sons, who help her with the business, live with her. She is involved in raising domestic livestock. She has 2 cows and 2 sheep. Aynagul is requesting the loan to repair her house. Aygul is 43 years old. Her husband is also in Russia, working as a driver in Tyumen. She is raising one daughter. Aygul is involved in animal husbandry. She has 3 heads of cattle and 20 heads of small livestock. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sheep to be fattened up. Nazgul is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a welder in Tyumen. She has small household at home, where she fattens up livestock. The loan will be used for the spring sowing season, specifically to plant rice. Turgun is 48 years old and married. Her husband works as private driver and also as a construction worker. Turgun has 3 children: 2 daughters and one son. One daughter and son work in Russia, and the youngest daughter goes to school. The client is involved in sales of food products at her own store. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of 2 small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Vivian Jepkogei

texts.en:
Vivian is a single mother of two lovely children. She is a farmer who plants maize both for her family consumption and for selling. She has been in her farming business for six years now and most of her customers come from where she lives. She also sells milk to one of the biggest milk distributers in Kenya called Kenya Cooperative Creameries (KCC).

Vivian was introduced to KADET through an existing group. She has applied for a loan which she is planning to use for farming like buying seeds for planting and manure and other fertilizer.

Vivian's goal is to continue with her farming business to a higher level, educate her children to higher learning institutions and most importantly to buy land in Eldoret and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy Jepkorir

texts.en:
Nancy is a 29-year-old woman who is married to Albert Kibet and they are blessed with two children.

Nancy farms in Eldoret and has been farming for the last six years. Besides farming she sells vegetables and milk to her neighbors. She also supplies milk to one of the biggest suppliers of milk in Kenya called the new KCC (Kenya Cooperative Creameries).

Nancy was introduced to KADET by an employee of KADET and she has applied for a loan which she will use for her farming activities. This includes paying for the hire of a tractor which helps her to plow faster and also to buy maize seedlings for planting. 

Nancy’s goal is to become a popular and prosperous farmer in Eldoret.

loans.use: To hire a tractor to plow and to buy seedlings to plant

loans.name: Nosir

texts.ru: Гулиев Носир проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 26 лет. Холост. У него среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Имеет небольшой коровник. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Именно сейчас клиенту выгодна покупка скота, так как в это время года животные продаются по низким ценам.
texts.en:
Nosir G. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 26 years old and single. He has a secondary education. Nosir earns a living by breeding cattle. He has a small cowshed. He buys young bulls, raises and re-sells them at the market. Nosir has been involved in this business for 5 years now. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock. It is especially profitable to buy livestock now because livestock is being sold at low prices this time of year.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sokros

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokros C., 29, has been married since 2002 and has two young sons. She lives with her sisters and brothers and widowed mother on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokros has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

Sokros is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Before becoming a member of ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines, Margie S.’s life was full of challenges. She and her family were very poor and she worked hard to help her fisherman husband earn money for the cash flow of her family and to be able to support the education of her children until they graduated from college.

When she became a member of ASHI seven years ago, loans Margie requested and received were spent on a business. Several businesses her loans have been financing include her husband’s fishing, and tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire businesses. She was able to purchase a fishing motorboat and also a tricycle which he operates once the fishing is off-season. He also sometimes uses the vehicle as a service for selling fish to the people in their village.

Margie was able to have her own business to manage as well, as she was able to purchase piglets for fattening. All these businesses still exist. As a matter of fact, her hog-fattening business has already grown and she has been able to sell more pigs to a lot of meat vendors.

Despite the time required to manage her businesses, since she is also helping her husband in selling the fish, she makes sure that she is also able to spend time with her children. She wants her productive and reproductive roles played fairly.

Margie’s children are inspired by the effort they see from their mother. They studied very hard to graduate from college to make their mother happy. Expenses for their education came from their mother’s educational loan from ASHI.

Even though Margie has been facing several failures and problems in life, she is still happy because she was able to achieve her dream of graduating her five children from college. Now, four of them have their own jobs and source of income.

However, Margie still aims to grow her fishing business. Her son, who is unemployed, will be operating another fishing boat she plans to purchase using the loan she is requesting from Kiva this time.

The proceeds of her businesses will be used to improve their house as well as making their life different from the one they once had.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat for her son to use

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa V., from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin Province, is 41 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a specialized retail business selling personal jewelry including necklaces, bracelets, and earrings in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years, earning about 2,500 monthly.

In 2009, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be Marissa's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. texts.ru: Тавбаев Бобомурод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Этим бизнесом занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Bobomurod T. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives together with his parents. Bobomurod is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle to re-sell it for meat. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Also, the development of this sphere provides markets with fresh meat. Bobomurod has been in this business for 8 years now. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Esther Chepkorir

texts.en:
Esther is a fifty (50) year old woman, married to Patrick M. and they are blessed with four beautiful children. They live in Kipkaren in Eldoret where Esther has been farming for the last three years. She plants maize both for consumption by the family and for selling. 

Esther was introduced to KADET by one of her friends; this will be her third loan with KADET.  She plans to use the entire loan to aid in the process of planting maize in her farm. She is a hardworking lady and she hopes to own a bigger farm in future so that she can expand in farming.

loans.use: The loan will be used for planting maize

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly C. has been engaging in fish selling business since the time she joined ASHI in 2005 together with her loving and supportive husband. Loans she requests are used to purchase fish from the fishermen in their village to be sold directly to people in the market. With the profits that this business makes, Nelly is optimistic that her dream of supporting the education of her two children (two and six years old) until they graduate from college is possible. Just recently, Nelly had ventured on a new business which is hog fattening. This is her sort of saving their profits and has it increased. Hogs/pigs they fattened in four months time will be sold either slaughtered or alive to a meat vendor in the market or to people in their village. By then they will have a profit in addition to the profit of their fish selling business. 

Though Nelly has enjoyed her hog fattening business, she really wants her fish selling business to grow because she is not only working hard to improve her family way of life but she is also helping her husband have his own source of income as well as giving the rest of the fishermen in their village have an access to market their fish. With that she is requesting for a loan to Kiva through ASHI with the amount much larger to the one she received recently.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of fish for selling.

loans.name: John Kiptoo

texts.en:
John Kiptoo is a man of thirty five years who is married with five children. He buys maize from farmers within his area of residence (Kapkuto village in Eldoret) and then resells it at a profit. He has been in this business for two years now.

John knew about KADET through a group called Tembelio which was already registered with KADET and he joined them. He has applied for a loan which he is going to use to buy maize for resale.

John says that, with the extra income he gets from the business, he is planning to educate his children and provide them with basic needs like clothing, food and housing.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell
