Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel M. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Raquel owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kebisoni Community Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
B. John is 62 years old and married with seven children with five still in school: two at the University and three in secondary school. He also takes care of other dependents.

John is into poultry farming in Rukungiri and one of his business strengths is ensuring that his layers give him quality eggs. He hopes to have more hens (layers) to give him more eggs as well as have a decent home and a bigger farm. He sells his eggs to his customers in Rukungiri.

John needs a loan to be able to buy more feed and drugs for his hens so that he gets quality eggs from them. He is a hardworking and friendly man and he appears again in the small photo as the leader of his lending group.

loans.use: To buy more feed and drugs for his chickens

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Being one of the oldest members of ASHI’s oldest branch in the province of Antique, Erlinda T.’s patience and determination in achieving her whim of changing her family’s standard of living has been tested through time.

Despite being poor and receiving small earnings from her soft drinks wholesaling business in partnership with her husband, Erlinda was able to create a cash flow for her family. She enjoyed spending it on the needs of her children, especially those who went to college for a higher level of education.

One of her children is now abroad working as an oversea contract worker. His salary is too small to support the needs of his own family, therefore Erlinda is helping him to support his children’s education. Aside from this child, the rest of her children (three) are living with her.

There was a time when the loan Erlinda requested from ASHI was used to support her eldest child’s fishing business. Anyhow, she wants to provide him with a regular source of income for he has not been to college and is impossible for him to get employment. 

Despite the fact that Erlinda sometimes feels tired of dreaming, she never gets tired of playing her role as a mother. She enjoyed growing her business using the loans she received from ASHI, Kiva’s field partner in the Philippines, the same way she enjoyed seeing her two younger children go to college. One has graduated and has started her teaching profession just a month ago while the other is still studying.

With hope that her youngest child will graduate from college, Erlinda is planning to grow her business further. With the loan she is presently requesting from Kiva, she hopes to grow her business further and expand the selling areas she covers. Then, her profit will also increase.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo R. Sr. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Eduardo owns and operates a business providing motorela (a motorcycle encased in a carriage with two rows of seats facing each other) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eduardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is 34 years old and is married without children although she hopes to have children in the future. Her husband provides laundry services to support their home.

Caro sells lightly-used shoes and handbags at retail prices. She is a hardworking woman and hopes to own a shoe factory in the future.

Caro is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Mamatova Umsun`s Group

texts.ru:
Умсун является лидером этой группы. Они все получают кредит во второй раз. 
Умсуну 53 года. Она замужем и мать 5 детей: 4 сына и 1 дочь. Все дети взрослые. С ней проживает младший сын. Супруг является пенсионером и в основном помогает по хозяйству. Они занимаются сельским хозяйством, выращивают рис. Кредит используется для закупа 50 кг семян, 200 кг удобрений и 50 лт солярки. 

Гулбурак, 21, замужем. Ее супруг работает в России, строителем. Она вместе с остальными членами семьи занимается животноводством. Кредит они планирует использовать для закупа 50 соток земли, где хотят посеить сельхозкультуры. 

Маматова Уулбу 39 лет. Она замужем, ее супруг работает чабаном. Сама клиентка работает в детском садике - уборщицей. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 100 кг семян и 50 кг удобрений. 

Гулира, 40, вдова. У нее 2 дочери. Старшая дочь работает в местной больнице медсестрой, а младшая школьница. Гулира врач по образованию и работает в больнице неврологом. Кредит будет использован для закупа 30 соток сельхоз земли. Таким образом она планирует начать новый бизнес: сельское хозяйство. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Umsun is the leader of this group. This is their second loan. Umsun is 53 years old. She is married and is a mother of 5 children: 4 sons and 1 daughter. All of the children are grown. Her youngest son lives with her. Umsun’s husband is retired and primarily helps with the household. They are involved in agriculture and grow rice. The loan will be used for the purchase of 50 kg of seeds, 200 kg of fertilizers and 50 liters of fuel. Gulburak is 21 years old and married. Her husband works in Russia as a construction worker. Together with her other family member, she is involved in animal husbandry. They plan to use the loan to purchase 50 ares (500 square meters) of land, where they want to sow agricultural crops. Uulbu M. is 39 years old. She is married, and her husband works as a shepherd. Our client works as a janitor at a kindergarten. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of 100 kg of seeds and 50 kg of fertilizers. Gulira is 40 years old and a widow. She has 2 daughters. The oldest daughter works as a nurse at the local hospital, and the youngest goes to school. Gulira is a doctor and works as a neurologist at the local hospital. The loan will be used for the purchase of 30 ares (300 square meters) of agricultural land. This is how Gulira plans to start her new business – agriculture.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Ejiro

texts.en:
Ejiro O. sells colorful sarongs and jewelry in her stall and also designs clothes for her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business.

Ejiro is married with three children, her eldest child being 15 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. She is 38 years old and her husband is a builder and he also supports their home.

With the profit she makes from her business Ejiro supports her family. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rwobusisi Bakyara Tukorerehamwe Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
B. Godfrey is the leader of his lending group and he appears in the photo with his lending group in Rukungiri. He is 40 years old and married with three children aged 13, 8 and 6 years. He also takes care of his siblings.

Godfrey has operated a retail grocery shop in Nyamayenje trading centre for sixteen years and the experience he has gained enables him to offer the best to his customers. He has a hope that, in future, he will be able to turn the shop into a wholesale business and have a happy family.

Godfrey needs a loan to be able to buy more items for his shop. These same loans have enabled him to save and, in the end, he has been able to buy a motorcycle that is bringing in more income as he employs someone to manage it.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking woman who own a private clinic and also sells drugs. She has been in her business for some years. With this she meets her family’s needs, including feeding, clothing and giving sound education to her children. Deborah has also saved lives through this means of rendering medical care to the sick.

Deborah hopes to improve on her service delivery to patients and buy more drugs to sell. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drugs to sell. 

Deborah is 48 years old, is married with six children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Her husband work as a civil servant in Lagos and they are doing well. She thanks Kiva for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married with six children and she is 40 years old. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports their home.

Margret is an honest and happy woman. To make a living in Ughelli she sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is used by Nigerians to prepare mouth-watering cooked foods. She sells her cooking oil in the market. She is hardworking and sells for long hours to enable her to support her family.

The demands for Margret’s cooking oil are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rwentuha Women Development, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
B. Angelina is 64 years old and a widow with three children aged 18, 16 and 14 years, all still in school.

Angelina is into the business of selling goats from Kanyanku village, Rukungiri, and her biggest challenge is the thieves that take the goats, especially at night. However, she has been able to employ security and a strong fence.

Angelina is happy that there is a market for the goats she sells and she ensures that she has enough stock on her farm. She buys goats and keeps them for resale later at a better price. She hopes to expand her business further as well as see all her children graduate at university level.

Angelina is such a hardworking lady and she needs a loan to be able to buy more goats for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr:
Mwanaidi K. est présidente du groupe de crédit Mapendo, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 13e  cycle de credit,agée de 42 ans, divorcée.Elle est mère de  10 enfants  parmi lesquels   6   vont à l’école et 4 autres n’étudient  pas par manque des frais scolaires.Notons  qu’elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants car son mari l’a complètement abandonné.
Elle a commencé son petit commerce avec son fonds propre Reçu de son mari avant leur divorce. Son Busines est de fournir  des poules aux hotels, snack bars  et restaurants  de la ville. il y a 23 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poules. Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant   45 poules. Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de varier et de développer d’autres  d’activités en s’approvisionnant dans de grands centres  commerciaux comme Dubai, Kampala, etc.
Elle rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle recoit sans aucune garantie materielle car grace a ces credits elle parvient a subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ce groupe est  composé des 14 membres. Il sied d'indiquer sur la ptoto 7 femmes sont debout et  7 hommes sont assis.
texts.en:
Mwanaidi K. is president of the Mapendo credit loan group, now in their 13th loan cycle. She is the one raising her hand on the picture. She is 42 years old, divorced, and mother of ten children, of which six are still going to school, and four no longer attend due to lack of resources for school costs. She is the sole support for her children as her husband has completely abandoned her. She started her small business with her own funds, received from her husband before the divorce. For the past 23 years, she has been selling chickens to hotels, snack bars and restaurants in town. With the credit loan from Hekima MFI, she would like to increase her turnover by purchasing 45 chickens. In the future she plans to diversify and develop other activities by getting supplies in large commercial centres such as Dubai, Kampala, etc. She thanks Hekima for the credit loans she has been granted without having any collateral, because they have allowed her to take care of her children’s needs. This group is made up of 14 members. On the picture, there are seven standing women, and seven men who are crouching.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 45 chickens

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 39 years old, married to a trader, and they are yet to have children. She is a hardworking woman and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

Florence owns a medicine stall where she sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
44 year-old Thelma O. has been an active member of ASHI since the time she joined. Despite the interest rate ASHi charges her for the loans she has received, she was inspired by the fact that she had a means of financial assistance which enabled her to have and grow a business.

Aside from ASHI, no one in their village would have entrusted a loan to someone as poor as she was because her capacity to repay was doubtful. Therefore, Thelma’s dream of uplifting her family’s standard of living in that case would have been hampered.

When Thelma started receiving loans from ASHI, she and her husband had been selling fish. The profit from this is her family’s main source of cash flow. Though it is not yet large, Thelma and her family are happy about it because their lives have improved a bit. She was able to support the education of her only child in elementary school and she hopes that by growing her business further she will be able to support her child’s education until she graduates from college.

With this intention, Thelma is requesting a much larger loan from Kiva through ASHI. Her husband is supporting this decision of hers and is also excited to help her grow their business as well as their profit so that they can have savings for their future needs.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old married man and the father of three children, two of whom are still of school-age.

In 2004, Ali started working in agriculture as a new business. He cultivates all type of vegetables according to the season and he distributes the harvest to specified agricultural markets we work with. He’s thankful for his new business; it allows making extra money for the family.

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizer and seeds because he's planning to expand his business and is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells groceries and drinks at the front of her house to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Elizabeth is married with three children and she is 36 years old. Her eldest child is 13 years old. All her children attend school and this gives her great joy. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell corn

loans.name: Noorya Waisy Group

texts.en:
Noorya is a woman who is the leader of Noorya Waisy Group. She is 35 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children. She lives in a household of five members, including her husband.

Noorya has been involved in tailoring for more than three years. She sews male and female clothing and now she wants to buy more cloth for her business.

Noorya is happy with this loan process and with her family. He wants to say that without this loan, it would be impossible to help her family improve their living conditions. She would like to thank all lenders and especially those who will help her obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 31-year-old married man and father of one young child.

In 2002, Joseph opened a car wash shop in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. He is the only provider in his family with his business and that's the reason why he works to hard to satisfy its needs.

Joseph services his town, and he has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas. In order to fulfill his project and to take in more cars for cleaning, he needs to buy a new air compressor. He’s asking for a loan of $700 to realize this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a new air compressor

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Туракулов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. У него среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает дыню и арбуз. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor T. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. Bahtiyor has a small plot of land, where he plants honeydew and watermelon. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He wants to plant and obtain a good harvest for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: 02.02.1.4 Group

texts.en:
Ngân Đào Thị (17) is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Ngân is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.02.1.4 Nam Ngan (02.02.1.4).

Ngân is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, Ngân owns & operates a livestock raising business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL.. Ngân has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Ngân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ngân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Dương Thị Đức (18) is a 35 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Vân (19) is a 34 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

3.  Lê Thị Kim (20) is a 46 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  Lê Thị Vinh (21) is a 40 year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ngân Đào Thị (17) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Ngân là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.02.1.4 Nam Ngan (02.02.1.4).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Ngân thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ngân kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Ngân đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ngân đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Dương Thị Đức (18) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Vân (19) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  Lê Thị Kim (20) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

4.  Lê Thị Vinh (21) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells bottles of wine at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to be a major wine distributor in the future. She loves this business so dearly because of the profit. She is an honest and hard working woman. She is married with 5 children and is 49 years old. Her husband is a plumber and he also supports their family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more bottles of wine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah R. is from the village of Del Pilar, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Leah operates a food vending business. She has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Leah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her snack vending business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and married with 2 children, 13 and 15 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. Grace sells foodstuffs at retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. Grace has requested a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Turibamwe Womens Group, Ibanda

texts.en: K. Florence is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend primary school. She has been operating a retail shop in Kitongore, Ibanda district for close to two years and she currently generates profits to the tune of 50,000 UGX per week.  In a month, she believes that her profits could triple. Since the inception of her business, her set goal has always been to dispense with poverty. K. Florence is a hard working and diligent woman who hopes to expand her retail trading activities once she can get a loan. She is the leader of her lending group and appears in the small photo at the top left of the group photo.

loans.use: to buy more goods to increase the stock of her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mai T. P. was born in 1957. She lives in Le Phap village with her husband and children. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She has taken out loans from SEDA for the past 4 years. This time, she wants to borrow 1,090,000 VND (~60 USD) to buy food for pigs.
About the other borrowers in her group:
Dao T. N. was born in 1949. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND (~335 USD) to buy food for cows and poultry.
Luyen T. T. was born in 1966. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND (~375 USD) for her small business.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Tope

texts.en:
Tope owns a boutique where she sells women's bags, shoes and clothes. She manages the business herself and her children sometimes assist her after school hours. Tope has been in the business for 12 years. 

Tope wants to expand the size of her business so as to increase sales in future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more bags, shoes and clothes to sell. This will enable her meet her customers’ demands and maximize profit.

Tope is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children between the ages of 13 and 18. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more women's bags, shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita M. is a 37-year-old mother of six children and wife of a small time hired laborer. Her family's poor economic situation, that of being dependent on the income generated by her husband, pushed Carmelita to develop her own business and source of income. She joined ASHI in 2007 in order to gain financial capital to realize her ambition, and has been receiving loans since then. She has supported two businesses with the loans she has requested: her husband’s fishing business and a variety store which sells grocery items. Her store is located in her house so that while she spends time managing her business she can also attend to the needs of her family, especially to those of her disabled child.

The profit from both businesses enables Carmelita and her husband to support the needs of their six children, whose ages range from 1 to 18. All but their eldest child and their disabled child go to school. Carmelita is requesting a larger loan from Kiva / ASHI to expand her variety store into a big grocery store to meet her regular customers' demands and to attract new customers. She also wants to increase her profit to support the financial needs for her children's education until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Zakira Hussain Group

texts.en: Zafar M., son of A. A., is 21 years old, single and the leader of the Zakira Hussain group. He is an educated man with work experience. He has a retail shop and has worked in this business for a long time. He has a good number of customers. His business was small but when he got his first loan, he expanded his stock, which gave his business more success and he is still working at it. He has requested a second loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his brothers in the business. He wants to work hard to make a better future for all of his family. He is sure that he can further his business with more success.

loans.use: to purchase more foods for his shop

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
Wassim has owned a car repair shop for the past fifteen years and specializes in repairing bodywork in addition to painting. He started working in this occupation when he was quite young and, due to his long experience, he was able to make a good number of customers over the years.

Wassim has already taken a loan from Kiva and he's pleased with his decision to take a loan via Ameen. He has repaid on-time and he has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than his scheduled end date.

Today, Wassim is requesting a new loan of $2,000 to buy new tools needed for his business in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Zahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen has always distinguished herself as being a hardworking person devoted to her husband and her two kids: one son and one daughter who are the apple of her eye.

Her husband runs a grocery store in the community which he started twelve years ago. Zahida helps him in his grocery store after finishing the domestic chores. Her husband feels good when he finds her in the store and appreciates her struggle on behalf of the family. 

Zahida has requested a loan worth Pak Rs. 18,000 for the grocery store. She thinks this would be a great help for the expansion of the business.

She is applying with another lady whose name is Naziran. Naziran wants a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

Note: These two ladies belong to a city called Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for store

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 30-year-old married woman with two school-age children. Six years ago, she started running a tailoring business from her home to earn income and help her husband in the household. She produces all kinds of tailoring supplies in addition to sewing curtains. She is well known by customers because she's very talented in her work.

Today, Fatmeh is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additionA. textiles to augment her productivity, meet her customers' demands, and so increase her family income.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Khan Agha Alaam Group

texts.en:
Mohammad Alam is son of A. S.. He is the group leader of Khan Agha Alaam and lives in the 7th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and has a cosmetics shop. When he started this business, it was small. However, when he got an individual loan, he really improved his business and continues to do so, attracting a good number of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan on time and without any difficulty. 
He has requested a second loan to enlarge his shop and maintain his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business leader in the future. 
He is happy with this loan. He would like to thank Kiva, AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Orilawo Funmi

texts.en:
Funmi, 43, is married with 2 children and lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is hard working and believes that women need to support men in providing for the family. Funmi is a nurse by profession; she sells drugs and groceries in order to earn additional income. She provides clothing, food and more to assist her husband in running the affairs of the home. Her husband is a civil servant who also works hard to meet his financial responsibilities at home. 

Funmi hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drugs and groceries to sell. She promises to repay her loan at the due date. She says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Asman's Group

texts.en:
Asman is a 32-year-old woman, married with three children currently in school. She lives in a city named Pakpattan in Pakistan and describes herself as an ambitious person. Although her husband has his own grocery store which he's been running for the previous 10 years, she handles her milk selling business independently. She does this business to improve their standard of living. They both have good knowledge about their work. They also share their working experiences with each other. Asman is requesting a loan of Pak Rs. 10,000 to add to the stock of her husband’s grocery store. 

She is the leader of a group of three other women from her locality. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goats and sheep) for her animal selling business. Noor ilahi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ubaida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to start a milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline T. is a married 32-year-old mother of two children.  As an ambitious entrepreneur, Charline would like to receive a loan of 25,000 PHP to support her venture in making sweet delicacies.   Her specialty, “cassava pudding” is very popular with loyal customers in her neighborhood and Charline loves making delicious treats for her community to enjoy.

A dedicated member of Kiva microfinance partner ASHI since 2006  Charline has been a model member demonstrating regular attendance to weekly meetings and timely loan repayments.
Her long term goals are to save for her children’s education, sustain the profitability of her store, and build brand recognition of her store throughout the entire province of Antique.  Through hard work and determination, Charline is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for production of cassava pudding.

loans.name: 02.1.5 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thien H. T. is a 52 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thien is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.1.5 Nam Ngan.


Thien is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Thien operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing construction services to local community members.  Thien has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Thien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Huong (23) is a 48 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


2.  T. T. Minh (24) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Tam (25) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a bakery.


4.  L. T. Huyen (26) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  N. T. Quyet (27) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thien H. T.  (22) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.02.1.5 Nam Ngan (02.02.1.5).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Thien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần T.ết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Huong (23) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  T. T. Minh (24) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Tam (25) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì.


4.  L. T. Huyen (26) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  N. T. Quyet (27) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Azran's Group

texts.en:
Azran is 22 years old and extremely vigorous in her work. She wakes up in the early hours and finishes her domestic chores, then she goes to attend to her grocery store that she has been managing for the last five years. 

She has given birth to two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom are students. The circumstances have made her mature at an early age. She understands her responsibilities and started performing them accordingly. Her husband completed his education through 8th standard and then started helping his father in his wheat grinding business. Then he later adapted this work as his own profession. Their incomes help meet the expenses. 

Her grocery store is located in a competitive environment and she needs to increase the products to manage the customer base and to improve sales. For this reason she has requested a loan of Pak Rs. 15,000.

She has five other ladies in her loan group. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Imtiaz baji, Haleema baji, Noor bhari baji and ZIkran baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Mohammad Saber Group

texts.en:
M. Ramin son of M. B. is the group leader of (M. Saber group). He is 19 single and he lives in a household of 7 members, including his mother and father. He is a hard working boy and full experienced in a retail shop and he has been working in this business for more then 3 years. Now he wants to complete his stocks.
M. Ramin would like to expand his business so he wants to take a loan to complete his stock so that he can make a good income and help his family, He is happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: He wats to comleted his stocks

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong T. X. N. was born in 1978 and lives in Le Phap village with her husband and two children. She is a tailor and also has a store where she sells cake, sweets, beer, etc.

Phuong T. X. N. has taken part in SEDA for five years and has always repaid on time. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,630,000 VND (approximately 400 USD) which will be used to buy a sewing machine and to invest in her store with the hope of a better life.

About the other borrow in her group:

Nhuong T. N. was born in 1958. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VDN to buy scrap iron to resell.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to invest in her store

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and five siblings. As the area he came from is primarily agricultural, he has learned about this occupation for the past 5 years. He started working as a farmer on his own in 2008. He cultivates all types of vegetables depending on the season, and he sells the products in a big agriculture market widely known in the area. He and his father are the only providers for the family. With his business income, he helps his father satisfy the family expenses. 

Salah is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizers and summer seeds to cultivate his land for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and summer seeds

loans.name: Onajita

texts.en:
Onajita sells roasted plantain to make a living. Roasted plantain can be eaten with pears, coconut and peanuts. She sells her roasted plantain in an open area in her community and hopes to expand her business.

Onajita is married with nine children and her husband is a welder. She is 45 years old. She has a large family to cater for.

Onajita sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband to meet the basic needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more bunches of plantain to roast and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to roast and sell

loans.name: Kosar Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen is from the city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan a city famous for its shrines. She is 36-year old woman, married and has three children. To make a living her husband operates a shoe selling business. He has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Pak Rupees in a month.

Kosar started a bed sheets making business with the intention of sharing financial burden of her husband. Her husband appreciates her for her kind thoughts. Her income fruitfully improved the living of her family. 

She is requesting for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 10,000 which will be used to enhance her husband’s shoe selling business by buying the shoes in bulk. They have a plan to use the additional revenue generated from the business to brighten up their kids’ future by enrolling them into good school. 

She has four other ladies in her loan group. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Rubia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies.

loans.use: To buy shoes for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy yam buds

loans.name: Toorpykai Anis Group

texts.en:
Allah M., the son of G. M., is the leader of Toorpykai Anis Group. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 47 years old, is married, and has five children.

Allah M. has a retail shop and works hard to earn money to provide for his family’s requirements. He needs to buy more food and materials for his shop.

He is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank those providing this process, especially the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy more food and materials for his shop

loans.name: Sylvanous

texts.en:
Sylvanous owns a boutique where he sells shirts to make a living. He loves this business because he makes his customers look good. He is an honest and hardworking man. He hopes to open another boutique before the end of this year.

Sylvanous is 32 years old and is married with a child who is five years old and attends school.

Sylvanous is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more shirts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts to sell

loans.name: Hajran's Group

texts.en:
Hajran is 26-year old woman, married with two children. She lives in a city named Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband name is M. I.. Presently he has three motorbikes which he earns income off of by renting the. He charges the customers by the hour. 

Hajran has given birth to two boys who are not of a school going yet. She is a very hardworking lady. After finishing the household works she attends her grocery shop. Her presence in her shop is very essential because where her grocery shop is located there is tough competition among other grocery shops. If she misses a single day, she will faces great loss from the customer side. She does this work to save money for her children future. 

She is requesting of a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15,000 which her husband will be used to repair the motorbikes. 

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy mason tools for her husband.

loans.use: To repair motorbikes

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 33-year-old married man with 3 young children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1998, servicing his town and its surroundings. In addition, he offers private transportation services upon request of his clients. He is always trying to work long hours to earn enough income to be able to pay for his children's school fees. 

Fadi has requested a loan of $1,000 to carry out maintenance work on his car. He wants to increase its safety features and offer comfortable transportation to his customers.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara owns a boutique where she sells shoes, sarongs, and bags. She also owns a shop where she sells drinks. With the profit made from her businesses, she supports her husband who runs his private business to take care of their home. They are blessed with two children.

Omolara wants to improve and further expand her business. She is requesting NGN 80,000 to purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell as this will attract more customers to her shop and increase her sales and income.

43-year-old Omolara and her family reside in Lagos State, Nigeria. She appreciates LAPO micro-finance and Kiva for their great financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells baby things like cream, Pampers (diapers), clothes and flasks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a friendly and hardworking woman.

Felicia is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She is married with four children and she is 38 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish a poultry's corral

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 34 years old and she is single without children. She hopes to get married very soon. She is a nice, hardworking woman who hopes to lift her business and parents above poverty.

Happy sells sarongs at retail and wholesale prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 brothers. In 2007, he opened a Nargile shop. Nargile is a special Lebanese tobacco very famous in Lebanon. He designed his shop as a café, receiving clients who come to have a good time, and he also offers delivery service to homes. 

Today, Khalil hopes to expand his shop by making it bigger and also building a cigarette stand. He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to achieve this purpose.

loans.use: Expand tobacco shop and add a cigarette stand

loans.name: Haja Ramatu

texts.en:
Madam Haja Ramatu is a fishmonger and she is married to a gold miner. She owns a stall at the market in the centre of town where she sells her fish retail.

Haja Ramatu has six children, three of whom are in school. Through her husband she was able to secure some capital and established herself in the fish trade. She has been selling fish for fifteen years now.

Haja Ramatu is in need of a loan to purchase an additional stock of fish to sell wholesale. She hope to use the proceeds of the loan to support her children’s education and to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 38 years old and is married with three children. She hopes to give her children a quality education. Her husband is an engineer and he also supports their home.

Prisca sells lightly-used shoes and handbags at retail prices. She hopes to own a shoe factory in the future. She is a hardworking woman and she sells to meet the basic needs of her family.

Prisca is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more lightly-used shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Bat-Undrah

texts.en:
Bat-Undrah is 29 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house. Bat-Undrah's husband is a carpenter by trade and works in housing construction.

Presently, Bat-Undrah operates a small cafe in the city. She started her business in October 2009 with one employee. Bat-Undrah previously worked as a cook at another popular cafe for a year and gained experience in her trade. In just a short time she has made much progress with her business and attributes her success to her cafe's good location.

Bat-Undrah is a very hardworking person and has good business sense. She is already making plans to expand her cafe by improving the quality and taste of her food, as well as adding more tables and chairs to accommodate her many new customers. She says “I would like grow my earnings so that I can purchase my workspace.”

Bat-Undrah is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase a freezer, a display refrigerator, and a stove for her cafe. She also hopes to use some of the funds to purchase meat before prices go up.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, refrigerator and stove for her café

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 45-year-old married man with two school-age children. He has owned a juice shop in his town for the past 30 years. He has a good reputation in the whole region due to the delicious fresh juices he makes. The availability of fresh juice all year round is one of Lebanon’s many great features. Depending on the season, it is possible to find juices such as mango, pomegranate, lemon, and blood orange. He’s thankful for his business because over the years, he has been able to meet his children's needs. 

Today, Abbas is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase more inventory and improve his business productivity.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for juice shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice sells groceries and drinks. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Beatrice, 25, is married with a child. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their family. Beatrice is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Densmaa is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Govi-Altay province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living in their current home since 2007. Densmaa's husband, Shaariibuu, is retired and her daughter helps Densmaa operate the family's small cafe, which she has been running since 2000. She has steadily built up her business over the years and has gained much experience as a businesswoman. Densmaa previously received a 300,000 tugrug (~211 USD) loan from XacBank's partner bank in order to increase her working capital. As a result, she was able to purchase a new ger for her other children who live on their own. Densmaa is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase a car for my daughter next year.” Densmaa is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 705 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices. Garri is a staple food in Nigeria and it can be eaten with soup or peanuts. Joy loves this business because it is highly profitable. Joy is 48 years old and hard working. She is a widow with 6 children. Life as a widow is a large challenge, which she is trying to overcome. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been working as a construction entrepreneur for the past 20 years. Working on a freelance basis, he manages parts of projects to build houses and shops in his town and its surrounding area. Over the years, his business productivity has improved and he has earned a very good reputation in the field. He is the only provider for his family of 5 children. 

Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase scaffolding, which will make him able to take on a new big project and be prepared to meet the requests of his customers.

loans.use: purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth owns a shop where she sells drinks and groceries to her customers at retail prices. She has been in the business for 10 years and it is her means of supporting her family. She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with more drinks. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more drinks to sell to meet her customers’ demands and make more profit to assist her family and save for the future.

Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children. The family lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Govi-Altay province, Mongolia. Both of her daughters attend university in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and her youngest son is in high school. Her husband is disabled and currently unemployed. Narantsetseg operates a small shoe shop at the local market in her town. She retired from her career in 2007; however, she has worked at the market selling imported goods and operating her current shoe business to supplement her income. Narantsetseg has found success since starting her new business. In 2008, she used her earnings to purchase her own counter at the market. Furthermore, Narantsetseg previously received a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 705 USD) loan from XacBank, and used the loan funds to effectively expand her business. Narantsetseg is a very open and hardworking person. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. She says, “My two daughters will graduate soon and my son plans to enroll in university after high school. I want to ensure that I can financially support them." Narantsetseg hopes to continue to expand her business in the future. She is now making plans to open a small shop from which to sell Korean products next year. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to increase her working capital and purchase summer sneakers to sell at her counter.

loans.use: To purchase summer sneakers to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard was born in 1951. He is a widower and the father of eight children: Marilyn and Lorna (25 and 23 years old respectively, both high school graduates); Bernard (18 years old, Form 1); Kenneth Richard (22 years old, Form 3); Jeptoo (17 years old, Class 8); Christopher (15 years old, Class 6); Brian (6 years old, Class 1); and Silas (14 years old, Class 4).

Richard runs a hotel (restaurant) and is also a farmer. Both of his businesses are one year old and he earns a profit of Ksh 10,000 per month from his businesses. His businesses are in Pemwai village.

Richard was introduced to KADET by a villager who comes from his area. He has no previous credit history. He plans to use his Ksh 40,000 loan to open another hotel while any remaining amount will be used to plant maize.

If this loan boosts his business he will use the extra profit to purchase a dairy cow. He intends to practice zero-grazing (stall-feeding) with the purchase of the cow as he dreams of being a dairy farmer. Richard describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To open another restaurant and to plant maize

loans.name: Ibrahim A.

texts.en:
Ibrahim A. K. is a trader who sells food condiments at Tumba Street Big Market. He is married with two children.

For the past five years, Ibrahim has been in this business and it has served as a means of providing for his family. He was a client under the group loan structure and has a very good credit history.

Ibrahim is seeking a loan which he intends use to buy more food products and hopes to use the proceeds from the business to buy a piece of land. 

Ibrahim is very committed to his business and spends much of his time at his shop.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married with four children and she is 35 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Christiana is a lovely and happy woman and is hardworking. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her family.

To make a living in Ughelli, Christiana sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She sells her cooking oil in market. Cooking oil is used by Nigerians to prepare mouth-watering cooked foods.

The demand for her cooking oil is high and Christiana hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Liza Kongato

texts.en:
Liza C. is a 56-year-old lady who is married to Mr. Joseph C.. They have been blessed with nine children: Hilda (26 years), Jeptui (30 years), Kimoi (28 years), Henry (26 years), Winny (24 years; in university), Edwin (22 years; in university), Robert (20 years; in university), Kipngetich (17 years; in high school) and Gideon(12 years; in primary school).

Liza is a farmer and she has been farming for eight years now. Her farming business generates a profit of Ksh 5,000 per month. She has no other sources of income. Liza’s business is situated in Timboiywo where most of her customers are residents.

Liza has obtained a loan of Ksh 80,000 from KADET. Ksh 50,000 of this loan will be used for farming and the balance will be used to pay school fees. She has never borrowed from another financial institution. If this loan boosts her business she will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children.

Liza dreams of having a good dairy cow and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay school fees

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 43-year old married man and father of 2 young children. He has been working as a construction worker since 1995. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of the clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job, in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. 

In order to take his business to the next level, Jawad is asking to borrow $1,000. He will use this loan to buy additionA. wood to improve the quality of his construction services.

loans.use: buy additional wood

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La Sra. Dominga tiene 46 años y esta casada con el Sr. Leopoldo de 58 años, cuenta con seis hijos mayores dos casados y con hijos  todos ellos trabajando. 
Ella siempre trabajo como empleada domestica, cuando su marido se accidento en su trabajo ella decidió trabajar en su casa realizando artículos de limpieza, actualmente cuenta con varios clientes. 
Le gustaría en el futuro abrir para su fabrica en su domicilio y que sus hijos le ayuden.
texts.en:
Dominga, 46, is married to Leopoldo, 58; they have 6 adult children, who are all employed; two are married and have children of their own. She had always worked as a domestic employee. When her husband was injured at work, she decided to work from home making cleaning supplies; she has several customers now. In the future, she would like to open a factory in her home and have her children help her with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, Mongolia. His oldest child, Zulaa, is 7 years old and is a secondary school student. His youngest child attends kindergarten. He and his family live together in a small house.

Sainbayar operates a grocery store in his town. He started his business in 2003, at first selling from a small food kiosk. After steadily growing his business he was able to expand to his current store. In 2005, He also began operating a taxi service in his town. His wife, Nyamgerel, is very supportive of her husband and works as a salesperson in their store when he is busy driving the taxi.

Sainbayar has used his business success to build a new house for his family near their grocery store. He is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills. He says, “I have many ideas to expand my business further and I hope it will allow me to add on to my house and purchase a new car."

Sainbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a variety of food products such as candies and fruit for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en: A. Akmal is 25 years old and has been selling men’s clothing for five years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop location and establish himself in the market. Akmal is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Akmal needs a loan of 3,000 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of his business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells sachet water (water in plastic bags) at retail prices. She loves her business and she is determined to lift her business above poverty.

The demands for her sachet water are high during the dry season and Florence hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Florence hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Florence is married with two children and she is 38 years old. Her husband is a builder and he also supports their home.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water to sell

loans.name: Saikhudja

texts.en: D. Saikhudja is 49 years old. He is married and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Saikhudja is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yields. Saikhudja needs tools and fertilizer to continue his difficult work, tending his crops so that they can be taken to the capital for sale. That's why he's applying for a loan of 5,000 Somoni. Let's be the ones who reach out our hands to help him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Alovidin

texts.en: S. Alovidin is married and has a little son. Alovidin works as a farmer everyday. He was educated until secondary school but he had to quit early because he couldn't afford to attend. Alovidin has a good work ethic and has whole-heartedly committed himself to agriculture. Thanks to his hard work, he has today become a man known for his determination and serves as an example and reference for other farmers. Alovidin has been growing vegetables and fruit for the past five years. He is now seeking a loan of 1,000 USD to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his crops in the hopes of being well prepared for the upcoming season so as to produce a good harvest at the end of the season. He can then better meet the needs of his family and improve his working conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and is married with six children. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home.

Evelyn sells dry pepper to make a living. Dry pepper is used in the preparation of Nigerian cooked foods and soup. She hopes to grow her business.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more dry pepper to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dry pepper to sell

loans.name: Adewumi

texts.en:
