Adewumi is 35 and married with three children. She sells food stuff like yams and garri to her customers at retail. (Garri comes from cassava and is consumed by most Nigerians as a meal in itself.) Adewumi has earned her living from this business for 15 years. 

Adewumi want to improve and expand her business in the future. She is asking for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more garri and yams to sell as this will put her in a better position to assist her husband in paying for their children’s education and provide for other family needs. She appreciates all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more garri and yams to sell.

loans.name: Ivon

texts.en:
Ivon is a 35-year-old woman living with her husband and 3 children in the town of Dickwella, in the Matara district of Sri Lanka.  Her husband works as a day laborer, and their three children (ages six, seven, and twelve) help Ivon in her business after they return home from school.  She started her business one year ago, and is a very active woman, so naturally she likes to work hard.  Coir making consists of extracting the fibres of coconut shells to be woven together, often into string, yarn, ropes, or floor mats.  It is a very popular trade in Sri Lanka.

Ivon is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy more coir to process and sell to her currently-expanding base of customers.  She attributes the success of her business to hard work and a good location.  But ultimately, she hopes to relocate her business to another area and start her own shop there.

loans.use: to buy coir

loans.name: Thereas

texts.en: Thereas sells iced fish retail. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers and hopes to grow it. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children all of whom attend school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their household. She hopes for a loan  of N80,000 to purchase more iced fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Priyanthi

texts.en:
Priyanthi is a 37-year-old woman living with her husband and 3 children in the town of Dickwella in southern Sri Lanka.  Her husband runs his own business, a painting service.  Her husband has had his business for a long time, and now Priyanthi is hoping to take a loan to expand her own business.  Both she and her husband consider themselves active and clever in their enterprises.  

Priyanthi is asking for a loan of 40,000 LKR to buy additional cloth for her tailoring business.  Eventually she hopes to buy a new sewing machine which would really improve her business, as it is in a good location, which has helped her expand and caused the need for a loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth

loans.name: Mujeres Unidades Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el  inicio del presente comité fue la señora Francisca R. quien se informa del programa, organizaron e invito a sus amigas y vecinas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Así se conformo el comité actualmente todas trabajan muy contentas y con mucha esperanza de mejorar las condiciones de vida que llevan, siempre trabajando dignamente.
La Señora  Guillermina O. se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías como papeles, cuadernos, cartucheras, bolsos, y otros artículos,  logrando de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de  mercaderías a su clientela.
texts.en:
Francisca R. was the initial contact person for the start-up of this committee. She became informed about the program and organized and invited her friends and neighbors to become part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Committee). That is how this group got together and they currently happily work together with much hope for improved living conditions; they always work with dignity. Guillermina O. sells general merchandise. She invested the funds in such things as: paper, notebooks, bookbags, pouches, etc. thereby offering a greater variety of items to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper, accessories, pouches, notebooks, book covers, globes.

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
El comité Los Rosales del barrio Colonia Juan de Salazar de la ciudad de Limpio, se formó mediante que algunas integrantes del comité Restaurador del barrio Isla A. decidieron formar un nuevo comité en su localidad a fin de no tener inconvenientes para la asistencia a las reuniones. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 17 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Ceferiana A. se dedica a la venta de leche e invirtió el dinero en la compra de alimentos  para la vacas que ella mantiene en su tambo, ademas también invirtió en la compra de tambores para reciclar la leche y compró una ordeñadoras herramienta esencial para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Los Rosales (Rose-Bushes) Committee of Colonia Juan de Salazar in the city of Limpio was formed when some members of the Restaurador (Restorer) Committee in the Isla A. neighborhood decided to form a new committee in their locality in order to avoid difficulties in attending meetings. Presently, the group is in its 5th cycle of loans with the Enterprising Women's Committee Program, sponsored by the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation). The group is composed of 17 members who invest in distinct activities. Mrs. Ceferiana sells milk and has invested her money in buying feed for the cows she maintains in her shed, as well as in buying drums for recycling milk, and buying a regulator instrument that is essential to improving her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FEED FOR COWS AND WORK TOOLS SUCH AS DRUMS AND REGULATORS

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 43 years old years and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She is a hard-working woman who sells melon retail and wholesale. Melon in Nigeria is used to prepare egusi soup. This soup is delicious and can be eaten with cassava dough. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more melons to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more melons to sell

loans.name: Mame Arame

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Arame S. habite à Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et a adhéré à la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 10 ans. Elle évolue  dans le commerce et la vente de vêtements  qu’elle pratique  chez elle depuis 3 ans. Après l’immigration de son mari  en 2005 elle a préféré  choisir une activité génératrice  de revenu pour ne pas rester  inactive. Donc avec ses bénéfices elle parvient a satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour diversifier ses produits en achetant des appareils cellulaires de la Mauritanie et de l’arachide destines a la vente. Ainsi elle espère  accroitre ses profits  a travers cette nouvelle activité  qu’elle veut découvrir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Arame S. lives in Bambilor. She is 35 years old and has belonged to the U-IMCEC since December 2009. She is married and the mother of two children, ages seven and ten. She has been developing a business selling of clothes, which she has been doing from her home for three years. After her husband immigrated in 2005, she preferred to choose a money-making activity in order to stay active. Thus with her profits she is able to satisfy her personal needs. She is seeking a 300,000 frs loan in order to diversify her products by buying cellular phones from Mauritania and peanuts to sell. In this way she hopes to increase her profits through this new activity that she wants to try.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Saddan's Group

texts.en:
Saddan is 55-years old. She is a loving mother and hard-working. She lives with her 70-year old husband A. D. and their three children in a city named Pakpattan in Pakistan. She dreams of improving their quality of life.

Her son has been engaged in a food selling business for over twelve years. His food stand is the busiest in the market. He has a good customer’s base. Everyday his customers make plans to enjoy the delicious food from his food stand.

M. Sharif says that his progress belongs to his mother Sadaan because she guided him how to cook food. They both offer varieties to their food stand and attract more customers. 

She is asking for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15,000 with which she will buy the required items (lentils, cooking oil, rice etc) to enhance the food selling business of her son.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Nagina wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruits selling business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy material for food selling business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita sells gari (cassava flakes) at retail prices. Gari is a staple food in Nigeria and it can be eaten with soup or peanuts. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She has 4 children and she is married. Her husband also works to support their home. 

Rita is 43 years old and hard-working. Her eldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is 7 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy. She hopes for the loan amount of N 170,000 to purchase more gari (cassava flakes) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gari flakes to sell

loans.name: Achintha

texts.en:
Achintha is a 39-year-old woman living with her husband and 2 children in Kamburugamuwa in the Matara district of southern Sri Lanka.  She and her husband work together to manage a book shop, which they started about one and a half years ago.  They are both very hard-working and hope to expand the book shop in the future.

Achintha is asking for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy books and stationery to help supply her shop.  She is situated in a marketplace that is in a very beneficial location right next to a center where many people take classes.  She hopes this loan will help her expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy books and stationery

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
To make a living in Ughelli, Cicilia sells onions at retail prices to her customers. She is doing well in her business. Her major challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is married to a commercial driver and they have 5 children. 

Cicilia is 52 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more onions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell

loans.name: Momar Talla

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar  Talla N. est un jeune marchand ambulant de 28 ans qui habite dans la localité de Bambilor. Il est membre de la caisse depuis décembre  2009. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 9 mois. Cependant il deux autres personnes a sa charge. Monsieur N. vend des vêtements  prêt a porter dans la communauté  rurale de Sangalkam. Il exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Lorsqu’il a quitte les bancs de l’ecole  a très  bas âgé  il est parti cultiver dans les champs. C’est en 2005 qu’il s’est lance a l’activité de marchand ambulant qui lui procure des bénéfices  satisfaisants. Par conséquent  il parvient a satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens ainsi que celui de sa petite famille. Il est mime  parvenu a acquérir un terrain. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs qui  est prévu  pour l’achat de tissus et de thioubs qui seront destines a la vente. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroitre encore d’avantage ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Momar Talla N., aged 28, is a young traveling merchant who lives in the town of Bambilor. Has been a member of the credit association since December 2009. He is married and the father of a 9-month-old child. However, he has two other persons in his care. Mr. N. sells ready-to-year clothing in the rural community of Sangalkam. He has been in this business for three years. When he left school at an early age, he went to farm the fields. In 2005, he got started in itinerant sales, which brings in satisfactory profits for him. Consequently, he manages to meet his everyday needs, as well as those of his small family. He even managed to acquire a plot of land. He's requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA that is intended for buying some fabrics and thioubs (a dyed cloth), that will be sold. This loan will enable him to grow his revenues still further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells loaves of bread to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and loves it because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is 38 years old and married to a trader; they have 3 children. She is requesting a loan of of N60,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran is 35-yrear old woman, married with five children. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines.

Gulzaran is a very hardworking lady and values the hard working people. She packs the salt in salt bags and earns income. She collects the order from retailer who paid her Pak Rs. 5000 per month. Her income allows her to pay the education expenses of her children. Her family members and the people in community respect her a lot.

Her husband name is M. A. who deals with vegetables. He purchased the seasonal vegetables from vegetable markets and sells to the required customers and earns income. They both save a part of their income for their kids’ future. 

This is the third loan Gulzaran has had with Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She will be used to buy vegetables to enhance her husband’s vegetable selling business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Zarina wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Jamila wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for selling

loans.name: Cyrillia

texts.en: Cyrillia B. has a husband who is an automobile mechanic and three children — all of them in primary school. For the past five years Cyrillia has sold hair products along Bojon street — a busy street in the city of Bo. After completing high school and desperately looking for a job to no avail, she resorted to starting a business. She wants a loan to buy the latest hair products to meet her customers' needs. She hopes to use the profit from her business to educate her children up to university level and also to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy hair products to sell

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: Gibrilla, 48, is a trader who sells men's clothes. He is married and has three school-aged children. Before that, he was a farmer. He sells at the Rogbaneh Road market centre in Makeni. Hard-working and dedicated, Gibrilla has been a trader for seven years. He wants  to expand his business and generate more income so as to be able to educate his children, run his household, and construct a house for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is 49-year old woman, married with four children. She lives in a city named Pakpattan, in Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrines.

Naziran is also a very hardworking lady. She runs a sewing clothes business. She does this work to improve the standard of living. She saves her income in a committee and has a plan to marry off her elder son with the amount.

Her husband name is M. S. and has a food stand in the market. He has been doing this work for over 15 years. He learned cooking from his mother and then took it as a profession. He feels good when the customers praise about his food. 

Naziran is applying for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 15,000 which she will be used to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice etc) to increase her husband’s food selling business.

She has four other women in her loan group. Maqsooda yasmeen wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Firdous baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Faizan baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for food selling buisness

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen sells yams at the Market in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells yams at wholesale and retail prices to make a living. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted or fried. She is a widow with 4 children and she is 60 years old. With the profits she makes in her business, she supports her children in their school and business. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Mor Talla

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOR Talla T. est un jeune éleveur  de 26 ans. Il habite a Bambilor et est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2010. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 3 mois. Après avoir quitte l’ecole monsieur T.  pratique l’élevage  de poulets de chair et de pondeuses depuis  plus de 6 ans. Aussi parallèlement  il mène  une activité  secondaire  d’achat et de vente d’œufs frais.
Avec les revenus générés  par ses 2 activités  il parvient a satisfaire la plupart de ses besoins. Il emprunte 500 000 frs pour l’achat de 200 poussins de chairs qui vont s’ajouter aux pondeuses  qui sont déjà disponibles. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Mor Talla T. is a 26-year-old breeder. He lives in Bambilor and has been a member of the U-IMCEC since January 2010. He is married and the father of a 3-month-old baby. After having left school, Mr. T. began raising chickens for meat and laying hens and has been doing this for more than six years. At the same time he also runs a business buying and selling fresh eggs. With the income from these two businesses, he is able to satisfy most of his needs. He is borrowing 500,000 frs to buy 200 chicks for meat which will be added to the chicks for laying that are already available. This loan will allow him to increase his profits.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build working capital

loans.name: Ruhusa Mweri

texts.en:
Ruhusa is a 33 year old Gentleman who is married to Mangi and they have three children. He is in the business of selling second hand clothes in New Market-Malindi where he targets residents of Malindi town. He gets a monthly profit of Kshs 5,000.

Ruhusa who is in his first loan cycle was introduced to Kadet by an existing client who was also a neighbor and he had never borrowed elsewhere before. He plans to use this loan to add stock of baby clothes with Kshs 5000 and to secure a better business premise Kshs 5000.

He plans to accumulate the extra profit he gets from this loan and expand his business. He describes himself as a hardworking man and he hopes to own a big building in Malindi town.

loans.use: to add stock of baby clothes

loans.name: Sirya Thoya

texts.en:
S. is 32 year old gentlemen who is married to Getrude and together have a daughter Josephine. 

He is in the business of motorcycle transport at Watamu-Malindi where he targets hotel employees and gets a monthly profit of Kshs 12000. His wife does small scale farming on their farm.

S. who is on his first loan and has had no prior credit history and he was introduced to Kadet by his business partners. He will utilize this loan by opening and stocking a new shop with Kshs 20000 and buying motor bike spare parts with Kshs 10000. With the extra income from this loan S. plans on accumulating the money for rental houses on his plot. 

A hardworking man he hopes to own a transport company.

loans.use: Open and stock a new retail shop and purchase motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres, Mujeres Virtuosas del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Luque, se formó gracias a la invitación de formar formar un comité que recibieron por parte de una de las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas de Isla Bogado. Actualmente el comité esta conformado por 18 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Alejandra E. se dedica a la venta de comestible, ella vende sus productos en un salón que alquila en el mercado de la ciudad de Luque, sus clientes están muy satisfechos con los productos que elabora. Los alimentos que comúnmente prepara son empanada, milanesas, sopa paraguaya, boori-bori, caldos de sistitos tipos, el crédito que solicitó lo invirtió  en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de sus productos alimenticios.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas del Barrio San Miguel (Virtuous Women of San Miguel Neighborhood) in Luque came together thanks to an invitation they received from one of the members of the Mujeres Unidas de Isla Bogado (Isla Bogado United Women) committee. Currently, the committee is made up of 18 members who are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Alejandra E. sells food in a food stand that she leases in Luque's market. Her customers are very satisfied with the dishes she makes. Some of her usual dishes are: turnovers, breaded steak, sopa paraguaya (similar to corn bread), bori-bori (a hearty soup made with meat, vegetables, and dumplings), soups. She used the funds to buy ingredients for her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meats, turnover rings, baked goods, vegetables, napkins, charcoal, flour, fruit, cooking oil.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa S. lives in Tengheh town in Freetown with her husband and 4 children. She has 2 dependents.  She has obtained 4 previous loans from LAPO,SL. Hawa S. is a very devoted business woman and hard working.
With her previous loan she purchased more rice, oil, flower, sugar, onions, groundnuts, and salt for sale. She testifies that "the profit from the loans has been a great help for me I use it to educate my children and build a house”.
She would indeed be grateful to kiva lenders because she envisages that with this larger loan her aspirations will come through.

With this loan of Le 1,500,000, Hawa S. will expand her business by purchasing oil, rice, flower, sugar and salt. This will enable her dream fulfill of having a large retail shop in Freetown.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, flower, sugar, onoins, groundnuts and salt

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Madame Sadio S. est une femme d’une quarantaine d’années  qui évolue  dans le secteur du commerce de légumes. Elle pratique cette activité depuis  plus de 5 ans au marche de Bambilor. Elle a choisi cette activité  génératrice  de revenus pour pouvoir subvenir a ses besoins de mère  de famille et éviter  la dépendance vis-à-vis de son mari. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 28 ans. Elle est devenue sociétaire  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009. Compte tenu de la rentabilité  de son activité ses bénéfices  constants lui ont permis d’acquérir quelques biens matériels  tels que réfrigérateur, téléviseur, etc.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destines a l’achat de légumes  et d’huile pour renforcer son commerce et accroitre ses bénéfices. L’acquisition de ce crédit pourra lui permettre  de tendre vers l’autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sadio S. is a woman in her forties whose business is selling vegetables. She has been doing this at the Bambilor market for five years. She has chosen this income-generating activity in order to help meet her needs as the mother of a family and avoid being dependent on her husband. She is married and the mother of eight children ranging from five to 28 years of age. She has become a member of the Bambilor credit union in October 2009. The income derived from her commercial activity has allowed her to acquire such items as a refrigerator, TV set, etc. She is requesting a credit of 500,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to purchase vegetables and oil in order to strengthen her business and increase her revenue. This credit will help her advance towards financial independence.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel K. owns a store in the center part of town. He is 37 years old and married. Before owning his store he started off with a wooden box where he displayed his goods for sale until two years back when he was able to rent a store as his business has grown more than the wooden box. Emmanuel is normally assisted in the shop by his wife and the shop is open from 7am - 12pm. He is therefore in need of a loan to buy more provisions and drinks for the store and if fortunate to access the loan will use proceeds from the business to respond to his family needs and plan on expanding his store in the future.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: Memunatu Macauley is 36 years old and trades in textiles. She owns a store which she rents and married to civil servant who works as a clerk. She has three children all in primary school. For the past 11 years Memunatu has been selling textiles. She seeks a loan to be able to travel and get the most recent textiles in order to meet her customers demand and hopes to use proceeds from the business to help her husband to complete their on going construction.

loans.use: To buy  textiles

loans.name: Saidu Rahim

texts.en: Saidu Rahim B. is 38 years old and owns a drug store at the centre part of town. He is married with one child and three dependents who are his wife's sisters. He started his business with a small table in which he sells his drugs and has now rented a store. His wife usually helps in the store when he is not around hence Saidu is seeking for a loan to purchase more drugs for his store and eventually use proceeds from his business to care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase drugs

loans.name: Jonathan Kipruto

texts.en:
Jonathan is thirty six years old, married and a father of four beautiful children who are all in primary school. 

He plants maize and after the harvest he sells the maize and gets income, he does not only do maize farming but has also diversified to horticulture which he has been doing for the last seven (7) years. His farm is at rock farm in Sergoit Location in Eldoret.

This will be his second loan in KADET and was introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a client. Jonathan will use the entire loan for farming like buying planting seeds, fertilizer and manure. His goals are to become a better farmer, provide basic needs to his family as well as educate all his four children.

loans.use: To buy maize for planting and fertilizer

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is married 4 children. She is 48 years old and her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the home. Vero sells cosmetics and jewelry at retail prices. She hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to sell

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité El Rincón de las Amigas es un comité formada  mediante el espíritu emprendedoras de las 15 señoras que la conforman. Cada una tienen un trabaja independiente de  acuerdo a las facilidades con que cuentan y realizan sus labores con mucho entusiasmo.  
Todas con la ayuda de las asesoras  practican buenas costumbres como hacer presupuesto familiar, ahorro entre otras actividades que pueden mejorar  la vida de sus familias, así ellas se sienten muy satisfechas y agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de ellas es la señora  María Rossana L. se dedica a la venta de mercaderías  varias como rapas , calzados, artículos de limpieza, útiles escolares y otras mercaderías, ella vende sus productos en su domicilio toda la familia colabora en la atención del negocio y los ingresos obtenidos ayuda mucho con los gastos de la casa comenta la señora Maria.
texts.en:
The El Rincón de las Amigas (The Girlfriends' Nook) is a committee that came about thanks to the enterprising spirit of the 15 women that compose it. Each works independently and with much enthusiasm according to her means. With help from their advisors, they follow good habits, like: making a family budget and setting aside savings, among others, that help them to improve family life. They are happy with and grateful to Fundación Paraguaya. One of the members is María Rossana L.. She sells general merchandise, like: clothing, shoes, cleaning supplies, school supplies, and others. She works from home and all of the family helps to tend to the business. Income obtained from it is a great help for her to meet household expenses, María tells us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, like: clothing, school supplies, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Priscillah Cherotich

texts.en:
Priscillah Cherotich M. is a forty year old woman who is married to Joshua Kirwa and is blessed with four (4) children, three in secondary school and one in primary school. She is a farmer who plants maize for resale and has been in the business for the last ten (10) years in Sergoit location in Eldoret. Most of her clients are her neighbors and others in Eldoret town.

Priscillah was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this will be her second loan. She will use the loan for planting maize in her farm by buying things like fertilizer and the seedlings.  

In future she hopes to diversify to rearing dairy cows and thus increase her income. This will enable her pay her children’s' school fees and to cater for the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: The loan will be used for planting maize

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.es: Martha Regina tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad pues siempre le ha gustado y además ha sido muy beneficiosa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a la venta de leche, cuajada, crema, queso y leche agria. Todos estos producto son muy solicitados por sus clientes, pues ellos aseguran que son de muy buena calidad. Esto motiva a Martha a realizar un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es poder establecer un negocio mucho más grande para ofertar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Martha Regina is 49 years old. She makes a living by selling dairy products. She has a lot of experience in this business, since she's always enjoyed it and it's been very profitable. For more than six years, she's been selling milk, curd, cream, cheese, and buttermilk. These are all in high demand by her customers, who say they're good-quality products. Because of this, Martha is requesting a loan that will provide working capital for her to buy raw ingredients. She wants to expand her business and be able to offer her products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La sra. Virginia trabaja desde el año 2007 con nuestra institución, ella tiene su restaurant ubicado en la zona de Villa Salome, tiene mucho tiempo en este rubro por lo que conoce bien acerca de esta actividad, su esposo tenía un salon de billar, pero lo vendió y abrieron otro restaurant en la zona de Pampahasi, al este de la ciudada de la paz 

En ambos locales les está yendo muy bien ya que son muy conocidos por la zona; tienen una pequeña hijita de 2 años y viven en la zona de Pampahasi (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.

La zona abarca 16 barrios en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia), aqui en la ciudad están los dos solos ya que sus familiares están en el campo,y van a visitarlos frecuentemente. El crédito que solicita ahora es para completar el saldo para tomar el local en anticrético y no pagar el alquiler cada mes. La Sra. Virginia es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia has been a client of our institution since 2007. She owns a restaurant in the Villa Salome area, a business that she has operated for some time and knows well. Her husband used to own a pool hall but he sold it and opened another restaurant in Pampahasi, a suburb east of La Paz. Both businesses are thriving because they are well known in their respective areas. The couple has a 2 year old daughter and they live in Pampahasi. Pampahasi, on the eastern side of La Paz, is considered both a residential neighborhood and a tourist destination. In the last nine years, the town has grown enormously and conditions for its 30,000 inhabitants have improved, as well. From the edge of the town, at the Segundo Cruce bridge near the border with Villa San Antonio, you can see impressive buildings of up to four floors with finished facades, along paved streets and wide avenues, lined with green lawns and open areas. The town has 16 neighborhoods in three zones: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Venus Fields) and Alto (Said-Crus Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cerveceria and La Guardia). It's here that the two live alone because their family is in the country. The loan that she is applying for will be used to buy the building where the restaurant operates (using a uniquely Bolivian form of property ownership). The purchase will allow her to avoid paying a monthly rent. Virginia is a responsible and hard-working person. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they've place in her by extending this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy building for restaurant business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda S. is a proud members of ASHI in Caniogan center of Rizal Central Branch (RCB). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been notably good in repayment and in attendance in center meetings. Erlinda joined ASHI to secure additional working capital for her sewing business. The business is still growing and therefore she is requesting a loan of 35,000 pesos to pay for an assortment of cotton and fabrics. Erlinda requests this loan through ASHI so that she can support the growth of her business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers. Without capital Erlinda’s business will not grow and she will not be able to give satisfactory service to her customers. Through the support of ASHI and Kiva, she hopes to see herself and her family someday improve their standard of living and move away from the ties of poverty. Erlinda is married to Marlon and is blessed with five children. Despite many challenges in her life, she never gave up fighting against poverty. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for an assortment of cotton and fabrics

loans.name: Arike

texts.en:
Arike is 37 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a pastor in one of the churches in Lagos where they reside.

Arike sells gold jewelry to earn her living and has been in the trade for fifteen years. From her profit from the business, she supports her husband in caring for their children’s living and education.

Arike wants to buy more gold jewelry and thus make more profit. She is asking for loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El Sr. René es una persona joven que se dedica al servicio de transporte con su taxi,  es muy conocido en su trabajo por que conoce muy bien varias zonas de la ciudad y de esta manera él puede ofrecer un buen servicio con su taxi. Su esposa, Elena, es enfermera y juntos tiene dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Ellos viven en la zona de alto Pampahasi (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.
La zona abarca 16 barrios en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Cuenta con 11 establecimientos educativos, uno de ellos privado, dos de convenio y el resto fiscales. Tiene tres mercados, de los cuales el principal es el 10 de Noviembre, ubicado en Pampahasi Central)
 la cual se encuentra a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Rene trabaja en esta actividad hace mas de cinco años. Solicita el credito para poder realizar la compra de una nueva caja de cambios para su taxi ya que a estado presentando algunos problemas recientes. El desea poder reparar su taxi lo antes posible para poder seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora.
texts.en:
René is a young taxi driver. He is very well known in his work because he knows the city’s various neighborhoods very well and can offer very good taxi service. His wife, Elena, is a nurse and they have two, school-aged children. They live in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood. (The Pampahasi area, located on the east side of the city, is considered to be a residential and tourist area. It has grown dramatically in the last nine years, which has meant improved living conditions for its approximately 30.000 residents). From the entrance to the area, a point called Segundo Cruce, abutting Villa San Antonio, one can see imposing buildings that are up to four storeys tall, many of them with finished facades, as well as wide, paved streets; added to this are planters and recreational areas. The area encompasses 16 neighborhoods in three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Cancha Venus) and Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA and La Guardia). It has 11 educational establishments: one private, two church run and the rest are public. It has three markets, the main one being 10 de Noviembre, located in Pampahasi Central, which is 20 minutes from city center. René has been in this line of work for more than five years. He is asking for funding to replace the transmission gear box on his taxi because it has had a few problems recently. He hopes to repair his taxi as soon as possible so that he can continue to work as he has done so to date.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité La Amistad del barrio Yka´a de la Fracción Las Abellanas de la ciudad de Luque, se formó gracias a que señoras de otro grupo de un barrio vecino, quien aprovecharon y se acesoran sobre el programa de la Fundación en cuanto al  comité de mujeres e invitaron a que formaran un nuevo comité en esa zona. 
De esta forma se inicia el comité La Amistad, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el décimo segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 17 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades.
Una de ellas es la señora Elva A.  quien tiene una despensa donde vende  todo tipo de artículos para la casa, de librería, para limpieza entre otros, su negocio es muy completo, y toda la familia ayuda de alguna manera para mantener y contar siempre con los ingresos del mismo ya que es fundamental por que de ella dependen todos los gastos de la casa y de los estudios de los hijos de la señora Elva.  El crédito que solicito lo invirtió en la compra de artículos que  faltaba en el negocio, de esa forma siempre cumple con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The La Amistad group, in the Yka´a community in the Fracción Las Avellanas neighborhood of Luque, Paraguay, formed when women from a group in another neighborhood heard about the foundation's program for women's groups and invited the members of La Amistad to establish a new group in that area. That's how the La Amistad group was formed. It's now in its 12th cycle with the Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras with the Fundación Paraguaya, and has 17 members engaged in different businesses. One of the members is Elva A., who has a shop where she sells all kinds of household goods, office supplies, cleaning products, etc. She has a little of everything, and the whole family helps in some way to keep it going and be able to count on that income. The business is essential, since Elva is responsible for all the household expenses and her children's educations. She will use the requested loan to buy some products for her business so she can always fulfill her customers' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, oil, flour, soft drinks, beer, baked goods, meats, fruits, charcoal, cloth, thread, yeast

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase clothing by special order

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: As a busy entrepreneur, Rosemarie has been making and selling doormats for almost two years. Her husband, Antonio, is also an entrepreneur in the community. To build her business, Rosemarie would like a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to increase her inventory of goods. She is planning to purchase additional products such as cotton, planel and other supplies. Rosemarie believes that offering a wide assortment of doormat products to customers will increase their daily income and maintain customer loyalty in the community. Rosemarie has been a committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2008. She is a model member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her business, and start a savings account for her children to support them until they finish studies in college. With hard work and determination, Rosemarie is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make doormats

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Maria tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 30 años. Por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar cada día. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado, pues han sido muy bien administrado en su negocio. Por lo que su actividad es muy importante para ella. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se acerca la semana santa y ella requiere comprar más producto al negocio, sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito, sus compras las realiza a camiones repartidores y en el mercado oriental. Sueña con mantener activo su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lesbia Maria has had a grocery store in her home for 20 years; she has striven always to improve daily. This isn't her first loan request; she has administered them in her business very well. Her activity is very important to her. She is asking for new funding to invest in stock for her store because Holy Week is approaching and she needs to buy more stock inventory. She sells both for cash and on credit. She buys her supplies from delivery trucks and in the Oriental market. She dreams with keeping her business active because it's her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos vive en la zona de alto san antonio en la parte periferica de la ciudad de la paz. Él esta casado con julia y juntos tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. El Sr. Carlos tiene una movilidad con la que trabaja como taxista. Él es una persona muy alegre y responsable con su familia y su trabajo ya que cada día se despierta muy temprano en la mañana y sale a trabajar con su taxi y se queda trabajando hasta muy tarde en la noche. Carlos llegó a nuestra institución hace varios años atrás y desde ese momento demostró ser responsable con sus pagos. Los créditos que sacó anteriormente los utilizó para ayudar a su esposa a poder abrir una venta de comida y de esa manera el y su esposa pueden aportar juntos para los ingresos de la casa. Unos de sus mas grandes deseos es poder ver a sus hijos profesionales. Ahora carlos quiere hacer unas reparaciones en su taxi y es por eso que solicita el préstamo.
Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the area of upper San Antonio in the part peripheral to the city of La Paz. He is married to a woman named Julia and together they have two school-aged children. Carlos works as a taxi driver. He is a very happy person and very responsible about his family and his job. Every day he wakes up very early in the morning to leave for work with his taxi and he works until very late in the night.

Carlos came to our institution several years ago and from that moment he has demonstrated that he is very responsible for his payments. The loans that he has taken out earlier were used to help his wife open a food store which allows her to help with the household income. One of their biggest dreams is for their children to become professionals. Now Carlos is asking for a loan to repair his taxicab.

He is very grateful to Emprender and Kive for their trust in giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cándida Rosa Venegas, es trabajadora de Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, vive en la Roberto González, es soltera no tiene hijos.
La señora Cándida Rosa solicito el crédito para comprar medicina de su mama ya que es una señora de edad y padece de la presión.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa Venegas is a cleaning woman employed by Chinandega's City Hall; she lives in the Roberto González neighborhood, is single and has no children. She requests funds to buy medicine for her mother, who is a senior citizen with high blood pressure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Amy Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Amy Diagne C. est une femme commerçante  de 46 ans qui habite dans la localité  de Bambilor. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis décembre  2009. Elle est mariée et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 3 et 23 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits maraichers et de poissons fumes.  Elle exerce cette activité  depuis plus de dix ans. Elle a démarré  ses activités commerciales après  son mariage avec la vente de pain. Sa préoccupation  était d’aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer. Elle sollicite un crédit de 25 000 frs destine a l’achat de  tomates  de haricots, et  de poissons fumes qu’elle va revendre. Pour madame C. ce prêt pourra l’aider a avoir une certaine stabilité financière  et  sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy Diagne C. is a 46-year-old retail merchant who lives in Bambilor. She has been a member of the local credit loan group since December 2009. She is married and has seven children, whose ages vary between three and 23 years. She has been actively selling garden vegetables and smoked fish for the past ten years. After getting married, she began her commercial activities by selling bread. Her concern was to help her husband manage household expenses. She is requesting a loan for 25,000 francs that will be used to buy tomatoes, green beans and smoked fish for resale. This loan will help Mrs. C. establish financial and social stability.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells groceries like toothpaste, milk, sugar and cream. She is 40 years old and married with three children who attend school. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because it is profitable for her. She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora confecciona buzos y chamarras deportivas para niños, que son comercializadas en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto; es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años, quien le ayuda en la confección de sus productos.

Vive en la casa de sus abuelos ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de la misma ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar materia prima (tela) para poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Dora.
texts.en:
Dora makes sportswear for children that she sells in the city of El Alto's 16 de Julio market; she is a single mother of a 17-year-old son, who helps her make the clothing. She lives in her grandparents' house, which is located in the 16 de Julio neighborhood of El Alto as well. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (fabric) in order to increase her income. This is her first Kiva loan; the evaluation we carried out indicates that Dora qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric to continue making children's sportswear.

loans.name: Calixtra De Jesus

texts.es: Calixtra De Jesús tiene 65 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Este no es el primer financiamiento que obtiene con Fundación León 2000, pues han sido las mejores opciones para mejorar su negocio. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, tan humilde pues siempre ha sido muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago pues los financiamientos son de mucha ayuda. Sus clientes siempre están pendientes de los diferentes productos que ofrece. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, aceite y detergentes. Sueña con ampliar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Calixtra De Jesús, 65, has a grocery store. She has had previous loans with Fundación León 2000 because this is her best option to improve her business. She has been in this very humble line of work for over 16 years and has always repaid her loans on time because they are of great use to her. Her customers are always aware of the various products she stocks. For this reason, she is asking for funds to buy beans, sugar, sweets, cooking oil and detergent. Her dream is to increase her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es madre soltera de tres hijos; es artesana en confección de calzados para damas que comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive en  casa alquilada ubicada en la zona Brasil de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para comprar material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillo) para terminar de construir su vivienda y así ya  no pagar alquiler.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Kiva y la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a single mother of three children; she is a craftsperson, who manufactures women's shoes for sale in El Alto's popular markets. She lives in a rented house in the Brasil neighborhood of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy building materials (sand, cement, bricks) to finish building her house so that she won't have to rent anymore. This is her second Kiva loan and the evaluation carried out indicates that she is qualified for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
El  señor Francisco José B. T. es  trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, como Vigilante ubicado en el mercado bisne es casado, tiene tres hijos todos bajo su cargo vive junto a su familia en el barrio Gerardo Aguilera de Chinandega
  
El señor Francisco B. tiene dos años de trabajar con créditos los que le han ayudado para el desarrollo de su familia y condiciones estables cabe señalar que el señor Francisco en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisco José B. T. is employed by the city of Chinandega as a watchman in the Bisne market; he's married and has three children under his care. The family live in Chinandega's Gerardo Aguilera neighborhood. Francisco has had loans for two years that have helped him support his family and provide stability; it is important to point out that all this time he has shown himself to be an honest and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette D. pratique une double activité  de vente d’haricot et  tomate comme activité primaire et de pain comme activité  secondaire. Elle est âgée de 37 ans et habite dans la localité  de Bambilor. Elle est mariée  et mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 mois et 15 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Elle a plus de 15 ans d’expérience dans son activité. C’est juste après  son mariage qu’elle a commence à s’occuper pour éviter une dépendance totale envers son mari. Et elle a trouve son activité assez importante dans la mesure où  elle lui permet de satisfaire une partie de ses besoins. Elle emprunte une somme de 50 000 frs qui sera utilise pour l’achat de haricots, de tomates et de pomme de terre destines a la vente. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire d’avantage ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette D. sells green beans and tomatoes as her main activity and bread as a secondary activity. She is 37 years old and lives in Bambilor. She is married and has six children whose ages vary between seven months and 15 years. She has been a member of the Bambilor credit loan group since January 2010. She has acquired over 15 years’ experience in her business, which she started just after getting married, to avoid becoming entirely dependent upon her husband. She finds that her activity is rather important in that she can satisfy part of her needs. She is borrowing 50,000 francs which will serve to buy green beans, tomatoes and potatoes for resale. This loan will allow her to satisfy a larger portion of her family’s needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel vive en la zona Río Seco  D, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Actualmente vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija.
 
Miguel trabaja en una empresa  en la que desempeña el cargo de lector de medidores domiciliarios de agua en determinados sectores de  la ciudad. 

El crédito lo destinará  al pago de pensiones de un instituto de formación profesional, ya que el quiere continuar con sus estudios superiores.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro y segundo vía kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in the Río Seco D neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He currently lives in his parents' house, together with his wife and their little daughter. Miguel works for a company where he has the job of reading home water meters in specific parts of the city. The loan will be used to pay tuition for a professional training institute, since Miguel would like to continue his higher education. This is his second loan with Impro and his second through Kiva; the evaluation carried out shows that he is qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying tuition at a professional training institute to continue his studies

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La Sra. Doris se dedica a la venta de ropa en la feria 16 de Julio (La feria 16 de Julio es mucho más que comercio. Asomarse a ella es adentrarse en la cosmovisión andina, donde se vive la ritualidad de las actividades comerciales del mundo Aymara. Por las calles, es común escuchar el “rebajame, aumentame”, formas centenarias de entrar en este espacio particular y que de ninguna manera se manejan en un supermercado u otros espacios. La feria 16 de Julio es una recreación de los “Colqa” o tambos de la época colonial, que eran una especie de almacenes de alimentos por donde circulaban gran cantidad de productos.
Sin embargo, el verdadero origen de este mercado se remonta a los años 60, cuando las calles que hoy se ven repletas tenían escasos puestos, que casi se podían contar con los dedos de las manos. El auge comenzó más tarde, durante la década de los 80, cuando una fuerte crisis económica asoló el país y hubo un despido general de mineros y empleados públicos. La gente tuvo que buscar sustentos donde se podía. Fue entonces cuando muchos vieron en el mercado una buena forma de salir adelante) de la ciudad de el alto. Esta feria tiene lugar los días jueves y domingo, pero esta feria es la mas grande de esta ciudad. Su esposo, Juan, trabaja con un minibus como servicio de transporte y esta afiliado al sindicato de transportes Miraflores. Ellos viven en la zona de Pampahasi  (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.
La zona abarca 16 barrios en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Cuenta con 11 establecimientos educativos, uno de ellos privado, dos de convenio y el resto fiscales. Tiene tres mercados, de los cuales el principal es el 10 de Noviembre, ubicado en Pampahasi Central)
la cual se encuentra a 20 minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ellos tienen un hijo que esta en edad escolar. Doris compra la ropa por fardos, ya que es ropa a medio uso, cada fardo tiene de 100 a 200 unidades de las cuales ella las separa en tres grupos, las de primera calidad, las de segunda calidad y el resto que es de remate. Doris trabaja con la venta de ropa hace mas de once año y ahora ella anhela ver a su hijo como un profesional. Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar doce fardos de ropa.

La Sra. Doris esta muy Agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del cedito.
texts.en:
Doris sells clothing in the 16 de Julio market. The 16 de Julio market is much more than a market. To take a look inside is to get a world view of Andean life where the commercial rituals of the Aymara world is in full view. It is not unusual to hear along the streets the “rebajame,” “aumentame,” (a little less, a little more), age-old ways of entering this particular space which would never be seen in a supermarket or other commercial space. The 16 de Julio market is a recreation of the “Colga”or “Tambos” of the Colonial era, which were a type of food warehouse wherein a great quantity of products circulated. However, the real origin of this market goes back to the 1960s when the streets seen now full of sales stands had few; they could be counted with the fingers. Its growth spurt happened in the 1980s when a severe economic crisis devastated the country and there were general dismissals of miners and public employees. People had to find ways to support themselves any way they could. That was when many of them recognized the market as a good way to get ahead in the city of El Alto. This market takes place on Thursday and Sunday and is the largest in the city. Her husband, Juan, drives a minibus and is a member of the Miraflores transportation union. They live in the Pampahasi neighborhood. (Pampahasi is located on the eastern side of the city; it’s considered to be a residential and tourist area. In the last nine years it has had dramatic growth, which has meant improved living conditions for its approximately 30.000 residents). From the entrance to the area, a point called Segundo Cruce, abutting with Villa San Antonio, one can see imposing buildings, up to four storeys tall, many with finished facades. Streets are wide and paved and there are flower planters and recreational areas. The zone encompasses 16 neighborhoods in three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Cancha Venus) and Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería and La Guardia). It has 11 educational establishments: one private, two church run and the rest public. It has three markets, the main one being 10 de Noviembre, located in Pampahasi Central, which is 20 minutes from city center. Doris buys clothes in bundles since it is semi-used. Each bundle has between 100 and 200 items, which she sorts into three groups: first quality, second quality, and bargain. Doris has sold clothes for over 11 years and now dreams of seeing her son become a professional; they have a son who is of school age. She is asking for funds to buy 12 bundles of clothes. Doris is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Maria Vanessa

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el sector Fundo Santo Tomas de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio. María cría patos, pavos, gallinas y cerdos para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Ella nos comenta que este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economia de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero eventual y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio tiene mucho exito, ya que María pone mucho empeño y dedicación al trabajo que realiza, los animales que cría tienen buena calidad y los negociantes pagan un buen precio por ellos. Maria ha estado invirtiendo las ganancias en hacer mejoras en su vivienda, ya que las continuas lluvias que se han presentado en la zona han hecho que la estructura de esta se debilite.

María desea terminar de hacer la mejoras en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos que piensa utilizar en la compra de de material para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una joven bastante responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una mujer de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María, 23, lives with her husband and son in the Fundo Santo Tomas neighborhood of the city of Lambayeque, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years she has raised small farm animals at home. She raises turkeys, ducks, chickens and pigs that she sells to various merchants that visit the area regularly. She tells us that this business is of great use to the family’s economy because her husband is employed sporadically as a laborer and his income isn’t sufficient to meet all family expenses. The business is very successful because María puts much effort and dedication into it; her animals are of good quality and the merchants pay good prices for them. María has been investing her profits in home improvements because the non-stop rains that the area has had have weakened the structure. María would like to finish the improvements to her home but lacks sufficient capital to do so. Therefore, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1500 new sol loan to buy building materials and supplies for this purpose. She is quite a responsible young woman who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a trustworthy woman. Her greatest desire is to provide her son with a quality education that will guarantee him a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luz Del Alba Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Senkata se encuentra en la periferie de la ciudad de El Alto. Se podría decir que es uno de los más alejados, esta situación dio lugar a que  pudiera acoger a la asociación “Luz del Alba”.   Esta asociación comunal se formó en una Urbanización nueva que aún no cuenta con servicios de luz y agua.  Las socias refieren que otras instituciones no quieren darles crédito, desconfían de ellas y ellas a su vez se ven limitadas por que no pueden capitalizarse e impulsar sus negocios.  

Los negoción que declararon las socias son: costura de polleras y mantas, comercio de dulces, repostería, venta de condimentos, venta de huevos, tienda de barrio y fotocopiadora.

La señora Janett M., casada, con dos hijos pequeños indica que tiene el negocio de elaboración de mantas y polleras. Aprendió ayudándole a su cuñada y actualmente trabaja con ella.  
En su caso elabora las prendas a pedido, indica que generalmente los grupos de personas (llamadas comparsas) le solicitan vestuario para bailar en fechas festivas (aniversarios de  zonas de la ciudad,  sindicatos), entonces ella se encarga desde la compra de la tela, la costura de polleras y mantas  y el macramé de las mantas. Las polleras y mantas tienen que ser iguales para todas las mujeres que bailan en la comparsa y los colores y diseños deben ser diferentes cada año.  Es por eso que cada artesano  se esmera mucho con sus clientes y requiere de un capital importante para elaborar estas prendas.

“Luz del Alba” está conformada  por 9 integrantes, el varón que sale en la foto con el bebé, es esposo de la señora de chompa y pantalón beis (la que se encuentra a su lado).
texts.en:
The Senkata focal center is located in El Alto’s outskirts; one could say that it is one of the furthest. This situation led to it’s being able to take in the “Luz del Alba” (Dawn’s Light) association. This communal association was organized in a new housing area that still does not have electricity or running water. The members have stated that no other financial institution was willing to extend them credit, or to trust them. They, on the other hand, are limited because they are unable to have capital or develop their businesses. The members are in a variety of commercial activities, such as: shirt and skirt making, candy sales, pastry making, sale of spices, egg sales, neighborhood grocery store, and photocopy services. Janett M., married and the mother of two children, tells us that she has a skirt and shirt-making shop. She learned these skills by helping her sister-in-law and they currently work together. She works based on prior orders. She indicates that usually groups called ‘comparsas’ (theater or dance troupe) request traditional costumes to dance at special events (municipal anniversaries, labor union special days, etc.) She then must buy fabric and make the shirts and skirts as well as the macramé trim for the skirts. The shirts and skirts must all be identical for every woman that dances in the troupe and the color and design must be different from year to year. This is why each artisan puts in so much effort for her customers and why a significant amount of capital is required to make these costumes. “Luz del Alba” is made up of 9 members. The man carrying the baby in the photo is the husband of the woman wearing the beige sweater and pants seated next to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, lining and trims for shirts and skirts.

loans.name: Francisco Higinio

texts.es: Francisco Higinio tiene 55 años, por lo que él se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años, por lo que anteriormente él se dedicaba a la agricultura y la ganadería ya que estos negocios no le generaban un ingreso mensual y necesitaba algo que le pudiera proporcionar a su familia un ingreso diario pues sus 2 hijos estudian y necesita proporcionarles los recursos necesarios. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y productos de limpieza para el hogar. Su deseo es obtener una mejor fama para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco Higinio, 55, has had a grocery store for over 11 years. He used to be a farmer and cattleman but these activites did not produce sufficient monthly income and he needed to do something that would produce enough daily income for his family. He has two children, who are still students, and for whom he must provide all the required resources. He will use the loan to buy stock items for his store, like: basic grains, snacks, detergents, home cleaning supplies. His wish is to acquire a better reputation among his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan, vive la zona Villa San José de Yunguyo, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El esta separado de su esposa hace bastante tiempo, vive junto a sus hijos en una casita en alquiler.
 
Se dedica junto a sus hijos en  la confección  de chamarras de cuero y billeteras, los cuales los vende al por mayor a sus clientes en las diferentes tiendas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de cuero y otras materias primas para su producción.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro y tercero vía Kiva; la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Froilan lives in El Alto's Villa San José de Yunguyo neighborhood. He has been separated from his wife for quite some time; he lives with his children in a small rented house. With help from his children, he makes leather jackets and wallets, which he sells at wholesale to various stores in the city. He will use the funds to buy leather and other raw materials for his shop. This is his 4th loan with Impro and 3rd through Kiva; the evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather.

loans.name: Marcelina Lilliam

texts.es:
La Señora Marcelina Lilliam B. C., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega  se desempeña como Secretaria, Habita en la comarca  San Benito, es Acompañada tiene 3 hijos , pero solo uno depende de ella , los otros dos ya trabajan por su cuenta.

La Señora Marcelina Lilliam B. C., solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya necesitaba sacar su cocina a una parte del patio para tener más espacio dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Marcelina works as a secretary for the Chinandega municipality and lives in the San Betino neighborhood. She has three children, but only one still depends on her. The others work and support themselves. Marcelina requested this loan in order to make modifications to her home. She needed to move her kitchen to an outdoor part of her patio in order to have more room within.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr: Madame Khoudia N. est une vendeuse d’huile de palme, d’arachide et d’haricots au marche de Bambilor. Elle est âgée de 25 ans et membre de la caisse depuis novembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère  de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 6 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Elle exerce son activité  depuis 2000.Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat des produits qu’elle commercialise. C’est après  son mariage qu’elle  a pense a exercer cette activité  pour pouvoir soutenir son mari dans la gestion du foyer conjugal. Ce crédit qui est son deuxième  au sein de l’institution va lui permettre d’augmenter ses  revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khoudia N. retails palm oil, peanut oil and green beans at the Bambilor market. She is 25 years old and a member of the credit loan group since November 2009. She is married and mother of two children, aged three and six. She has been active in retail since 2000, and has already been granted one previous loan. She is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs to buy the products she retails. She thought of this activity after getting married, as a means to assist her husband in managing household expenses. This second loan from the institution will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  vive, en la zona San Roque, ubicada en una zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada vive en su casa propia, junto a su padre y su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil en diferentes lugares de la ciudad.

Trabaja  en la venta de pan, que ella misma elabora en su pequeño horno artesanal, el cual se encuentra ubicado  en su domicilio. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción(ladrillo refractario, cemento, etc.) para realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su horno ya que por esta época de lluvias hubo un deterioro en la parte de paredes y techo. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Justina lives in the San Roque neighborhood which is located in suburbs of the city of El Alto. She is married and lives in her own home together with her father and her husband. Her husband is a construction worker who works all over the city. Justina sells bread that she makes in a small artisanal oven located in her home. The loan is destined for the acquisition of construction materials (bricks, heat-resistant materials, cement, etc.) to make improvements to the infrastructure of the oven since it’s the rainy season and there has been deterioration in the walls and roof. This is her second loan with Impro; our evaluation has qualified her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy heat-resistant bricks, cement, and other materials to repair the oven she uses to bake bread.

loans.name: Farolitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Farolitos”  esta representado por la señora Bertha Maxima y conformada por 10 D. las cuales solo hay 1 miembros varones y el retos esta conformado por mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Bertha Maxima  que es la presidenta del grupo está casada su esposo se llama Gregorio ambos tienen 3 hijos que  van al colegio, la hija mayor vive D. forma independiente conformando su propio hogar, El señor Gregorio trabaja como chofer D. mini bus en las cuidad D. El Alto  para poder mantener a su familia, viven en una pequeña casa por la cual pagan un alquiler,  las expectativas D. Bertha Maxima y su esposo son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase una casa, ella se dedica  a la venta D. mantas artesanales y desea poder agrandar su mercadería para obtener un mejor ingreso que pueda ser útil para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría se dedica a  diferentes actividades como venta D. ropa (para niños, accesorios, lencería) ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, una socia se dedica a la venta D. material D. escritorio otras son vendedoras D. comida. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, para la compra D. Insumos, materiales y mercadería para ampliar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos permitiendo darles un hogar mas estable a sus familias. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su segundo ciclo en la cual han demostrado responsabilidad y honestidad para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group “Farolitos” is represented by Mrs. Bertha Maxima and maD. up of 10 members, only one of whom is a man. This bank is characterized by being very united and happy. Mrs. Bertha Maxima, the group’s president is married. Her husband’s name is Gregorio. They have three children who are in high school. Their eldest daughter lives on her own in her own home. Mr. Gregorio works as a mini-bus driver in the city of El Alto to maintain his family. They live in a small rented house. Bertha Maxima and her husband hope to grow, bit by bit, and be able to buy a home.
