She sells artisan blankets for a living and would like to be able to increase her merchandise and earn a better income which would be useful for improving her children’s quality of life. The rest of the group have different businesses like selling clothing (for children, accessories, lingerie) either by foot or in fixed stalls. One member sells writing materials, others sell food. In general, the group has a lot of experience with the businesses they do and this is why they are known in the fairs where they sell their products. Even though competition is pretty high in general, the group can count in its' experience and also on regular customers who know their work and require their services. On the other hand, the enthusiasm they have for what they do is important. This loan will be used for working capital to purchase ingredients, materials, and merchandise to increase their sales and improve their incomes. This will allow them to proviD. more stable homes for their families. The group hopes to continue working and above all with financing to help them achieve their goals. This bank has ample experience with loans since this is not the first time they have applied for a loan. For example, this is the second time around they proved themselves responsible and honest so they can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive, en la zona villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa Marcela y su familia que consta de tres hijos mayores y sus respectivas familias.

Es rentista jubilado de una institución estatal.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción para realizar algunas mejoras en las habitaciones y techos de su domicilio, ya que por esta época constante de lluvias ha ocasionado que el techo de su habitación tenga filtraciones de agua y necesite urgentemente un cambio parcial de calamina (calamina es una hoja de aluminio que se usa comúnmente para techar habitaciones).
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Villa Exaltación neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He lives together with his wife, Marcela, and his family which is made up of three older children and their respective families. He is a renter who retired from a state institution. The loan is destined for the acquisition of construction materials to make some improvements to his home including the rooms and the roof. It’s the rainy season and the constant rain has caused leaks in the roof in his bedroom. He urgently needs to partially change the corrugated roof (“calamina” is a sheet of aluminum that is commonly used for roofing). This is his first loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of corrugated tin roof and other materials to repair his home's roof.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora María Auxiliadora U. M. , es trabajadora de la Alcaldía desempaña el cargo de operaria de limpieza, Habita en la Reparto la Florida, es soltera y con 4 hijos todos viven con ella , de los cuales dos ya trabajan y cuenta con el  apoyo económico de ellos.

La Señora María Auxiliadora U. , solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya que necesita brindarles a sus hijos un hogar digno y seguro a sus hijos, a pesar que es madre soltera ha sido emprendedora y sacado adelante a sus hijos, lleva ya 5 créditos con ceprodel y ha sido bien responsable.
texts.en:
Maria works as a cleaning woman for the city hall. She lives in Reparto la Florida, and is the single mother of four children, all of whom live with her. Two of them work and she relies on their economic support as well. She requested this loan so that she could repair her house, so that she would be able to give her children a safe and dignified home. Even though she is a single mother, she has been very entrepreneurial. She has had 5 previous loans through CEPRODEL and has been very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Ndieme Rosalie Ale

texts.fr: Madame Ndieme F. est une femme de 41 ans, sociétaire  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Elle exerce l’activité  de vente de légumes  au marche de Bambilor depuis 2005. Elle a choisi l’activité   pour ne pas rester oisive et aussi éviter la dépendance  totale vis-à-vis de son mari. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat d’un kiosque ou elle pourra vendre du mil de l’arachide et autres produits locaux dans l’objectif de diversifier ses produits vendus. Ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité  de commerce grâce a laquelle elle parvient a avoir une indépendance  financière. Son objectif final avec l’accroissement de ses revenus est d’acquerir des biens mobiliers et immobiliers.
texts.en:
Ndieme F. is 41 years old, and member of the Bambilor credit loan branch since January 2010. She has been selling vegetables at the Bambilor market since 2005. She chose this activity to avoid idleness and total dependence on her husband. She is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs with the aim of buying a kiosk where she will be able to sell millet, peanuts and other local products, and thus widen the range of products she sells. This loan will allow her to reinforce a commercial activity which brings her financial independence. Her final objective, as her earnings increase, will be to make investments and acquire real estate.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Amistad Rsr. Group

texts.es: El grupo “Amistas rsr” esta representado por la señora Maria y conformado por 11 socios D. los cuales 4 son miembros varones y el retos esta conformado por mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Maria  que es la presidenta del grupo está casada su esposo se llama Jorge ambos tienen 1 hijo el  cual va al colegio, su esposo trabaja como chofer D. radio taxi  en las cuidad D. La Paz  para poder mantener a su familia, viven en una pequeña casa que comparte con sus hermanos,  las expectativas D. Maria y su esposo son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase un terreno para tener su propio hogar, Maria se dedica  a la venta D. Electrodomésticos en el mercado y requiere el préstamo para la adquisición D. mercadería. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría se dedica a  diferentes actividades como venta D. ropa (para niños, accesorios, lencería) ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, una socia se dedica a la venta y confección D. redes para arcos otras son vendedoras D. comida, celulares y artículos D. ferretería. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más insumos, mercadería y otros modernizaran sus puestos D. venta con herramientas para agilizar su trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución en el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad y honradez en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The “Amistad RSR” group is represented by María and maD. up of 11 members; four men and 7 women; this bank is noted for being very united and cheerful. María, who is group president, is married to Jorge; they have a son, who is in school. Her husband works as a radio dispatch taxi driver in La Paz to support the family. They live in a small house that they share with her siblings. María’s and her husband’s expectations is to gradually grow so that they can buy a small lot to have their own home. María sells home appliances in the market and needs funds to buy stock inventory items. The other group members are in a variety of commercial activities, such as: clothing sales (for children, accessories, lingerie) either door-to-door or in fixed stands. One member makes and sells nets for arches and others sell food, cell phones and hardware items. The group as a whole has quite a bit of experience in the various businesses they run and are well known in the markets where they sell their wares. Although competition is widespread the group has both the experience and the regular customer base that recognizes their work and asks for their services; on the other hand, the enthusiasm with which they do their work is noteworthy. The current loan will be used for working capital. Some will buy more ingredients and merchandise; others will modernize their sales stands with tools that will facilitate their work. The group’s expectation is to continue working and, above all, continue to count on financing to reach their goals. The bank has quite a bit of credit history since this isn’t the first loan they have gotten. The present loan, for example, is the second one with our institution and they have demonstrated responsibility and honesty in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and work tools.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal  vive, en la zona Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y su sobrina, puesto que sus hijos son mayores de edad y por lo tanto formaron sus propias familias y se fueron a vivir en otras zonas.

Es jubilado rentista de un centro minero.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillo) para continuar con la construcción de su vivienda.
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives in El Alto's Villa Exaltación neighborhood with his wife and niece; his children are all adults and have their own families living in other parts of the city. He is a retired miner. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies (cement, sand, bricks) to continue building his house. This is his first loan with Impro; the evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Oñondivepa” se formó con la unión varias vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes constituyen un grupo muy solido y organizado.V
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante, con la ayuda de una asistencia financiera permanente.
Una de ellas es la señora Hermelinda quien se dedica a la venta ropas, ella compra sus mercaderías del mercado 4 de la ciudad de Asunción, y luego recorre por los negocios de la Ciudad de Villa Elisa para ofrecer sus productos, el recorrido es muy sacrificado por que tiene que llevar toda sus mercaderías y ella no posee móvil.
Hay días con mucha venta y otros que no,  pero los ingresos me ayudan bastante con los gastos de la casa y es muy importante para mi comenta la señora Hermelinda, por ello pidió el crédito con el fin de renovar sus mercaderías. Ella invirtió en la compra de remeras, pantalones, camisas.
texts.en:
The “Oñondivepa” committee was organized when various neighbors from Villa Elisa got together. All the group members are involved in independent commercial activities, like sales. They are a very solid and organized group. All of the group members are mothers who are involved in a variety of activities designed to strengthen family economy and develop their businesses in a sustainable way aiming at consistent growth with permanent financial assistance. One of the members is Hermelinda, who sells clothing. She buys her merchandise in Asunción’s Mercado 4 and then visits businesses in Villa Elisa to offer her products. This is exhausting work because she must carry all her wares and she does not have a vehicle. Some days sales are very good; others, not so much so. However, income from the sales helps her quite a bit with household expenses and Hermelinda states that this is very important to her. For this reason, she asked for funding to renew her stock. She used the funds to buy t-shirts, pants and shirts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal CAMINANDO JUNTAS, se esta reestructurando con otro nombre y empezando como nuevas, antes (Crecer Juntas). Está conformado por 8 clientes, 7 mujeres y 1 varon, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi (La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.
La zona abarca 16 barR. en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Cuenta con 11 establecimientos educativos, uno de ellos privado, dos de convenio y el resto fiscales. Tiene tres mercados, de los cuales el principal es el 10 de Noviembre, ubicado en Pampahasi Central), que están ubicados bajando tres cuadras de la oficina de Emprender, las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, mantillas, colchas, venta de tucumanas, condimentos y otros. En el anterior ciclo todas cancelaron a excepción de dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 

La Sra. Alejandra  Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de mantillas en la misma zona cuenta con esta actividad hace mas de 20 años, asimismo fue cliente de emprender en grupo solidario hace 2 años, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión de mercadera de mantillas.  Es viuda  y vive con su hijo (mayor de edad, En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Juana Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta de condimentos en la zona de Pampahasi se dedica a esta actividad hace 4 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra condimentos por mayor. La socia es Viuda y mantiene dos hijos. La Señora Juana es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco y conduce por un buen camino a sus compañeras. 

La Sra. Modesta, activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la  venta de colchas en la zona de San Antonio. El préstamo esta destinado para la inversión de mas colchas de todos los tamaños y colores. Vive en la casa de sus padres  y esta concubina (no estan casados)con el señor Javier  que trabaja como chofer mecánico en el sindicato Simón Bolívar, tiene un hijo.
texts.en:
The "CAMINANDO JUNTAS" (Walking Together) communal bank is reorganizing itself under a new name. It was previously known as "Crecer Juntas" (Growing Together). It is made up of eight members, seven ladies and one gentleman. Most of the members live in the Pampahasi zone, located on the east side of the city, and known for being a residential and tourist neighborhood. Over the past nine years the area has undergone a vigorous development, which translated into better living conditions for its approximately 30,000 residents. From the entrance to the zone, the point known as "Segundo Cruce" (Second Crossing), the border with Villa San Antonio, one notices important buildings up to four stories tall. Many of them have been completed. There are also paved streets and wide avenues, gardens, and recreation areas. The zone includes 16 neighborhoods and three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). There are 11 schools, one private, two covenant schools, and the rest public schools. There are three markets, the main one is called "el 10 de Noviembre" (November 10th), located in central Pampahasi. They are located three blocks from our Emprender office. The members sell different products, such as frocks, bedspreads, empanadas, condiments and other things. In the past all repaid their loans, with the exception of two people who paid with their bank savings. Alejandra is in charge and the president of the bank. She sells frocks in the zone and has been doing this for 20 years. She worked with Emprender two years ago and will use the money from this loan to invest in frock items. She is a widow and lives with her adult son. She has distinguished herself as being a very responsible person within her communal bank, with a reputation for being on time with her payments. Juana is the treasurer. She sells condiments in the Pampahasi zone and has been doing this for the past four years. She will use the money from this loan to buy condiments in bulk. She is a widow with two children to support. Juana is one of the communal banks representatives who was elected because of her demonstrated responsibility and good relationship with the other members. Modesta is an active and dynamic member who serves as the Secretary. She sells bedspreads in the San Antonio zone. She will use the money from this loan to buy more bedspreads of various colors and sizes. She cohabitates with Javier in her parents' home, but is not married. Javier works as a maintenance driver for the Simón Bolívar union. She has one son.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cosmos Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cosmos rsr” esta representado por la señora Maria Antonieta y conformado por 11 socios D. los cuales 3 son miembros varones y el retos esta conformado por mujeres, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y alegre. La señora Maria Antonieta  que es la presidenta del grupo está casada, su esposo se llama Florencio ambos tienen 4 hijos que  van al colegio, la hija mayor vive D. forma independiente, el señor Florencio trabaja como electricista que tiene su propio taller en su hogar en la cuidad D. El Alto  para poder mantener a su familia, viven en una pequeña casa que les pertenece a sus padres,  las expectativas D. Maria Antonieta y su esposo son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase una casita y formar un hogar mas independiente, la señora Maria Antonieta se dedica a la venta D. carne D. res y pollo en el mercado zonal D. su barrio. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, como la venta D. ropa  (mantas, deportiva, lencería) ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, uno socios se tiene su pequeño taller D. cerrajería, otras son vendedoras D. comida, lubricantes, telas y cosméticos. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, unos comprarán más productos, otros comprarán víveres. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la s vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución en el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad y honradez en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The group “Cosmos rsr” is represented by Mrs. Maria Antonieta and it consists of 11 members, out of which, three are men and the rest are women. This group is characterized for its unity and joy. Mrs. Maria Antonieta, the group’s president, is married to Florencio and they have four children who are still in school. The eldest daughter lives by herself. Mr. Florencio works as an electrician and has a workshop insiD. his home. They live in a small house owned by his parents and it’s located in the city of El Alto. Maria Antonieta and Florencio hope to grow their businesses to be able to buy a house of their own and be more independent. Maria Antonieta sells beef and chicken at the local neighborhood market. The others in the group have different kinds of businesses, such as, selling clothes (blankets, sports clothes, lingerie) at market kiosks or on the street. One of the members has a locksmith shop; others sell food, lubricants, fabrics and cosmetics. They all have significant experience in their businesses and have established reputations in the markets where they sell their products. Although there’s ample competition, the group’s experience and enthusiasm make their loyal customers recognize and demand their work. The loan they are requesting will be used to buy products and supplies for their businesses. The group expects to continue to work hard to be able to reach their goals. This is the group’s second loan with this institution and they have a lot of credit experience with other institutions as well. They are very honest and have been very responsible with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian vive en la zona  Ballivián de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en casa de sus padres, aun es soltero.

Es un joven emprendedor, tiene una pequeña oficina donde ofrece servicios de empleo a gente de escasos recursos en su mayoría.
Con el primer y segundo  crédito amobló y amplio su oficina ubicada en la principal zona comercial de la ciudad.
 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mercadería electrónica (especialmente radios y dvd players) ya que desea ampliar  la oferta de servicios en su oficina.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristian lives in El Alto's Ballivián neighborhood; he is single and lives with his parents. He is an enterprising young man. He has a small office where he offers employment services mostly to low-income people. He used his first and second loans to furnish and enlarge his office, which is in the city's main commercial zone. This loan will be used to buy electronic items (especially radios and dvd players) because he wants to diversify the range of services offered in his office. This is his third loan with Impro; the evaluation conducted indicates that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy radios and DVD players.

loans.name: María Maura

texts.es:
La Señora María Maura A., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega  se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, Habita en la Colonia Roberto González, es Acompañada tiene 4 hijos  pero solo 2 dependen de ella y están en edad escolar.

La María Maura A., solicito crédito  para reparar su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno y necesita acondicionarla para que no se le pase el agua.
texts.en:
María works as a cleaning lady in the Chinandega city hall and lives in Colonia Roberto González. She has four children, but only two are school-aged and still depend on her for support. She requested this loan in order to make repairs to her home, now that winter is approaching. She needs to seal it so that it will not leak.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells groceries like toothpaste, milk, sugar and cream. She is 40 years old and married with three children who attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the family. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves this business because it is profitable to her. She has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosibel Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz Rosibel tiene 60 años, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Ella tiene más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad y seguir adelante con este medio de vida. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado mejora su condición de vida. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, calcetines. Su deseo es mejorar su condición de vida para seguir proporcionándoles a sus hijos la educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Beatriz Rosibel, 60, has three children in her care. She has been a clothing merchant for over 6 years. She has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life through this activity. She has always liked to improve her living standard. She is asking for funding to buy pants, shirts, underwear, socks. Her wish is to improve her living standard and to continue to provide her children with the necessary education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Saer

texts.fr: Monsieur Saer D. est un jeune menuisier métallique  de 24 ans qui vit dans la localité  de Sangalkam. Il a choisi cette  activité  pour avoir quitte l’ecole un peu tôt.  Il a commence par être apprenti a partir de 1998. C’est en 2005 que son père lui a cédé la gestion de l’activité. Et avec les profits qu’il gagne il parvient à satisfaire ses besoins de responsable de famille. Monsieur D. est célibataire  mais il a en charge deux de ses parents. Il sollicite un crédit d 400 000 frs dans le but de diversifier son activité  et de démarrer  le traitement de l’aluminium. Son objectif est d’acheter une machine de coupe, d’une perceuse et d’un appareil  silicone.  L’obtention de ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter  sa clientèle  et par conséquent  d’accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Mr Saer D. is a 24 year-old metalworker who lives in the Sangalkam area. He chose this line of work after leaving school at an early age, and began by becoming an apprentice in 1998. Then, in 2005 his father handed over management of the business to him. Saer uses the profits earned in order to meet his family's needs; he is single, but looks after his parents. He is seeking a 400 000 frs loan in order to diversify his business and to start working with aluminium. His aim is to purchase a metal cutting machine, a drill and a silicon device. By receiving this loan he would be able to increase his customer base, and consequently his profits.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Cristo La Fuente 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Dania is the coordinator of her group Cristo La Fuente (Christ the Source), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically based around sugarcane, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Dania is excited to be taking her fourth loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her mobile business selling clothing by traveling to the Capital to purchase merchandise such as blouses and blue jeans to sell. 

She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing them school supplies as well as saving towards her goal of one day having a store from which she can sell her clothes. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Modou Gadiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois.  Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga  N.  est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs.  Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans.
Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à  Notto  de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique.
  Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait.  En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès  son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment  où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce.  Cette activité, dit-il,  lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur.
 C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit  il va constater son revenu augmenté.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou Gadiaga N. is 45 years old, married and father of five children, of which the eldest is 25 and the youngest four months old. He also takes charge of his half-sisters. His main activity is retail commerce which he embarked on ten years ago. His secondary activity is vegetable gardening, which is quite developed in Notto, due to its privileged position in the Niayes area of Senegal. The area is rather unique, characterized by dunes and depressions often flooded by an overflowing water table, and a favourable climate. This environment was certainly attractive to the population and gave the whole region its agronomic vocation. Mr. N. has practiced vegetable gardening for the past 20 years, influenced by his father who had the same activity. In fact, Mr. N. started helping his father in his gardening work from an early age. He eventually took the initiative to develop his own commercial activity, which allowed him to develop relations with the outside world. When U-IMCEC opened a branch office in 2009 to help producers in the area, Mr. N. became a member and is now requesting a first loan for 50,000 FCFA. He wants to buy bags of vegetables (potatoes,…) he will resell at the market. He expects that his earnings will increase thanks to this loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies of vegetables for retail

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Monsefu, una zona que es conocida por dos actividades principales: la artesania y la panaderia, este lugar esta ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años es propietario de una panadería. El nos comenta que se inició en el rubro trabajando como ayudante en diversas panaderias de la ciudad y que con sus ahorros pudo comprar poco a poco los materiales que necesitaba para instalar su propio negocio. Actualmente el prepara diversos productos y los distribuye en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos económicos por lo que da lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio preparando mas productos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos (leña, harina, azúcar) para realizar su objetivo.

El es un joven bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona bastante responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es poder implementar a su panaderia con la preparación y distribucion de pasteles.
texts.en:
Luis, 36, is single and lives with his mother in the Monsefú district, an area famous for its two main activities: crafts and baking. This place is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has had a bakery for the last 5 years. He tells us that he started out in this line of work working as a helper in various bakeries in the city. With his savings, he gradually acquired the basic tools necessary to set up his own bakery. He currently makes several products that he distributes throughout Chiclayo. This is his only source of income so he does his best to help it succeed. Luis would like to increase productivity making more items. For this reason, he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 2000 new sol, loan to buy ingredients and supplies (firewood, flour, sugar) to reach this objective. He is quite a hard-working young man who is dedicated to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be quite trustworthy and responsible. His greatest wish is to equip his bakery to produce cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread-baking ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Veneranda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Veneranda R., Habita en la Colonia Roberto González, es madre soltera de dos hijos ambos en edad escolar, La señora Rosa Veneranda tiene un tramo en el Bisne de chinelas, Ropa, Artículos escolares, en fin un poco de cada cosa para tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La señora Rosa Veneranda tiene a su hija mayor en la Universidad y para que su hija se ayude con ese gasto le puso en su casa de habitación una pequeña pulpería, entonces ella atiende los días de semana la venta y los sábados viaja a león a la universidad y su mama atiende el tramo todos los días de la semana.

 La señora Rosa Veneranda solicito el crédito para incrementar su inventario de sandalias y chinelas ya que estamos en temporada de playa y es lo que más se le mueve.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Colonia Roberto González and is the single mother of two school-aged children. She has a cart where she sells slippers, clothing, school items…a number of items in order to offer a variety to her customers. Rosa's oldest daughter attends university, so she set up a small store in her home in order to help her daughter with school expenses. [Her daughter] runs the store during the week. She travels to university in León on Saturdays. Her mother manages the cart every day. Rosa requested this loan in order to increase her inventory of sandals and slippers. Now that the beach season is here, these are the items she sells the most of.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Presentación Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Presentación del Carmen N., Habita en la Comarca la mora, tiene un tramo en el bisne en el sector de la ropa, tiene de trabajar con ceprodel desde que inicio, y siempre ha solicitado créditos pequeños para ir aumentando su inventario poco a poco.
	

 La señora Presentación del Carmen N. solicito el crédito para incrementar su inventario de ropa  ya que estamos en temporada de playa y  no poseía ropa playera.
texts.en:
Presentación lives in the "la Mora" area and has a cart where she sells clothing. She has been working with CEPRODEL since it began and she has always requested small loans in order to increase her inventory little by little Presentación requested this loan in order to be able to increase her inventory of clothing, now that the beach season has begun and she has no beach clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beach clothing for resale

loans.name: Eddy Alberto

texts.es: El señor Eddy Alberto L. M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Operario de limpieza en el tren de aseo, es soltero tiene tres hijos a su cargo, el crédito lo solicito para cubrir gastos personales con sus hijos, y para comprar unos artículos del hogar, como una tv, ya que el que tenían se le daño con un bajón de luz.
texts.en:
Eddy works as a sanitary engineer in the Chinandega city hall. He is single and has three children to take care of. He is asking for this loan in order to pay for some of his children's personal expenses and to buy a few household items, such as a TV because the one they had was damaged after a power outage.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Household expenses

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal CLAVELES, en su Secuencia 8, está formado por 9 clientes, 8 mujeres y 1 varon, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Pampahasi(La zona de Pampahasi, ubicada en la ladera Este de la ciudad, es considerada como un barrio residencial y turístico. En los últimos nueve años alcanzó un desarrollo vertiginoso que se tradujo en mejores condiciones de vida para los aproximadamente 30.000 habitantes. 

Desde la entrada a la zona, el punto denominado segundo cruce, el límite con Villa San Antonio, se pueden advertir  imponentes edificaciones de hasta cuatro plantas, muchas de ellas con fachadas acabadas, como también calles y amplias avenidas asfaltadas, a lo que se suman las jardineras y los espacios de recreación.

La zona abarca 16 barR. en tres sectores: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (cancha Venus) y Alto (Said-Cruz Pata, ex SAMAPA, Cervecería y La Guardia). 

Todas las socias están ubicados por los alrededores de la oficina de Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, de ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta de comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción de dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que uno de sus familiares falleció, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 
 
La Sra. Rebeca Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de comida en el Mercado 10 de Enero cuenta con esta actividad hace 13 años, también vende Calzados en la feria de la zona San Luís de la ciudad de El Alto los días miércoles y sábados, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión en la compra de calzados por mayor.  Casada con el señor Miguel, que trabaja como carpintero independiente en la zona de Sensata , tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de la socia. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Irene Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta de comida por pedidos en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o  eventos especiales se dedica a esta actividad hace 20 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra de víveres  mayor. La socia es Viuda y mantiene un hijo que estudia en colegio. La Señora Irene Es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera de grupo.

La Sra. Sofía, activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carteras en su taller Ceja  de la Cuidad de El Alto, también se dedica a la confección de ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para la compra de tela y otros insumos para la elaboración de carteras.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The community bank Claveles, in its 8th loan cycle, consists of 9 clients, 8 women and 1 man. The majority of the members live in the Pampahasi zone, located on the east side of the city. From the entrance to the zone, the point called the second crossing, the edge of Villa San Antonio, imposing buildings of up to four stories can be noticed, many of them with finished facades, as well as streets and broad avenues with asphalt surfaces, joined by parks and recreation spaces. The zone includes 16 neighborhoods in three sectors: Bajo Pampahasi (Illimani-San Juan), Centro (Cancha Venus), and Alto Said-Cruz Pata, formerly SAMAPA, Cervecería and La Guardia). The group members work in the sale of various products such as clothing, handbags, cosmetics, and food. In the previous loan cycle, everyone paid off their loan, with the exception of two members, who paid with their savings because one of their family members had died, and they were retired from the bank. Señora Rebeca represents the group. She now has the role of president of the bank. She sells food in the 10th of January market. She has carried out this activity for 13 years. She also sells shoes in the market in the San Luis zone of the city of El Alto on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The loan will be invested in the wholesale purchase of shoes. She and her husband, Sr. Miguel, who works independently as a carpenter in the Sensata zone, have two children who depend on her. In the communal bank she has stood out as a person who is responsible and punctual in her payments. Señora Irene has the role of treasurer of the bank. She sells food on order in different locations, such as in institutions or at special events. She has worked in this business for 20 years. The loan will be used to purchase greater supplies. She is a widow and supports a son who is in secondary school. Señora Irene is one of the representatives of the community bank, who has been selected for this role because of the responsibility that she has demonstrated with the bank as a guarantor and as a member of the group. Señora Sofia, active and dynamic in writing, was chosen as secretary. She makes and sells handbags in her workshop in Ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto. She also makes clothing. The loan will be used for the purchase of fabric and other supplies for making handbags. All the bank members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion Group

texts.en:
Dignora is the coordinator of her group Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is based on sugarcane and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Dignora is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by traveling to the capital and purchasing pants, underwear and sandals to sell.

She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing shoes for her children and saving towards the day when she can have her own store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman M. trades in building materials at the center of the main business street in Makeni.  He is single and started his business from a financial settlement, which he received from his father as a result of his service to his business.  He has ten years of experience in building material supplies.  He intends to buy key items in large quantity to meet the needs of his customers.  He has spent part of his life in business and wants to be self-reliant. He is hoping to use the proceeds of the loan to start building a house and raising his family.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria María H. vive en el barrio Rodolfo grillo vive acompañada  tiene dos niños menores,  trabajar con CEPRODEL, hace tres años ha tenido veintidós créditos el cual ha cancelado en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona responsable,
La señora Gloria H. trabaja elaborando repostería y vendiendo pan de diferentes sabores junto a su mama viaja todos los días por la tarde al puerto de Corinto para vender su mercadería
Los créditos anteriores han sido importantes porque me han permitido desarrollarme un poco mas,  mejorado mis condiciones en mi hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria María lives in the Rodolfo Grillo neighborhood, along with her two young children. She has been working with CEPRODEL for the past three years and has had several loans which she has repaid in a responsible way. Gloria makes and sells desserts and sells different flavors of breads. Every night she and her mother go to the port of Corinto to sell their merchandise. [She says,] "The previous loans have been important because they have helped me develop a bit more and improve the condition of my home."

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Modou Gadiaga

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois.  Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga  N.  est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs.  Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans.
Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à  Notto  de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique.
  Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait.  En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès  son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment  où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce.  Cette activité, dit-il,  lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur.
 C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit  il va constater son revenu augmenté.
texts.en:
Monsieur Modou Gadiaga N. est un homme marié et père de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 25 ans et le plus petit 4 mois. Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur Modou Gadaiga N. est en charge de sa famille et de ses demi-sœurs. Son activité principale est le commerce qu’il a embrassé depuis 10 ans. Cependant il a une activité secondaire le maraîchage (culture de légumes) une activité très développée à Notto de par sa position dans la zone des Niayes au Sénégal. Une zone constituée d’un milieu assez original caractérisé par des dunes et des dépressions souvent inondées par l’affleurement de la nappe phréatique et par un climat assez favorable. Ce milieu n’a pas manqué d’attirer la population et de donner également à la région toute sa vocation agronomique. Monsieur N. a pratiqué le maraîchage depuis 20 ans sous l’influence de son père qui s’y activait. En fait Monsieur N. aidait son père dès son jeune âge aux travaux de maraîchage jusqu’au moment où il prit l’initiative de développer sa propre activité le commerce. Cette activité, dit-il, lui a permis de tisser des relations avec le monde extérieur. C’est ainsi en 2009 lorsqu’U-IMCEC a ouvert une mutuelle pour mieux aider les producteurs de cette zone que Monsieur N. est devenu membre et sollicite pour la première fois un prêt de 50 000 FCFA. Il veut acheter avec le crédit des sacs de légumes (pomme de terre….) qu’il va revendre sur le marché. Avec ce crédit il va constater son revenu augmenté.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: s'approvisionner en légumes destinés à la vente

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed K. is a driver and a local food market supplier.  He owns two vehicles, which he uses to transport local foodstuffs from the farm to the city of Freetown.  He is married and has acquired 20 years of business experience in both driving and trading.  Mohamed want to purchase foodstuffs, lubricant and spare parts for his truck to effectively transport his goods. He hopes to use the proceeds of his loan to construct a house on already-purchased land and to pay his children's tertiary fees.

loans.use: To buy local foodstuffs and spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic footwear

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is a civil servant working in the health sector. She is a single parent of one child. She owns a shop on the outskirts of Makeni where she sells drinks and provisions. She employs a shop assistant and normally supervises the business in the evening.  She has secured funds from her personal savings to set up the business but not enough. As a result, she is seeking a loan to buy additional stock so that she can meet the needs of her customers.  She hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to educate her child and to build a house and expand her business for her retirement.

loans.use: To buy drinks and provisions

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeni es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Yeni es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Yeni tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donD. venD. repuestos D. carros, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Yeni necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. aceite.
Yeni sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeni is a member of the “Laureles” comunal bank. She is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She sells auto parts from a rented location daily. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to invest in motor oil. She hopes to be able to expand her business one day, and also hopes that her children will have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in motor oil for resale

loans.name: Talibé Makhtar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Talibé Makhtar A. est le chef du village de Gandeck situé à 3 Kms de Bambey (ville à 50Kms de Thiès). Il s’active principalement dans l’agriculture de façon générale. Il cultive du mil, de l’arachide…..etc  et  s’adonne également à l’embouche bovine dans son terroir. C’est par l’amour des bêtes et de la nature qu’il a embrassé cette activité.
Ainsi, pour acheter une vache et son veau, Monsieur A. sollicite un prêt de 300 000 FCFA dans la caisse U-IMCEC  Bambey  mise en place depuis fin 2009. Enfin, cet investissement, dit-il, lui permet de tirer profit du lait de ses vaches pour améliorer la nourriture familiale et d’augmenter le nombre de bœufs  de son enclos.
texts.en:
Talibé Makhtar A. is the village chief of Gandeck, located 3km from Bambey (a village 50km from Thiès). He mainly works in agriculture. He grows millet, peanuts, etc., and fattens cattle on his land. It is for the love of animals and nature that he embraces this activity. Thus, to purchase a cow and her calf, Mr. A. asks for a loan of 300,000 FCFA from the U-IMCEC Bambey credit union, in development since 2009. Finally this investment, he says, will permit him to benefit from his cow’s milk to improve the family's food and to increase the number of cows in his pen.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow and her calf.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en: Lamin is a trader dealing in used clothing at the main market in Makeni City.  He is married to a trader and has two children in high school.  He has eight years of business experience.  He intends to increase his stock and to buy wholesale from Guinea and Freetown.  He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to settle his children educational issues and to purchase a piece of land for his family.  He is hard working and has spent his entire lifetime in the business with his wife who normally assists him in the business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
Maria Cruz tiene 54 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos ya independizados. Vive sola en el distrito de Reque, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace mas de cinco años tiene instalado en su vivienda un pequeño negocio en donde ofrece a sus clientes prendas de vestir y calzado para damas, caballeros y niños. Este negocio le provee de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y también la hace sentirse activa. La mercadería que ofrece la compra en la ciudad de Lima y también la distribuye a sus clientes en base a pedidos.

El negocio ha ido creciendo y ahora ya es conocida en la zona por la calidad de las prendas que ofrece y por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes al momento de atenderlos. María Cruz desea implementar su negocio con la venta de uniformes y calzado escolar, aprovechando el inicio de clases  en las escuelas del país, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y que su negocio se haga mas conocido. Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los que la consideran una persona bastante confiable y que siempre ayuda cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
María Cruz is 54 years old, separated and has two, independent children. She lives in the Reque district, which is 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a small clothing and shoe store installed in her home for the last 5 years; she stocks items for women, men and children. The business produces income to meet family expenses but also allows her to feel active. The merchandise she sells she buys in Lima; she also works based on prior customer orders. The business has been growing and she is now well-known in the area thanks to the quality of her stock and the good customer service she provides. María Cruz wants to start to sell school uniforms and shoes taking advantage of the new school term that is about to start countrywide. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 2000 new sol, loan for this reason. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman and that her business becomes better known. She is held in high esteem by her neighbors, who consider her to be trustworthy and always willing to help those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school uniforms.

loans.name: Donata

texts.es:
Donata es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Donata es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Donata tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery en donde vende verduras, camote, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Donata necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de camote y zanahoria.
Los sueños de Donata son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Donata is a member of the Laurales communal bank. She is the 29 year old mother of two children. She has a spot in the Nery market, where she sells vegetables and sweet potatoes daily. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to ($375) to buy sweet potatoes and carrots. She hopes to be able to expand her business and provide a good educational opportunity for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in sweet potatoes and carrots

loans.name: Flora Martina

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Flora es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Flora tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Flora son tener local propio y brindar calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flora is a member of the communal bank Laureles. She is 45 years old and is a live-in partner. She has 5 children. She has a restaurant in a rented site where she works every day. Flora needs a loan of $450, which will be used to purchase rice and sugar. Flora's dreams are to own the site of her restaurant and give a better quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar

loans.name: Teodoro German

texts.es:
German es socio del Banco Comunal Laureles.
German es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, German tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros, además German vende ropa a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito.
German necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.
Los sueños de German son tener casa propia y ahorrar.
texts.en:
German is a member of the communal bank Laureles. He is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. German transports passengers in his mototaxi (a motorized rickshaw). He also takes orders for clothing and extends credit to his clothing customers. German needs a loan of $450, which will be used to maintain his mototaxi. His dreams are to have his own house and to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his mototaxi

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Elena es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Elena son tener un restaurante y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank Laureles. She is married, 47 years old, and has five children. She has a store in her house from which she sells groceries every day with the help of her children. Elena needs a loan of $725 to purchase milk, sugar, and rice. Elena's dreams are to have a restaurant and to see her children succeed in school.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milk, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Julia Saturdina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Saturdina J. Z. es soltera no tiene hijos vive en el barrio Pedro Joaquín  junto a su familia,  tiene tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha tenido veintiocho créditos el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, 
Los créditos anteriores han sido importantes ya ha evolucionado con su negocio antes solamente vendía refrescos hoy vende frutas gaseosas popsicles entre otros, también ha mejorado su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Julia is single and has no children. She lives in the Pedro Joaquín neighborhood with her family and has been working with CEPRODEL for the past three years. She has had 28 previous loans, with which she has proven to be responsible. The previous loans have been important because they have allowed her to evolve her business. In the past she only sold a few drinks, now she sells fruit, soft drinks, and popsicles, among other things. She has also been able to improve her home little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Las Emprenderdoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LAS EMPRENDEDORAS, en su Secuencia 2, está formado por 8 clientes, todas mujeres, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio Alto, que están ubicados por donD. se encuentra el sindicato D. Minibuses y Colectivos "Simón Bolívar"  y sus alrededores las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa libros cuadernos cosméticos, jugos D. fruta. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con atrasos, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. En cuanto a su historial D. créditos no tienen días D. mora.
 
La Sra. Ruth Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. Yanbal por catalogo y por mayor cuenta con esta actividad hace 2 años, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión en sus pedidos cada 20 días, contando con una buena cartera D. clientes. Casada con el señor Benedicto, que trabaja en la Republica D. Argentina como costurero, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen D. la socia.  En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Juana  Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. material escolar en una librería ubicada en la Av. Josefa Mujia,  se dedica a esta actividad hace 1 año, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. material escolar por mayor. Casada con el señor Javier que trabaja como empleado en la empresa FADERPA, tiene 1 hija Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado con sus compañeras. 

La Sra. Carla activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la costura D. ropa y también a la venta D. anticuchos en los locales D. fiesta D. Villa Copacabana, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. tela y otros insumos para la elaboración D. ropa.

Todas las socias estan agradecidoas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedora (Entrpreneurs) Communal bank, in its second loan cycle, is formed by 8 clients, all women. Most of the members live in the San Antonio Alto area, which is located near the Simón Bolívar minibus and group taxi union. The members are engaged in the sale of diverse products in the surrounding area such as clothing, books, school supplies, cosmetics, and fruit juice.

In the previous cycle, most members paid on time, though a few were late, and their payments were covered by the communal bank. Insofar as the communal bank’s credit history is concerned, there are no late payments.

Sra. Ruth represents the group. Currently, she is the president of the bank. She is engaged in the sale of Yanbal cosmetics via catalogue (the products are in a catalogue which she shows to her customers) and at wholesale. She has counted on this business for two years. She will invest the loans in ordering her stock every 20 days, relying on a steady clientele for purchases.

Ruth is married to Señor Benedicto, who works in Argentina as a tailor. She has two dependent children. In her communal bank, she is known as a responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Sra. Juana is the member who is the treasurer of the bank. She is engaged in the sale of school supplies in a bookstore located in Josefa Mujia Avenue. She has been involved in this business for a year. She will use the loan to purchase school supplies at wholesale. Juana is married to Señor Javier, who is employed by FADERPA, an auto parts business. She has one daughter. Ruth has been selected for the post of treasurer because she has shown her colleagues how responsible she is.

Sra. Carla, an active and dynamic women, was selected a secretary of the communal bank. She is involved in sewing clothing and also sells anticuchos (beef heart kabobs) at the Villa Copacabana festival. She will use the loan to purchase fabric and other raw material for making clothing.

All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown to them by making the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory.

loans.name: Restauradas 1 Group

texts.en:
Ruth, 34, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres Restauradas (Restored Women), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ruth lives with her husband and three children in a simple home in Los Alcarrizos, a large, crowded suburb of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Ruth runs a successful business running a small food stand in her community. With this loan, she will be purchasing hot dogs, buns, and condiments to prepare food for her customers.

This is Ruth’s very first loan with Esperanza International. When food sales are slow, Ruth also sells clothing for added income. With continued profits, Ruth hopes to continue the growth of her business. She is currently studying, using profits from her business to pay for her education. Ruth has already accomplished many goals for herself, including the ability to begin saving money for the well-being of her family. Most importantly, she believes that the income from her food stand will give her children security in health, education, and a step forward in society.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ruth and the Mujeres Restauradas group!

loans.use: Hot dogs, buns, & condiments

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is married with two adult sons. She sells various products like plastic bags, toilet paper, napkins, and artificial flowers at the central market in Pavlograd city. Tatyana has been in this business for 16 years. Being polite and offering good products at low prices has helped Tatyana to develop her business well. This business is the only source of her family income. Tatyana would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase materials for artificial flowers. She is going to sell the flowers for Easter and make additional income. Tatyana helps her youngest son pay for his college tuition.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es socia del Banco Comunal Laureles.
Carmela es casada, tiene 47 años y 7 hijos, Carmela vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria cerca de un terminal terrestre, además Carmela compra y vende quesos.
Carmela necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y frutas.
Los sueños de Carmela son mejorar su casa y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Laureles communal bank. She is 47 years old and has seven children. Carmela sells snacks on foot, near a terminal. She also buys and sells cheeses. She needs a loan of 1,750 PEN ($625) that she will use to buy snacks and fruit. She hopes to someday be able to improve her home and diversify her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas y frutas.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar Manuel tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos naturales. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio porque no tenía un trabajo estable para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importante para él. Ya que el vende sus productos de manera ambulante por lo que recorre muchos lugares para ofrecer sus productos los que más demandan sus clientes son los refrescos de naranja y mandarina, pues estas fuertes temperaturas hacen que los refrescos naturales hidrate nuestro cuerpo, pues Oscar es muy trabajador. Es por esto que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, melones, mango y piña. Su deseo es que sus hijos tenga una educación digna y que no les falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Oscar is 41 years old and sells natural refreshments (drinks). He’s been doing this for more than 20 years. He started this business because he did not have steady employment with which he could support his two children, who are very important to him. He sells his products on foot and walks through many areas offering his merchandise. The most popular flavors are orange and mandarin orange. These natural refreshments hydrate our body in these harsh temperatures. Oscar is a very hard worker. He is asking for this loan so that he can buy fresh fruit, such as oranges, mandarin oranges, cantaloupes, mangos and pineapples. He wants his children to receive a sound education and that they are never in need of their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Aminata Dauda

texts.en: Aminata K. is a trader who is 31 years old and owns a shop where she sells provision and drinks. Her shop is strategically located in one of the busy streets in town. She is married with one daughter and four dependants. Although an illiterate, Aminata has been in business for about 10 years and has been managing the business very well. She normally opens her shop from 7 am - 12 pm each day. She is, therefore, in search of a loan that will enable her to get more stock to meet her customers' needs. She will use the profit from the business to care for her family as her husband is currently studying and not working.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks

loans.name: Oulèye

texts.fr: Madame Oulèye Sène veuve  et mère de 9 enfants s’active depuis 20 ans dans la vente de mil, dérivés du mil (araw, sankhal,  couscous….), bissap, pain de singe et…etc.  Elle  est très connue dans ce domaine et reçoit même des commandes  des Etats Unis et de l’Europe.  Née en 1953, Madame Oulèye S. est une dame de fer  très dynamique et compte sur son commerce pour aider ses enfants et régler les besoins quotidiens familiaux. Cependant, elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 FCFA  pour s’approvisionner dans les grands marchés afin de renouveler son stock pour mieux répondre à ses commandes très intéressantes.
texts.en:
Oulèye Sène, widow and mother of nine children, has for 20 years sold millet and derivatives of millet (araw, sankhal, couscous), hibiscus flowers, “monkey bread,” [the fruit of a baobab tree], and more. She is well known in this area and welcomes orders from the United States and Europe. Born in 1953, Oulèye S. is a dynamic iron lady and counts on her business to help her children and to provide for the family’s daily needs. She seeks a loan of 300,000 FCFA however, to stock up in major markets so that she can update her stock to meet her very interesting orders.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise to fulfill customer orders.

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es:
ROCIO NOEMI, ES CASADA, TIENE 45 AÑOS Y DOS HIJOS D. 9 Y 20 AÑOS D. EDAD. ELLA ES PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO "MANOS TELARAÑAS" DENOMINADO ASI PORQUE LAS SIETE INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO;  SE DEDICAN A LA FABRICACIÓN D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR A BASE D. TEJIDOS MANUALES. 
ROCIO NOEMI, DESD. LOS NUEVE AÑOS, LE NACIÓ EL INTERES POR EL TEJIDO, APRENDIÓ DESD. MUY PEQUEÑA. HACE CINCO MESES ES UNA FUENTE INGRESO PARA SU ECONOMÍA, ELLA PREPARA LAS PRENDAS YA SEA CHOMPAS, POLITOS D. VERANO Y LOS OFRECE A SUS CONOCIDOS Y AMIGOS.
CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO HA LOGRADO MEJORAR ECONÓMICAMENTE, APOYAR A SU ESPOSO Y LO MAS RESCATABLE PARA ELLA ES QUE HA PODIDO CONOCER MAS GENTE Y ASI AUMENTAR SU CLIENTELA.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO COMPRARÁ MATERIALES PARA PRODUCIR MAS PRENDAS.
texts.en:
Rocio is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 9 and 20. She is the president of the “manos telarañas” (Spiderweb Hands) group. It’s called that because its seven members, who live in the Carabayllo district, make articles of clothing by hand. Rocio became interested in sewing nine years ago. She learned the art when she was a little girl. This has been an economic fountain for her for the past five months. She makes the clothing, such as sweaters and summer shirts, and offers them for sale to her friends and acquaintances. This business has allowed her to improve her economic status and to help her husband. What she likes most is that she’s been able to meet lots of people and increase her customer base. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for making clothing

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Karina es soltera y tiene 22 años, Karina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, azúcar.
Los sueños de Karina son comprar un carro y surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank. She is 22 years old and single and has a small general grocery store, which she runs the store daily with her mother’s help. She needs this loan for 1,200 PEN to invest in rice, noodles, milk, and sugar. Someday she would like to buy a car and offer greater variety in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Marianela es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Marianela viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes en general, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor y reparte a las tiendas.
Marianela necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Marianela son construir un hotel y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) comunal bank. She is 32 years old, married and has one son. Marianela travels to the “Ayacuchana Jungle” where she sells groceries in bulk, mostly to other stores. She needs a loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,075) to buy rice and sugar. She hopes to someday build a hotel and also hopes that her son can have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Kelly Edmita

texts.es:
Kelly es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Kelly es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Kelly tiene una panadería en donde elabora panes típicos, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar y también reparte a las tiendas.
Kelly necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Kelly sueña con ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para repartir su producto.
texts.en:
Kelly is a member of the “Bienestar” (Well Being) communal bank. She is 22 years old and has one son. Kelly has a bakery where she bakes and sells typical breads. She also sells to other stores. Kelly needs a loan of 1.050 PEN ($375) that she will use to buy flour. Kelly hopes to be able to expand her business and buy a car to be able to deliver her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Gbampor Group

texts.en: This group of entrepreneurs calls their group 'Gbampor'. Sonie K. is the group’s leader. She is 40-year-old and born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have 5 children – two are in secondary school and three are already grown-ups. Sonie sells rice, beans and palm oil. She has been a businesswoman for 2 years. With this loan, Sonie will improve her business by buying bags of rice and beans and gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and beans and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Mabel's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1985 by the Catholic mission to educate the children of the Kolo Kolo community, on the outskirts of Makeni. Currently, the school is staffed with 12 teachers and has 550 pupils.

This is the second loan these teachers are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mabel C. who is pictured second from right is the leader of this group of teachers. The 43-year-old was born in Gbonkolenken village, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have 5 children – four of them are attending secondary school and one is in a tertiary institution.  Mabel, who has been a teacher for 24 years, is requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 in order to buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc.

loans.name: Brima O.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1980 by the Inspectorate Office, Makeni. It was opened to give formal education to the children of Yalisanda village. Presently, this school is staffed with 10 teachers and has 319 pupils. 

This is the first loan these teachers are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Brima O. T., who is pictured on the left, is the leader of this group. He has taught for 32 years now. The 60-year-old Brima was born in Gbanti Kammaranka village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have 6 children – 1 in secondary school and 5 in primary school. Brima is seeking for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to buy house-building materials – cement, nails and corrugated zinc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials – cement, nails, and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Santigie S.'s Group

texts.en:
