These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1976 by the Nigerian Baptist mission. Presently, the school is staffed with 7 teachers and has 296 pupils.

This is the first loan this group of teachers is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

The leader of this group of teachers is Santigie S. K., pictured second from left. Born in Mange village, the 32-year-old is married with 5 children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending schools – one in secondary school and four in primary school. Santigie has been a teacher for 9 years now. He is requesting a loan of SLL 700,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy house-building materials such as cement, nails, and corrugated zinc. He will also use some of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials such as cement, nails, and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Pictured here is Ismail K., a businessman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Ismail K. sells medicines in his small pharmacy at the center of town. This is the first loan this entrepreneur is requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, he will be able to expand his business. 

Ismail is married and has 5 children. He has been a businessman for 6 years now. With this loan, he will travel to Freetown and purchase the following drugs: Panadol, Stop Ache, Septrin and ORS to add to his business stock.

loans.use: Buy medicines to add to his pharmacy stock

loans.name: Issa B.

texts.en:
Issa B. K. is an approximately 42-year-old man who lives in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone with his wife and their 4 children. Issa has been running a small video center (a mini-cinema) for 5 years now. He shows mainly soccer – European, domestic, and Champions’ leagues, which are very popular here. He also shows Nigerian, Western, and Indian movies. 

He requested a loan from Kiva field partner Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to pay his monthly satellite subscription fee, buy petrol for his generator and buy video tapes. This is the first loan that Issa has requested from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay his monthly satellite subscription fee, buy petrol for his generator, and purchase video tapes

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is an approximately 53-year-old man who lives in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone with his wife and their 5 children. Mohamed has been a businessman for many years now. He sells local produce like rice, ground-nuts, and beans. 

Mohamed has requested a loan of SLL 3,000,000 from Kiva field partner Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT) in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy bags of rice, ground-nuts, and beans to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, making sales and profit-to-sales-margin improve for him.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, ground-nuts, and beans

loans.name: Work For Yourself Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the 'Work For Yourself' group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businessmen who have applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each person. With the help of this loan, these small-scale entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales and improve their living standards.

The leader of this group is 45-year-old Henry B. T.. Henry, who was born in Masugbi village, is married to a businesswoman and they have 5 children. Henry makes a living through the selling of used clothes. He has been selling used clothes for 15 years now. With his share of this loan, Henry will travel to Freetown and buy a bale of used clothes. A bale will cost him SLL 950,000.

loans.use: Buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Josiah Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the J. Group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale businesswomen who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person. With the help of this loan, these small-scale businesswomen will be able to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales so that their living standard will improve.

The leader of this group is 34-year-old Isatu J.. Isatu, who was born in Magburaka, is married to a lorry driver and they have 3 children. Isatu makes a living through selling dried fish. She has been in this business for quite a number of years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets full of dried fish.

loans.use: Buy baskets full of dried fish

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS"

"Uno pueD. caer, pero con esfuerzo y el apoyo D. la familia se pueD. levantar nuevamente”.

Filomena tiene 52 años y 3 hijos D. los cuales solo uno es independiente, es la tesorera D. la alcancía comunal “SAN CARLOS”, que trabaja con EDAPRSOPO-PROSPERIDAD por casi 1 año y 5 meses.

El negocio D. Filomena es la fabricación D. zapatillas, se dedica a ello por más D. 15 años, actualmente su negocio es pequeño aunque no siempre fue así, Filomena nos cuenta que años atrás con la iniciativa D. su esposo deciden asociarse con un señor, amigo D. su esposo, para abrir el negocio D. la fabricación D. zapatillas, ya que el amigo D. su esposo sabia del negocio, sin embrago después D. un año D. su asociación se separan, fue así que deciden continuar solos, teniendo algunos conocimientos del negocio en el mercado, pero las cosas se pusieron difíciles cuando la municipalidad exige que formalicen su negocio, entonces el municipio solicitó los papeles correspondientes, papeles y trámites que exigían mucho tiempo y dinero, pero lo consiguieron, luego ya formalizados tenían que pagar un sueldo mínimo, pagar gratificación, seguro, etc. gastos D. los que no estuvieron preparados y provocaron el quiebre D. su negocio.

Teniendo una mala experiencia se mudaron y comenzaron nuevamente, ahora ya sus hijos ayudarían con una pequeña labor pero significativa, en el trasporte D. sus maquinas, materiales, etc. a su nuevo taller, “ella está convencida D. que uno pueD. caer, pero con esfuerzo y el apoyo D. la familia se pueD. levantar nuevamente”.
Filomena también para tener un ingreso extra alquila el primer piso D. su casa.

Sus planes a futuro son los D. costear la carrera D. sus hijos, terminar D. construir su casa y darle los acabados, también hacer crecer su negocio y sueña que algún día su marca D. calzado sea reconocida en el mercado.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS" (San Carlos Communal Bank) “One can fall, but with effort and support from one’s family, one can rise again.” Filomina is 52 years old and has three sons, one of whom is independent. She is the treasurer of the ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SAN CARLOS," which has been working with EDAPRSOPO-PROSPERIDAD for nearly one year and five months. She has been making slippers for more than 15 years. Her business is small now, but it has not always been this way. Filomina tells us that two years ago, on her husband’s initiative, they decided to associate themselves with a friend of his. They were going to open a shoe making business, since her husband’s friend knew something of business. Unfortunately, the partnership broke up after one year, so they decided to continue on their own, since they also knew something about doing business in the marketplace. Things got a bit difficult when the city compelled them to formalize their business and they required papers and permits that took much time and money to obtain, but they got them. Once formalized, they were required to pay minimum wage, tips, insurance, etc. They were not prepared to pay these costs, so the business went broke. Having had a bad experience, they moved and started over. Their children helped with a small, but significant amount of labor. They helped them move their machines and materials to their new shop. She is convinced that, “One can fall, but with effort and support from one’s family, one can rise again.” Filomena also rents out the first floor of her home to earn an extra income. Her plans for the future are to pay for her children’s career education, to finish building her house, along with fixtures and finishing touches, and also to grow her business. She also dreams that her brand of shoe is one day known around the world.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dina Mercedes

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Dina es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Dina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende ropa para damas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Dina junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte de pasajeros.
Dina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago del carro.
Dina sueña con tener una empresa de transportes y una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the “Banco Comunal Bienestar” (Well Being Communal Bank). She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. Dina has a ladies’ clothing store in a rented location, which she attends to daily. She and her husband also have a car which they use to transport passengers. Dina needs a loan of 900 PEN ($325) which she will use to make a partial payment on the car. Dina hopes that some day she will have her own transportation company and an auto parts store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle payment

loans.name: Sara Magdalena

texts.es:
Sara León es socia del Banco Comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la parroquia  Santa Ana, esta localidad  se caracteriza por ser una de las de mayor producción  agrícola y tiene como atractivo turisticos la playa de Chorro que se encuentran a 2 Km. del centro parroquial  donde encontramos espacios verdes para la recreación y esparcimiento de la familia.

 Sara tiene 55 años de edad  y esta se parada hace 27 años, su matrimonio fracaso porque su marido era mujeriego, vive con su único hijo de 28 años aun soltero, estudia en el ESPIE y  también trabaja en el departamento de gestión ambiental de ETAPA, la casa en la que habita la construyó  su hijo gracias a los préstamos que ha realizado.

Nuestra socia  se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes no sólo en los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca sino tambien en su propia casa y es aqui donde más ventas realiza, su hijo le ayuda  en su negocio ya que tiene muchos conocidos que le hacen  pedidos de cuyes.

Lleva cuatro  años en su bankito y trabajando con los prestamos que recibe y éstos le han beneficiado mucho a salir adelante en su negocio, fue su hermana quien la incentivó a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor porvenir, con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en acabados para su casa como puertas, tumbados.

Su meta es ponerse un asadero de cuyes y hacerse otra casita para incrementar su ciadero de  cuyes.
texts.en:
Sara León is a member of the Unión Progresista communal bank. She lives in Santa Ana parish. This area is known as a major agricultural center. It is also a tourist destination; Chorro beach with green spaces for family recreation is only two kilometers from the center of the parish. Sara is 55 years old and has been separated from her husband for 27 years. Her marriage failed because her husband was a womanizer. She lives with her only son, 28. He is single and studies at ESPE University and also works in the department of environmental management of ETAPA. He also built the house that Sara lives in, thanks to previous loans. Sara works raising and selling guinea pigs, not only in the markets of Cuenca, but also in her own house, where she makes most of her sales. Her son helps in the business, which is doing well. Sara has been with Unión Progresista communal bank for four years and the loans have helped her get ahead in her business. It was initially her sister who encouraged her to join this great group of women who are seeking a better future. With this loan, Sara will invest in finishing her house, including doors and ceilings. Her goal for the future is to build another shed for raising guinea pigs and also a roaster.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy doors and ceilings to finish her house

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Carmen es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Carmen tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la selva ayacuchana actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además Carmen tiene carros que realizan transporte interprovincial.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
El sueño de Carmen es construir su casa para alquilar.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Banco Comunal Bienestar” (Well Being Communal Bank). She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Carmen has a small grocery store in the “Ayacuchana Jungle, which she runs with her husband’s help. Carmen also has cars that they use to provide interprovincial transportation. She needs this loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,075) to invest in rice and sugar. Carmen’s dream is to build a house to rent out.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Adpat N°1 Group

texts.fr:
L’Association pour le Développement des Parcelles Assainies de Thiès (ADPAT) est un groupement mixte composé de personnes habitantes toutes dans un même quartier  les  Parcelles Assainies, un  très grand quartier à Thiès. Elle a été créée en 2003 sous l’influence d’un groupe de femmes  qui étaient en tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). Cependant, les membres sont animés d’un même objectif qui est de créer la solidarité et de développer leur cher quartier les Parcelles Assainies.   
  L’association est actuellement dirigée par Madame Diallé N., une  dame très engagée et qui connait bien la culture associative.  Elle est scindée auprès de U-IMCEC en 9 sous groupements avec un président et un trésorier pour chaque sous groupe afin de les faire profiter de ses services. 
Quant à l'ADPAT N°1, Madame Diallé N. la présidente de l’Association est à la tête de ce sous groupement.  Cette femme âgée de 52 ans est formatrice en langue nationale, le wolof, en entreprenariat et en  décentralisation depuis 1997. Pour ses temps libre, elle se consacre au commerce. Elle vend des tissus, chaussures, du crème …etc. Elle pratique le commerce, dit-elle, pour  régler ses besoins et augmenter ses revenus. D’ailleurs, avec sa part du crédit, elle compte renforcer son approvisionnement en chaussures, tissus pour un meilleur développement de son commerce. Cette femme mariée a 5 enfants et partage ce sous groupe avec :
-Madame Aminata G. qui vend des draps, tissus, produits cosmétiques et des effets pour femme dans son magasin sis en ville avec Thiès.
-Madame Aminata D. qui vend depuis 12 ans dans sa maison de l’arachide et de l’huile de palme.
-Madame Amy B., la vendeuse de poisson séchés et fumés au marché de Thiès
-et Madame Haychatou G. coiffeuse de métier qui gère depuis 1 an sa propre boutique dans le quartier.   
Elles demandent un financement de 500 000 FCFA qu’elle vont se partager à part égale.
texts.en:
The Association for the Development of les Parcelles Assainies of Thiès (ADPAT), is a coed group of people all living in the quarter of les Parcelles Assainies, a large district in Thiès. It was created in 2003 under the influence of a group of women who were part of a tontine (a system of rotating credit in which each member periodically contributes an agreed upon sum, and where each member is paid individually in turn). The members are inspired by the same objective, that is to develop solidarity and to improve their beloved quarter of les Parcelles Assainies. The association is currently managed by Diallé N., a very involved woman who knows group culture well. The association is split from U-IMCEC into nine subgroups with a president and a treasurer for each in order to help them benefit from its services. As for ADPAT N°1, Diallé N., the president of the association, is the head of the subgroup. This woman, 52 years old, has been an instructor in the national language, Wolof, in entrepreneurialism, and in decentralization since 1997. In her free time, she devotes herself to business. She sells fabric, shoes, creams, and more. She does business, she says, to meet her needs and to increase revenue. Moreover, with her portion of the loan, she will increase her stock of shoes and fabric to better develop her business. This married woman has five children and is in the group with: Aminata G., who sells linen, fabrics, cosmetics, and women’s clothing in her store located in Thiès. Aminata D., who for 12 years has sold peanuts and palm oil from her home. Amy B., merchant of dry fish and ciagarettes in the Thiès market. Haychatou G., hairdresser by trade, who has run her own boutique in the quarter for one year. They ask for a loan of 500,000 FCFA that they will split evenly.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcer leurs activités

loans.name: Abraham Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Abraham Antonio O. M., tiene la edad de 29 años, vive en el humilde Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casado y tienen dos hijos pequeños, de los cuales el mayorcito estudia la escuela primaria, dentro de los planes familiares esta la culminación de la construcción de su casa.

El trabaja como Bombero en la gasolinera de Ticuantepe, él compro gracias a su propio esfuerzo, un terreno el cual se lo vendió su tío, actualmente está en la legalización de esas tierras. Ese terreno lo compro para la construcción de su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como Bloques, cemento , arena y laminas de zinc, con esto él daría comienzo a las edificaciones.

Ellos son personas humildes, que con su trabajo han evolucionado en gran medida y que con el apoyo económico les permitirán mejores condiciones sociales.
texts.en:
Abraham Antonio O. M. is 29, and he lives in the humble Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. He is married and has two small children. The oldest goes to elementary school. The family has plans to finish building their house. He works as a fireman in the Ticuantepe gas station. Thanks to his own efforts, he bought a piece of land from his uncle. He is currently involved in the legalization of this land. He bought this land to build a house. That is why he is requesting a loan. He will buy construction materials like blocks, cement, sand, and zinc sheeting. With these materials he will start building. They are humble people, who have evolved greatly with their work. The economic help will allow them to have better social conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of his house

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS”, actualmente se encuentra en el IX ciclo, las reuniones D. los socios son una vez al mes en las oficinas D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la provincia D. Anta, el banco comunal esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco y Izcuchaca. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. joyas, venta D. golosinas, venta D. hortalizas, venta D. verduras, venta D. árboles, venta D. comestibles, venta D. animales menores, venta D. pasamanería y otros ofrecen servicios D. lavandería y docencia. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Margarita forma parte del banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, ella vive en la ciudad D. Izuchaca, ella tiene cinco hijos D. las cuales cuatro son independientes y Alejandro es su último hijo que todavía depenD. D. ella. 
Margarita nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta D. pollos, ella venD. sus animales todos los días domingos en la feria dominical D. Izcuchaca y ella cría pollos y cuyes para preparar Chiriucho (El plato más famoso del Cusco es el CHIRI UCHU (Ají Frió) un plato a base D. gallina, cuy, morcilla, cochayuyu, cancha, tortilla, queso y algunos otros ingredientes...y se prepara para las fiestas del Cusco). Ya son tres años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Margarita en época  escolar se dedica a la atención D. la tienda escolar del  colegio “Agustin Gamarra” donD. venD. golosinas, galletas, postres y comida, ella requiere el préstamo para implementar la tienda escolar y desea comprar azúcar, galletas, harina, etc.     

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Warmicuna Llanqanchis Communal Bank is currently in their ninth cycle. The members’ meetings are held once a month in the offices of the Asociación Arariwa in the Anta province. The communal bank is comprised of 15 hard-working and entrepreneurial people who are looking every minute for the opportunities to get ahead. With their daily efforts they look to give their children a better future. It is a communal bank whose members live in the cities of Cusco and Izcuchaca. Cusco is a city known for its archaeological sites, its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country. Examples of some of their economic activities are selling jewelry, selling sweets, selling produce, selling vegetables, selling trees, selling food, selling small animals, and selling braids and tassels. Some offer services like laundry and teaching. The communal bank has operated for several cycles. The members say that they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, the savings, and the training. An ongoing valuable aspect of the communal bank is the service offered of group savings, which allows for the possibility of building up capital. Margarita is part of the Warmicuna Llanqanchis Communal Bank. She is 50, and she lives in the city of Izuchaca. She has five children, and four of them are independent. Her last child, Alejandro is still dependent upon her. Margarita tells us that she sells chickens. She sells her animals every Sunday at the Izuchaca Sunday fair. She raises chickens and guinea pigs to make “Chiricucho” (The most famous dish in Cusco is Chiriuchu, which means cold chili pepper. It is a dish maD. from chicken, guinea pig, blood sausage, seaweed, toasted corn kernels, tortilla, cheese and other ingredients. It is prepared for the holidays in Cusco.) She has been in the business for three years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. During the school season Margarita tends the school store at the Agustin Gamarra School. She sells sweets, cookies, desserts, and food. She needs the loan to set up the school store. She wishes to buy sugar, cookies, and flour, etc. The members are grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and they promise to make their payments on the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margarita needs the loan to set up the school store.  She will buy sugar, cookies, and flour, etc.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es:
Emerenciana es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar.
Emerenciana es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Emerenciana tiene carros con los cuales realizan transporte interprovincial, su esposo e hijos son los encargados D. conducir los carros.
Emerenciana necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. neumáticos.
El sueño D. Emerenciana es comprar mas carros.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bienestar [Wellbeing] Communal Bank. She is 48 years old and is married with three children. Emerenciana has cars with which she operates an inter-provincial transport service. Her husband and sons are the drivers for the service. Emerenciana needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to buy tires for her cars. Her dream is to be able to buy more cars.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Birama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Birama N., célibataire âgé de 37 ans est membre d’U-IMCEC depuis Décembre 2009.  Il est prestataire de services (location de chaîne à musique, groupe électrogène….) et commerçant d’accessoires de portable depuis 7 ans. Il gère une cantine et produit  4 à 5 fois dans le mois à l’occasion de cérémonies familiales ou soirées dansante.
Cependant pour les besoins de sa sonorisation et de sa cantine, Monsieur N. souhaitait un prêt de 100 000 FCFA. Ainsi, il pourra avec cet argent acheter un ordinateur à 70 000 FCFA  nécessaire à son travail  de sonorisation  et mettre en place avec le reste de l’argent  une vitrine dans sa cantine pour les accessoires de portables …etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Birama N., aged 37, is unmarried and has been a member of U-IMCEC since December 2009. For seven years, he has been a service provider (renting stereo music equipment, electric generators...) and a merchant of mobile phone accessories. He runs a stall and has four to five bookings a month at family-oriented occasions or dance parties. However, Mr. N.'s sound system and his stall are lacking, so he would like a loan of 100,000 francs CFA. He will then be able to use this money to buy a 70,000 franc computer necessary for his work involving sound systems and to use the rest of the money for installing a glass case in his stall for phone accessories...etc.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stereo sound equipment and more

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr: Assa Diène Est une femme de 52 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THieckène depuis 5ans et y a reçu 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assa Diène is a 52-year-old woman and the mother of six children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Thieckène for five years and has received ten loans there that she always handled well and repaid on time.  Her goal is to boost her level of savings and to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing her income-generating work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Elizabeth junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, Además Elizabeth siembra verduras que vende en el M. de abastos.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son construir su casa y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the "Solución" ("Solution") communal bank. She is 29 years old and has a live-in partner and 3 children. Together with her partner, she works making handmade bricks in the community of Compañía. Elizabeth also grows vegetables, which she sells at the wholesale market. Elizabeth needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in buying clay. Elizabeth's dreams are to build her own home and keep working to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay soil to make bricks

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Delfina es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Delfina su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, Además Delfina siembra verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones.
Delfina sueña con salir adelante y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Solución Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has one son. Delfina and her husband have a business making bricks in the Compañía community. Delfina also grows vegetables that she sells in the market. Delfina needs a loan of 900 soles to pay workers. She dreams of getting ahead and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay workers.

loans.name: 12 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal 12 DE MARZO está formado por 10 clientes, 8 mujeres y 2 varones, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de San Antonio Alto y al ingreso de la zona Escobar Uria las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de. Realizaron la capacitación en 4 reuniones asistiendo en un 100% a todas las reuniones en cuanto a su historial de créditos ninguno se encuentra en la central de riesgos.

La Sra. Ana Es la representante, líder actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de trigo en calle Gallardo cuenta con esta actividad hace 5 años, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión en la compra de trigo por mayor  pero su meta es ampliar su negocio y la variedad en abarrotes estando en lugar comercial. Casada con el señor Wilfredo, que trabaja como albañil, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de la socia. En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable, desde el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco. También fue socia integrante de un banco hace 1 año atrás en el cual cumplió con todos sus pagos asumiendo su responsabilidad como garante, siendo ella la que agrupo el banco de Emprendimiento.

La Sra. Maria Del Carmen Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la costura de muñecos y peluches de diversos tipos de tela, compartiendo esta actividad hace 1 años con su hermana el préstamo esta destinado a la compra de material y telas de distinto tipo.  Su objetivo es tener su propia empresa de muñecos y peluches a gran escala. Soltera vive en la casa de sus abuelos con sus familiares 
Es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su juventud y dinámica de trabajo. 

La Sra. Juana activa y dinámica en la conformación del banco es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la venta de fruta en el mercado modelo de Villa San Antonio Alto, el préstamo esta destinado para la inversión de su mercadería, en variedad para la mejor atención de sus clientes. Casada con el señor Victor tiene 1 hijo de nombre Pedro.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

Ojo. En la fotos algunas de las socias salen con sus hijos.
texts.en:
The village bank 12 de Marzo is composed of 10 clients, 8 women and 2 men. The majority of the members live in the San Antonio Alto zone at the entrance to the Escobar Uria zone. They dedicate their time to the sale of food and clothes. They have met for training from Emprender 4 times during which all members were in attendance and none have a history of poor credit, or are considered risky. Señora Ana is the leader and, as president, is currently in charge of the group. She sells wheat on Gallardo street and has been doing this for the last 5 years. She plans to use her loan to invest in bulk wheat purchases but her goal is really to grow her business and sell a variety of groceries in a commercial center. She is married to Señor Wilfredo who works as a brick-layer. They have two children who depend on her. From the beginning of their training sessions, her village bank has identified her as a very responsible person since she always supported the other members and took the lead in coordinating the formation of the group. She was also a member of another bank a year ago in which she completed all her payments and took responsibility as a guarantor. Señora Maria Del Carmen is the bank's treasurer and runs a toy business where she sews clothing for dolls and makes stuffed animals from all different kinds of fabric. She has been doing this business with her sister for the last year. They plan to sue the loan to buy a specific type of fabric. They hope to have their own large-scale doll and stuffed animal business. She is single and lives in her grandparent's house with her other relatives. She has been chosen as a representative by her village bank because she is young and a dynamic worker. Señora Juana has been active and dynamic in the group's formation and has been chosen as secretary. She sells fruit in the Villa San Antonio Alto market. She will use the loan to invest in a variety of merchandise so that she can better serve her clients. She is married to Señor Victor and has one son named Pedro. All the women are very thankful for Emprender and Kiva for their confidence and providing this loan. Note: In the photo, some of them women are with their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Aquilina es soltera y tiene 54 años, Aquilina se dedica a la siembra de verduras en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de ayacucho.
Aquilina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y abono.
Aquilina sueña con terminar el cuarto piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Solución community bank. She is single and is 54 years old. She works planting vegetables in the community of Compañia. She sells her produce in the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. Aquilina needs a loan of PEN 1050 to invest in the purchase of seed and fertilizer. Aquilina dreams of finishing the fourth floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Maria es casada, tiene 57 años y 5 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales, queso.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. aceite, harina y arroz.
Los sueños D. Maria son aumentar su capital y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Solucion community bank. She is 57 years old, married and has 5 children. Maria travels to different fairs in the region to sell groceries, vegetables, and fruits and to buy cereal and cheese. Maria needs a loan of PEN 1050 that will be invested in the purchase of oil, oatmeal and rice. Maria’s dreams are to increase her capital and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase oil, oatmeal, and rice.

loans.name: Nancy Gladys

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Nancy es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una Botica llamada Unión Gómez en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
El sueño de Nancy es tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Solucion community bank. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 children. Nancy has a drugstore called Union Gomez in a rented space. She works there every day with the help of her son. Nancy needs a loan of PEN 1050 that will be invested in the purchase of medicine. Nancy’s dream is to have a pharmacy chain.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Serafina Ludys

texts.es:
Serafina Ludys M. V. tiene 42 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio en Barranquilla. Está casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años. La educación de sus hijos ha sido el mayor desafío de esta admirable mujer, pues los dos padecen de enfermedades que requieren especialistas: tiene un hijo especial (a su lado en la foto) y el otro tiene una enfermedad de la piel y ella siempre está pendiente de ellos, por eso para poder atenderlos trabaja desde su casa en su pequeña miscelánea y refresquería todo el día hasta cuando el cliente lo requiera, ella ora y espera con mucha fe un milagro de Dios: la recuperación total de los dos.
Inició su negocio en el año 1994 y este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en los que ha demostrado su excelencia en el cumplimiento de su plan de pagos;  ella aplica por un  valor de de $2.000.000 para comprar refrescos, ropa, zapatos y cosméticos y para arreglar la vitrina. Tiene varias fuentes de proveedores de sus productos, entre otros, empresas de revistas, tiendas en el centro de Barranquilla y el camión de la Cervecería Águila, cervecería importante de tradición barranquillera. Cuenta con una variedad de clientes, que incluye vecinos, referidos, empleados, amigos y familiares y se sostiene siempre al frente de la fuerte competencia que hay en  su barrio, con atención oportuna y esmerada de sus clientes. Es más, los tres créditos que ha recibido en los últimos dos años le han permitido comprar una vitrina, pagar facturas y acreditar el negocio en mercancías pues, más adelante, sueña con tener un local con almacén bien surtido.
texts.en:
Serafina Ludys M. V. is 42 years old. She lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood in Barranquilla. She is married and has two children who are 16 and 14 years old. Her children's education is this admirable woman's greatest challenge. Both of them have illnesses that require specialists. She has a special needs son (next to her in the photo) and the other child has a skin disease. She is always watching over them; that is why in order to take care of them she works from her home with a small variety and refreshment store. She works all day, whenever the customer needs her. She hopes and prays with much faith for a miracle from God: their recovery. She began her business in 1994 and this is her fourth loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has demonstrated her excellence in making payments according to schedule. She is applying for the amount of $2.000.000 to buy beverages, clothes, shoes and cosmetics and to fix her display case. She has various suppliers of her products, among them, magazine distributors, stores from downtown Baranquilla and the Cervecería Águila truck. This is a very important brewery of the Baranquilla tradition. She has a variety of clients, including neighbors, referrals, workers, friends and family. She maintains the business in the face of strong competition in her neighborhood with prompt and conscientious service. In addition, the three loans that she has received in the last two years has allowed her to buy a display case, to pay bills and to accredit the business for merchandise. In the future, she dreams of having a locale with a well outfitted store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, clothes, shoes and cosmetics and to fix the display case

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”, actualmente se encuentra en el II ciclo, las reuniones D. los socios son una vez al mes en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa, el banco comunal esta conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.
               
Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. yeso y tejas, venta D. comida, venta D. comestibles, venta D. verduras, venta D. ropa y zapatillas y otros ofrecen servicios D. transportes, construcción D. casas y carpintería. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Fidelia forma parte del banco comunal “Los Lideres”, ella tiene 38 años D. edad, ella vive en la ciudad D. Cusco, ella tiene tres hijos (2 varones y 1 mujer). Fidelia nos cuenta que se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. muebles D. madera, ella y su esposo tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, ella nos cuenta que los días sábados venD. sus productos en la feria sabatina del  mercado el Molino II y los domingos en la feria dominial del Mercado D. San Sebastián, ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Fidelia requiere el préstamo para implementar su casa, ella desea comprar calaminas para techar la parte que falta D. su domicilio, su mayor anhelo D. la socia es tener su propia tienda donD. pueda expender sus productos.           

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Los Lideres Communal Bank is currently in its 2nd loan cycle. The group meetings take place once a month insiD. Asociación Arariwa's central office. This group is comprised of 14 hardworking and enterprising people who are looking for opportunities to get ahead at every moment, struggling on a daily basis to proviD. their children with a better future. The members of this group live in the city of Cusco, a place that is well known for its archaeological centers, its history, and its landscapes, which makes it an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.

The members are involved in plaster and tile sales, fast food sales, general stores, vegetable sales, and clothing and footwear sales. The other members offer transportation services, home construction, and carpentry. This group has been in existence for several loan cycles. The group members state that they are happy and satisfied with the microfinance institute's loans, savings, and training. One of the positive aspects of this bank is the chance for savings and for turning a profit.

Fidelia is a member of the Los Lideres Communal Bank. She is 38 years old and lives in the city of Cusco. She has three children (2 sons and a daughter). Fidelia makes and sells wooden furniture for a living. She and her husband have a small workshop in their home. She states that they sell their furniture at the El Molino II market every Saturday, and at the San Sebastián market every Sunday. They have been in business for 10 years and have been prosperous. Fidelia needs a loan for her house. She would like to purchase corrugated roof panels for the area of her house that lacks a roof. Her greatest wish is to have her own store to sell her products.

All the group members in general are grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan, and they are committed to making their repayments according to their pre-established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corrugated roof panels

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Bernardino, una zona rural del distrito D. Túcume, en la provincia D. Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección D. pantalones en drill y poliéster desD. hace mas D. 10 años. Este negocio ha sido D. mucha ayuda a la economía familiar durante todo este tiempo, ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y los ingresos que percibía no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Con este negocio ella y su familia ha salido adelante. Actualmente sus hijos ya estan independizados y ello la llena D. orgullo.

Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, trabaja junto a otros vecinos con un comerciante mayorista que les compra los pantalones que confeccionan para manufacturarlos y venderlos en diversos puntos del país. Actualmente ella tiene muchos pedidos y comparte responsabilidades con dos D. sus hijas que se dedican a la misma actividad.

Francisca se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. una maquina D. coser industrial con la cual su labor se haga mas facil y eficiente.

Ella es una mujer bastante laboriosa y muy creativa, realiza su trabajo con la mayor responsabilidad y calidad posibles. Su mayor anhelo es poder implementar un taller junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 49-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the San Bernardino settlement, a rural area in the Túcume district of the Lambayeque province, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been making polyester and drill cotton pants for over 10 years. This business has been of great help to the family income throughout all this time because her husband works in agriculture and does not earn enough money to cover all the family expenses. With this business, she and her family have been able to get ahead. Her children are now independent, which fills her with priD..

She and some of her neighbors work (by special order) with a wholesaler who buys the merchandise that they make and later sells it throughout the country. She currently has many orders to fill, and she shares the load with two of her daughters who also make pants.

Francisca is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000.00 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa for the very first time. She will use this loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine, which will help her work faster and more efficiently.

She is a very hardworking and creative person who works responsibly and produces the highest quality products. Her greatest wish is to be able to set up a sewing workshop alongsiD. her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es socio del Banco Comunal Solución.
Humberto es casado, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Humberto tiene una agencia D. corretajes D. compra y venta D. terrenos, casas, cuenta con un personal que le ayuda en las actividades D. L. agencia.
Humberto necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. muebles D. oficina.
Humberto sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Humberto is a member of the Solución Communal Bank.

Humberto is a 59-year-old married father with 6 children. He is a real estate broker who buys and sells land and homes. He has his own staff who help him with the agency.

Humberto needs a 1,800.00 PEN loan, which he will invest in purchasing office furniture. He dreams of expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase office furniture

loans.name: Aida Estela

texts.es:
Aida Estela Sánchez C. tiene 39 años,  vive en  el barrio 7 de Abril, ubicado en el suroccidente  de Barranquilla y se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada, como ropa y platería;  negocio que inició a finales del año 1992, una vez decidió compartir su vida con su cónyuge y dedicarse al cuidado de su familia especialmente de sus hijos.   Siendo soltera había trabajado mucho tiempo  como empleada  y ahora con un hogar, decidió cambiar su vida para cumplir con su responsabilidad de esposa y madre y al mismo tiempo  apoyar el mejoramiento de  su familia. Comenzó  vendiendo  jean, suéter y accesorios de  platería, como en la actualidad  ocurre desde  hace 17 años,  lapso de tiempo en el que ha logrado consolidar su actividad comercial. Ella tiene  muchos clientes fijos y es muy reconocida en su sector por dar respuestas rápidas a sus pedidos; este es el propósito que planea al acceder a este crédito por valor de $1.000.000,   que invertirá en la compra de mercancías especialmente camisueter solicitados por sus clientes;   con esta inversión en su negocio aumentará  sus utilidades, pues significa un nuevo capital de trabajo del que puede disponer para comprar en efectivo. Desde que inició su negocio este es su segundo crédito, dice que asì  ha logrado ampliar sus inventarios  y capitalizarlo, ofreciendo  a sus clientes las mercancías que le encargan de manera oportuna.
Aida Sánchez tiene el gran sueño de  comprar una casa donde se encuentren cómodos  con sus familia,  para eso se mantiene siempre activa, porque está siempre dispuesta a responder a sus   clientes con  ropa y accesorios  de  buena calidad, para conservarlos e  incrementar su mercado a través de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Aida Estela Sánchez C. is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the 7 de Abril neighborhood, located in the southwestern part of Barranquilla. She sells a variety of products, such as clothing and silver jewelry. She started this business towards the end of 1992, when she decided to share her life with her spouse and take care of her family, especially her children. When she was single, she had worked as a domestic servant for many years. Now that she has a family, she decided to change her life in order to fulfill her duties as a wife and mother, while at the same time support her family's amelioration. She started out by selling jeans, sweaters, and silver accessories. She has been in business for the last 17 years, during which time she has been able to strengthen her commercial activities. She has a fixed clientele and is well-known in her area for filling her orders quickly. For this reason, she is now requesting a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing merchandise, especially the polo shirts her customers have requested. By investing in her business, her profits will increase because this is working capital that she can use to pay cash for her merchandise. This is her second loan since she started the business, and she has been able to expand her inventory and make a profit, offering her customers the merchandise they order at an optimal time.

Aida Sánchez dreams of buying a house so that her family can live comfortably. For this reason, she is always active. She is always willing to provide her customers with high quality apparel and accessories so that she can keep their business and increase her transactions.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, particularly polo shirts

loans.name: Milagros Isabel

texts.es: Milagros Isabel de 33 años de edad es soltera, trabaja como administradora en una Farmacia desde hace 6 años, tiene 2 niñas, Cristina de 12 años estudiando 1er año de secundaria y la menor Ivonne de 9 años en primaria,  cuenta con el apoyo del padre de las niñas que asume los gastos escolares de las niñas y del hogar.  Milagros esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera ser beneficiada con kiva, pues desea mejorar su cocina construyendo un pantry, y poniendole el piso para mayor comodidad de la familia, si el dinero lo permite desea poner el techo donde tiene el lavandero porque como se acerca el invierno cuando lava la ropa se moja.  El mayor sueño de Milagros es tener su casa bonita con las comodidades que sus  hijas necesitan, ya que es la herencia que les dejara.
texts.en:
Milagros Isabel is a 33-year-old single woman who has been working as an administrator at a pharmacy for 6 years. She has 2 children: Cristina, age 12, who is in her first year of middle school, and Ivonne, age 9, who is in elementary school. Milagros has their father's support in that he covers both their school and household expenses. Milagros is requesting her second loan, and she hopes to obtain one from Kiva as she would like to remodel her kitchen by building a pantry and installing floor tile to provide more comfort to her family. If money permits, she would like to install a roof over her laundry area because when winter arrives, she gets wet while doing the laundry. Milagros' dream is to have a beautiful house with all the amenities that her daughters need because her house will be their inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen remodeling

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores L.  vive en la parroquia  Santa Ana junto a su esposo que trabaja en construcción y  cuatro de los ocho  hijos que concibió, el mayor de 32 años es soltero y vive independiente, el de 20 y 17 años trabjan y aportan con los gastos del hogar solo cuando pueden, los dos menores de 15 y 12 años respectivamente son estudiantes de secundaria en un colegio de la comunidad mientras que los otros son mayores de edad y han formado sus propias familias. La casa es propia gracias al esfuerzo conyugal mantenido durante muchos años.

La señora María Dolores es socia del banco Comunal Unión Progresista formado por mujeres luchadoras, visionarias dispuestas a sacar adelante a sus familias, tiene una amistad muy buena con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal en donde lleva dos  años.  Este banco esta  ubicado en la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca región que se caracteriza por sus hermosos  paisajes naturales, su gente la cual en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura y cria de animales. 

A sus 56 años ella se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la cría de animales como gallinas, chanchos, borregos y este oficio aprendió desde muy pequeña de sus progenitores, el credito obtenido anteriormente le ha servido para cancelar algunas deudas del hogar, con el  nuevo crédito que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a  comprar chanchos grandes solo para engordarlos y  venderlos.

Su meta es seguir trabajando muy duro para salir adelante y prosperar en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Dolores L. lives in Santa Ana parish with her husband, who works in construction, and 4 of their 8 children. The eldest is 32 years old, single, and independent. Both the 20 and 17-year-old work and help with the household expenses when they can. The younger ones, ages 15 and 12, currently attend the local secondary school. The rest are all adults who have started their own families. The family has its own house thanks to this married couple's years of efforts.

Ms. María Dolores is a member of the Unión Progresista Communal Bank, comprised of hardworking women--visionaries who are willing to help their families get ahead. These members have had a very solid friendship throughout the two years that this group has been in existence. This communal bank is located in the Santa Ana parish of the city of Cuenca, a region that is known for its beauteous natural landscapes, and its people, who are primarily in agriculture or stockbreeding.

María, now age 56, takes care of the household chores and raises animals, such as chickens, pigs and sheep. She learned this skill from her parents at a very young age. She used her previous loan to pay off a couple of household debts. With this new loan from FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, she will purchase large pigs to fatten and sell.

Her goal is to keep working arduously so that she can get ahead and so that her business can prosper.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Valle Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SARA EDITH, TIENE TIENE 27 AÑOS D. EDAD, Y TIENE DOS HIJOS MENORES D. EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "LA ESPERANZA DEL VALLE" Y FUÉ RECIENTEMENTE ELEGIDA POR SUS NUEVE COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. SARA EDTH SE DEDICA DESD. HACE SEIS MESES A LA VENTA AMBULATORIA D. PAPA RELLENA, QUE ELLA PREPARA TODAS LAS MAÑANAS Y SALE A DIFERENTES LOZAS DEPORTIVAS Y RECORRE LAS CALLES OFRECIENDO SUS PAPAS RELLENAS.
APROVECHANDO EL CARISMA QUE TIENE, YA QUE ES MUY ALEGRE Y AMIGABLE, UNA AMIGA LE DIÓ LA IDEA D. INVERTIR EN EL NEGOCIO D. COMIDA, CON EL CUAL HA PODIDO SOSTENER A SU FAMILIA, A SUS DOS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA ELLOS, SOBRETODO HA PODIDO SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS D. ESTUDIOS D. SUS MENORES HIJOS.
LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO TENER MAS ADELANTE UN RESTAURANTE.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INTERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. MESAS Y SILLAS PARA UBICARSE FUERA D. SU CASA PARA OFRECER SUS PAPAS RELLENAS Y TALVES OTROS PRODUCTOS MAS.
texts.en:
Ms. Sara Edith is a 27-year-old mother of two underage children. She is a member of the La Esperanza del Valle Group, a communal bank of which she was recently elected president by her 9 group members.

Ms. Sara Edith has been selling stuffed potatoes as a street vendor for a living for six months. She prepares her dishes every morning, then goes out to various sports grounds, selling her stuffed potatoes throughout the adjacent streets.

She is making use of her charm because she is a very cheerful and friendly person. A friend gave her the idea of investing in a food business. With this business, she has been able to support her family--her two children--as she is both a mother and a father for them. Above all, she has been able to cover her children's educational expenses.

She would very much like to open up her own restaurant in the future.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing tables and chairs so that she can set them up outsiD. her home and sell her stuffed potatoes and possibly more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que el tenia el objetivo de buscar nuevos ingresos y con la ayuda de su esposa por lo que tenía a 4 hijos que mantener todos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que actualmente Francisco tiene muchos clientes por lo que asisten a su negocio, por que el carisma que ofrece es muy bueno. El lucho mucho por tener este negocio es así que decide solicitar este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y aplicarlo en la compra de golosinas, galletas, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón y detergentes. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco José is a 49-year-old man who runs his own general store. He has been in business for more than 6 years. He launched his business because his goal was to look for additional income with his wife's help. At that time, he had to support 4 children, who are now self-employed. Francisco currently has customers who visit his store because of his charm. He struggled tirelessly to obtain this business, so he has decided to request this loan as working capital, which he will use to purchase candy, cookies, beans, sugar, soap and detergent. He dreams of home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Chepito Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de pantalones desde hace mas de cuatro años. Ella nos comenta que se animó a empezar este negocio debido su esposo trabajaba como agricultor y los ingresos que percibía no eran permanentes. María del Carmen se contactó con un comerciante mayorista que le hace diversos pedidos de acuerdo a la campaña del año (actualmente se encuentra confeccionando pantalones escolares), el va a recoger la mercadería para luego manufacturarla y venderla en diversas zonas de la serranía del país.

Adicionalmente ella ha empezado un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella piensa valerse de este negocio para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. El negocio está teniendo muy buena acogida entre sus clientes y vecinos debido a que la zona en donde vive queda alejada del pueblo y no tienen acceso a productos de consumo diario. María del Carmen desea ampliar este negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada en la comunidad donde vive. Su mayor anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su bodega para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chepito Alto settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been making pants for a living for over four years. She states that she decided to launch this business because her husband works in agriculture and does not have a steady income. María del Carmen got in touch with a wholesaler who fills special orders depending on the season (they are currently making school uniform pants). He picks up the merchandise and sells it throughout the different areas of the country's mountainous region.

She has also started her own small general store. She plans on using this business to help her family get ahead in life. This business has welcomed many customers and neighbors due to the fact that they live in a rural area that is far from town, so they do not have access to the products that they consume on a daily basis. María del Carmen would like to expand this business, which is why she needs to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the very first time. She will invest this money in purchasing goods for her general store.

She is a well-known and respected person in her community. Her greatest wish is to keep making her general store grow so that she can continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for in-home general store

loans.name: Ndoumbe

texts.fr: Madame Ndoumbe D. est une femme de 44 ans vivant dans la localité  de  Guediawaye plus précisément  dans le quartier de Nimzath 2. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis septembre 2009.Madame D. vend du te, du sucre, des produits  détergents  et a une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Elle est divorcée  et mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 20 et 25 ans.  Elle a choisi cette activité  par nécessité  car après  le divorce elle devait assurer la survie de ses  enfants.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de produits. La rentabilité  de son activité  lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins personnels, d’assurer les frais de scolarité  de ses deux filles, l’une étant   étudiante  en deuxième  année  a l’université  de Dakar   et l’autre inscrite dans une institution de santé.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndoumbe D. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Guediawaye, in the Nimzath 2 district to be precise. She has been a member of the credit association of Baye Laye since September 2009. Ndoumbe sells tea, sugar, and detergents, and she has twenty years of experience in her work. She is divorced and the mother of three children varying in age from 20 to 25 years. She chose this work out of necessity because, after the divorce, she had to ensure the survival of her children. Ndoumbe is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for bolstering her stock of goods. Her business' profitability enables her to cover schooling costs for her two daughters. One of them is a student in her second year at the University of Dakar, and the other is enrolled in a health care institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique tiene 63 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que el inicio como un medio para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y esto le ocasionaba problemas porque no podía ofrecerle a su familia el pan de cada día, motivado por una amigo que le ayudo con este negocio empieza su arduo trabajo. Es así que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, faldas, trajes y ropa interior. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y además ofrecer sus productos de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
Enrique is a 63-year-old man who buys and sells clothing for a living. He has been in business for over 5 years. He started this business as a way of covering the household expenses. He has 4 children who are self-employed. He did not have a steady job, which caused problems because he could not provide his family with their daily bread. Motivated by a friend who helped him with the business, Enrique started his arduous work. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase undergarments, pants, skirts and suits. He dreams of expanding his business, as well as becoming a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Blanca C. es socia del banco comunal  Unión Progresista, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana localidad donde se puede apreciar paisajes naturales como el cerro Mama Tepal ubicado a 3 Km. del centro de la parroquia este es  un mirador natural desde donde podemos apreciar la belleza de la ciudad de Cuenca y  parte de Azogues, su  población se dedica a varias actividades pero principalmente a   la agricultura y cria de animales de corral.

Blanca  tiene  43 años de edad enviudó  hace 11 años porque su esposo murió a causa de una pelea en la cual  le propinaron un golpe en el riñón, con su conyuge concibió tres hijos que ahora cuentan con 23, 21, 19 años, los dos mayores viven  en unión libre con sus respectivas parejas en otro sector de la urbe, sólo le acompaña su hija menor aún soltera  que trabaja como empleada doméstica y lo que gana le sirve solo para sus gastos personales,  tiene un pequeña casa que fue herencia de su esposo.

Ella  se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos en casa de otras personas todos los días de 8 a.m. a 4 p.m. lleva 20 años en este oficio, también cría animales pero tiene un poco de problemas en esta laborar ya que se le mueren con algún mal. Lleva  trabajando tres años con la fundación  incentivada por una compañera de su banco comunal y gracias al apoyo recibido ha comprado sus animalitos que los vende y le han permitido  mejorar un poco la economía de su hogar,  con el crédito que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue a invertir en su casa comprando articulos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, aceite, fideo, sal, etc. y crias de chanchos, afrechillo para su crecimiento.

Su meta es arreglar su casa que se encuentra un poco vieja.
texts.en:
Blanca C. is a member of the Unión Progresista communal bank. She lives in the hamlet of Santa Ana, from where natural landscapes can be seen, such as the Mama Tepal hill, located 3 kilometers from the center of the village. This is a natural lookout from where the beauty of the city of Cuenca and part of Azogues can be appreciated. The population works in various activities but mostly in agriculture and raising livestock. Blanca is 43 years old and was widowed 11 years ago, when her husband died due to a fight in which he received a blow to the kidneys. She had three children with her husband who are now 23, 21, and 19 years old. The oldest two live in common-law marriages with their respective partners in another part of the city. Only her youngest daughter, who is still single, lives with her. She works as a domestic employee and what she earns is only enough for her personal expenses. She has a small house which she inherited from her husband. She does domestic chores at other persons´ homes every day from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. She has been doing this for 20 years. She also raises animals but she has a few problems with this work since some of her animals have died from disease. She has been working with the Foundation for three years, motivated by a colleague of her communal bank. Thanks to the support she has received she has bought animals to sell and this has allowed her to improve her household economy a little. With a loan from Fundación Espoir she will invest in her home by buying basic goods that she needs such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, salt, etc., and will buy piglets and bran feed so they will grow. Her goal is to fix her house, which is currently somewhat old.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic goods for her home such as rice, sugar, pasta, and oil: piglets and bran feed

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo de 2 años de edad en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que hace dos años empezara a dedicarse a la confección de gorros de lona, el confecciona sus productos y luego los vende a diversos comerciantes de las ciudades de Piura, Jaén y Bagua. Candelario ya ha había trabajado anteriormente en un taller y con sus ahorros pudo adquirir su máquina de coser al momento de independizarse.

La demanda por su producto ha aumentado y Candelario piensa ampliar su negocio con la confección de más gorros, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar materiales (hilos, lona) para realizar esta acción.

Candelario es un padre honesto, muy entregado a su trabajo y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir una vivienda para darle a su esposa y a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Candelario is a 24-year-old father who lives with his wife and young 2-year-old son in his parents´ house, located in the hamlet of Lagunas, a rural zone in the Mórrope district of Lambayeque province, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Two years ago, the need to support his family made him start to work at sewing canvas caps. He makes his products and later sells them to different salespeople in the cities of Piura, Jaén and Bagua. Candelario had previously been employeed at a workshop and with his savings was able to buy a sewing machine when he went independent. Demand for his product has increased and Candelario is thinking about expanding his business by making more caps. To do so he needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1500 new soles, which will allow him to buy supplies (thread, canvas) to take this step. Candelario is an honest father, dedicated to his work, and always gives the best he can to support his family. His greatest dream is to be able to buy a house in order to give his wife and son a better qualify of life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and canvas to make caps.

loans.name: Ada Zila

texts.es: Ada Zila es una mujer joven. Esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con financiamientos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. por lo que tiene 2 hijos que mantener, Doña Ada sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, por lo que busca la forma de mejorar su negocio es así ofreciendo sus productos de manera personal y en su bicicleta. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ada Zila is a young woman. This is not her first experience with obtaining a loan. Her economic activity is the sale of general goods. She has been in this business for more than 16 years as she has 2 children to support. Every day Doña Ada goes out to sell using her only means of transportation, her bicycle. She looks for ways to improve her business by offering her products both personally and from her bicycle. The loan she is requesting is for working capital to buy merchandise. Her wish is to improve her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable y con vistas a un crecimiento constante. 

Así como ejemplo la señora Elva J. quien se dedica a la elaboración de productos de limpiezas, ella compra  todos los ingredientes y elabora los productos de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes. La señora Elva visita a los clientes y levanta los anota los pedidos y de acuerdo a ello prepara sus productos para vender.

Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de ingredientes de los productos de limpieza que ella prepara para vender.
texts.en:
All members of the committee are mothers who work at various activities with the goal of strengthening their home economies and developing their businesses´ sustainability, with a view toward continuous growth. For example, Elva J. makes cleaning products. She buys all the ingredients and makes the products according to the orders she receives from her customers. Elva visits her customers and writes down their orders and based on that prepares her products to sell. She is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients for the cleaning products she prepares and sells.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for cleaning products such as soap, sodium bicarbonate, perfumes and oils.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JADEE NOEMI, VIVE EN LA ZONA D. TRAPICHE, EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO, TIENE 30 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE DOS MENORES HIJOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "AMIGAS UNIDAS" JUNTO CON 10 PERSONAS MAS Y HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. GRUPO.
JADEE NOEMI, SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO D. COSTURA, TIENE UN PEQUEÑO TALLER EN SU DOMICILIO.
ELLA INICIÓ TRABAJANDO EN EL TALLER D. UNA VECINA, AHI APRENDIÓ A REMALLAR, LE AGRADÓ MUCHO EL TRABAJO Y PARALELAMENTE CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD EMPEZÓ A ESTUDIAR CORTE Y CONFECCIÓN.
CON EL FRUTO D. SU TRABAJO PUDO ADQUIRIR SU PRIMERA M ÁQUINA D. COSTURA CON LA CUAL CONFECCIONÓ POLOS PARA LA VENTA, LOS CUALES OFRECIÓ PRIMERO A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS MAS CERCANOS.
HOY EN DÍA TIENE UN TALLER EN SU CASA Y SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR POLOS PERO EN MAYOR CANTIDAD. CON ÉSTE TRABAJO ELLA HA LOGRADO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, LO CUAL LE PERMITÉ PAGAR UNA MEJOR EDUCACIÓN PARA SUS HIJOS.
CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO, INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR MAS PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
texts.en:
Jadee Noemi lives in the Trapiche zone, in the Carabayllo district. She is 30 years old and has two young children. She is part of the "Amigas Unidas" group along with 10 other people and has been chosen by her colleagues as president of the group. Jadee Noemi is a seamstress. She has a small workshop in her home. She started off in the workshop of a neighbor and there she learned how to mend. She liked the work a lot and at the same time started to study how to cut and sew. With the fruits of her work she was able to buy her first sewing machine with which she maD. t-shirts to sell, which she first offered to her family members and closest friends. Today she has a workshop in her home and she makes t-shirts but in greater quantities. With this work she has been able to achieve financial stability, which has allowed her to pay for a better education for her children. With the loan requested, she will invest in material to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials.

loans.name: Gloria  Noemi

texts.es:
La Sra Gloria Noemí C. de C. tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 11 años, no tiene hijos.
Desde hace 4 años atrás empezó junto a su marido el negocio de la venta de carnes en un Supermercado, poco a poco fue creciendo, ya que el mismo tiene cliente recurrentes.
Con el crédito obtenido de la fundación compro una congeladora, para la conservar los embutidos para la ventas ya que uno de sus congeladoras tuvo un desperfecto y solo con la compra de uno nuevo podría seguir conservando dichas mercaderías.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Noemí C. de C. is 31 and has been married for 11 years. She doesn’t have any children. 4 years ago she started a business along with her husband of selling meat in a supermarket. Little by little the business grew because of returning customers. With the loan that she obtained from the foundation she bought a freezer to keep the cold meats for sale. One of her freezers had a flaw and only when she bought a new one could she keep selling this merchandise. She thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the support offered her.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: La Gran Familia Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado La Gran Familia y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la comuna La Granja. La Granja es una comuna ubicada en la zona sur del gran Santiago, capital de Chile. Corresponde a un territorio urbano con viviendas e importantes empresas relacionadas con la madera, manufacturas y metales. 
Estos socios se dedican a diversos negocios independientes tales como confección de ropa, panadería, pastelería, artesanía, coupage (decoración de objetos como cajas de madera, botellas y cuadros), verdulería, almacén de abarrotes, peluquería, fabricación y reparación de calzados y preparación y venta de comida rápida.
La socia entrevistada fue Carolina, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en la última fila, a la derecha y viste polera (camiseta manga corta) naranja. Ella vende verduras y ensaladas preparadas, en su casa. Invertirá este préstamo en bolsas para las ensaladas y en verduras, además ahorrará para comprar una camioneta usada para comprar mercadería. Sus sueños son tener un Kiosco, que sirva también de bodega, con el mismo rubro (verdulería) y tener un puesto en una feria.
