The loan is to buy construction materials like cement, sand and blocks for the construction of a room for one of her sons.

Mrs. Johana has had 2 loans with CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner) for 2 years and she has used it to improve her home.

Johana says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL she now has a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and make her home bigger.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Manuela de Jesús J., es una señora emprendedora de un negocio de venta de Bisutería   y otros productos el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de ahorro hace 15 años. Este negocio está ubicado Mercado Israel lewite callejón principal del mercado. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra prendas de fantasías, colas, prensadores, chapas de madera y carey. 
Ella es casada tiene a su cargo un hijo y se encuentran  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella  Vendía ambulante en el mercado Israel lewite. 

Lleva 16 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 4 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela de Jesús is an enterprising woman with a business selling a variety of products. It began with an initial capital of 5,000 córdobas, and has been expanding for 15 years. Her business is located in the principal aisle of the Israel Lewite Market. The loan she solicits is to be invested in working capital, such as buying women's accessories, tails, pins, wooden plates,etc. She is married and has a school-age boy in her charge. She says that before this business, she sold goods on foot in the Israel Lewite Market. Manuela has had 16 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 4 years. Each was invested in her business, which has been growing, with diversified products, thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOMEN'S ACCESSORIES, TAILS, PINS, AND WOODEN PLATES TO SELL

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
Esta señora se llama Ana Bertha E. Méndez, soltera, tiene 57 años de edad, ella es maestra de escuela primaria, tiene 26 años de trabajar como maestra. 

Con nuestra institución tiene de estar trabajando desde el año 2005, los créditos que se le han otorgado, en su mayoría han sido para mejorar su vivienda. 

En la totalidad de los créditos otorgados esta señora ha presentado muy buena conducta de pago.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Bertha E. M.is single, she is 57 years old and she is a primary school teacher. She has been a teacher for over 26 years.

She has been working with our institution (Kiva’s field partner) since 2005, the majority of the loans have been used to improve her home.

As a whole, she has shown to be very good at repaying the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to improve her home (cement, sand, gravel, blocks, labor).

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Eufemia V. es comerciante del mercado central tiene un tramo de marisco en el sector marisco, tiene 40 años de ser comerciante activa anteriormente ella era ama de casa y caminaba vendiendo por las mañanas marisco lo iba a comprar a Morazán y aquí lo venia a revender es madre de 7 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella.
 Su negocio lo abre desde las siete de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde  y el producto me lo traen a vender a mi tramo proveedores que vienen de Morazán.
El financiamiento ella lo solicito para surtir su negocio  tiene seis años de trabajar con estos créditos y se siente muy agradecida primero que gracias a Dios nunca nos ha quedado mal, segundo que lo  ha sabido administrar para su negocio y de las ganancias a podido ir remodelando su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Eufemia V. sells in the central market and has a stall where she sells shellfish in the shellfish sector. She has been selling for over 40 years, before she was a housewife and sold shellfish as a street vendor in the mornings. Mrs. V. buys the fish in Morazán and resells them in her area. She is a mother to 7 children but none depend on her financially.

She opens her business from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. and the product is brought from Morazán so that she can sell it in her stall.

The loan will be used to stock her business. Mrs. V. has been working with loans for 6 years and she is very grateful, first of all to God who has never let her down, and second she has been able to manage her business and the profits have been used to help remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varieties of shellfish.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Auxiliadora M., tiene un negocio de venta de embaces vacios como bidones, barriles, y sacos vacios el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa frente al mercado y a la parada de buses de Cosiguina, y sectores aledaños a esta.
Tiene 17 años de trabajar con este tipo de negocio se esfuerza bastante para tener el sustento en su hogar abre su negocio de lunes a domingo de ocho de la mañana a cinco y media de la tarde  tiene bastante demanda por la ubicación ya que ahí se centraliza la gente que agarra los buses que van para fincas y comarcas, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 2,000.00 ahorro decidio poner su negocio para ser independiente antes ella trabajaba como secretaria, es madre de dos hijos pero ninguno depende de ella, el financiamiento lo solicito para comprar barriles de unos grandes que le vendian a precio favorable.
La señora M. es clienta de ceprodel desde hace cinco años en los cuales ella se siente muy agradecida con la institución y con los créditos adquiridos ya que ha superado su negocio y su vida familiar tambien.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora M. has a business selling empty containers like cans, barrels, and empty bags. The business is located in her house, in front of the market, at the Cosiguina bus stop, and in surrounding areas. She has done this type of work for 17 years. She puts forth so much effort in order to support her household. The business is open from Monday to Sunday from eight in the morning until five-thirty in the afternoon. There is plenty of demand because of the location. That is where people gather to take the buses that go to the farms and other regions. She started her business with C$ 2,000.00 of savings. She decided to set up her business in order to be independent. Before that she worked as a secretary. She has two children, but they are not dependent upon her. The loan she is requesting is to buy large barrels that are being sold at a good price. Mrs. M. has been a client of Ceprodel for five years. She is very grateful to the institution. With the loans she has improved her business and her family life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy large barrels

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La Señora Martha D. A. es comerciante del mercado central en el sector de las mieles salmerón tiene 28 años de tener su negocio, lo inicio con C$ 500.00 capital propio ya que anteriormente ella era ama de casa y lavaba y planchaba ajeno primero puso una ventesita de bisutería en su casa vendiendo vigorón y luego decidio poner su negocio en el mercado  es madre soltera de dos hijos en edad escolar se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante en sus estudios desde las siete de la mañana hasta las dos y media de la tarde vende en el mercado y luego abre su pequeña venta en su casa.
El financiamiento lo solicito para surtir su negocio, tiene cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución y me manifestó sentirse agradecida con los créditos otorgados ya que por medio de estos tambien a podido ir  mejorando su casita.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha D. A. sells in the central market in the mieles salmerón sector. She has had her business for 28 years, she started with C$ 500.00, her own capital, since she used to be a housewife and she washed and ironed other peoples’ clothing. Mrs. Martha set up a small sale of costume jewelry in her home as well as selling vigorón (a dish made with yucca, fried pork and salad). Later, she decided to set up her business in the market. She is a single mother of 2 children who are of school age, and she works hard to give her children a good start in life by providing them an education. From 7 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. she sells in the market and later she opens her small store in her home.

The loan was used to stock her business. She has worked for 5 years with our institution and she said that she is very grateful for the loans because through them she has also been able to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yuccas, pigs, bacon, costume jewelry.

loans.name: Reyna Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Reyna Francisca E. R., es madre de dos hijos  y responsable de su hermano de 13 años de edad uno de sus hijos y su hermanos estan  en edad escolar, tiene un tramo ubicado en el sector verdura ya tiene ocho años de tener su negocio anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá a vender y estudiaba, pero con la ayuda de su mamá empezo a poner su propio negocio  a la par del de ella.
La señora E. R. necesita su financiamiento para surtir su negocio ya que su productos es perecedero y tiene que estar comprando a cada rato a parte que ella solo trabaja con nuestra institución con créditos ya tiene cuatro años y medio de ser clienta con nosotros y manifestó que ceprodel la a ayudado a salir adelante su casa ha mejorado bastante a comprado algunos muebles con las ganancias que le han quedado. Ella se esfuerza bastante para sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su hermano diario viene al mercado a vender a su puesto de venta desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Francisca E. R. is a mother of 2 and responsible for her 13 year old brother. One of her children is of school age as well as her brother. She has had her business for 8 years and has a stall in the vegetable sector. Some time ago, she helped her mother sell and was going to school and with her mother’s help she was able to set up her own business exactly like her mother.

Mrs. E. R. needs the loan to stock her business since her products are perishable and she has to buy them all the time. Besides she only works with our institution, and has done so for four and a half years and has said that ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner) has helped her improve her living conditions by buying some furniture with the profits that are left over. She works very hard to give her children a good start in life as well as her brother. Daily, Reyna goes to the market to sell from 6 in the morning until 5 at night.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables:  tomatoes, onions, carrots, cabbages, chayote (a plant from the gourd family).

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carla del Socorro M. tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el Mercado Santa Ana en el sector comida, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su financiamiento lo solicito para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles por quintales y un bidón de aceite,  esto lo hizo para no estar comprando poquito por poquito estos productos, anteriormente doña Carla M. solo le ayudaba a su mamá en el negocio pero luego decidio poner su propio negocio ya que tiene que mantener a su hija. La señora M. es madre soltera de una niña en edad escolar por la cual ella se esfuerza para sacarla adelante  abre su negocio  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde su niña cuando sale del colegio le ayuda a entregar las comidas que tiene de pedido.
La señora  Carla M. tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel la cual ahora tiene mas inventario, mejor acondicionado su negocio para sus clientes y a mejorado su casa comprando lo esencial para el hogar
texts.en:
Carla sells food in the Santa Ana market and has been doing this for 20 years. She requested this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil. She does not want to have to buy these items in small amounts. She used to help her mother with a similar business, but later decided to start her own, as she must support her daughter. She is a single mother with a school-aged daughter whom she works to get ahead. She opens her business at 7:00 am and works until 4:00 pm, when her daughter gets out of school. [Her daughter] helps her to deliver the food that the customers have ordered. Carla has been working with CEPRODEL for five years. Now she has a larger inventory and her business is better known. She has also been able to buy necessities for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Eirá  Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eirá Mercedes S. Aguilera, es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de jugos, agua y choco-litas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la COTRAN 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de leche, agua helada y gaseosa.

Es casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, este se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 8 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 3 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Eirá is an enterprising woman and the owner of a business that sells juices, water, and chocolate milk. She started with capital of 10,000 NIO which she borrowed ten years ago. Her business is located in the Israel Iewite market, in the principal entrance to COTRAN. She is asking for this loan in order to provide working capital to invest in milk, water, and soft drinks. She is married and has school-aged two children. She says that she used to work as a domestic before starting this business. Eirá has had eight previous loans through CEPRODEL, within the past three years, which she has invested into her business. She's been able to grow the business by diversifying her merchandise to be able to compete in the marketplace. All of this thanks to the financing through CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo, el banco comunal esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las ciudades del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. comida, venta D. comestibles, venta D. artesanía, venta D. jora y pasto, venta D. verduras, venta D. animales menores,  venta D. lácteo y venta D. granos secos y otros ofrecen servicios D. cuidado D. ancianos, limpieza D. hoteles y secretariado. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Isabel forma parte del banco comunal “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla”, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. Isabel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. chicha (La chicha D. jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.), ella tiene su propio local denominada picantería que esta ubicado en la plaza D. armas del distrito D. San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco. La picantería se diferencia D. los demás negocios pues a la puerta D. ingreso del local se le coloca una bandera D. color rojo amarrada con una planta. Isabel nos cuenta como realiza su actividad comercial, ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar la chicha D. jora y empieza a venderla a partir del medio día, a partir D. las tres la tarD., ella reparte a sus clientes D. forma gratuita una pequeña comida llamada “picante”, ella atienD. su negocio hasta las 10 D. la noche y después D. terminar su jornal laboral se va a descansar para mañana volver a comenzar su trabajo. Ya son 16 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar leña, jora y cerveza.                  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA” communal bank is in its 5th loan cycle. It is composed of 15 hard-working, enterprising members who constantly seek ways to get ahead and proviD., through their daily efforts, a better future for their children. It is a communal bank maD. up of residents of Cusco. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Among these are: sale of food, prepared meals, crafts, jora (alcoholic beverage maD. from fermented corn), pasturage, vegetables, small farm animals, dairy products, grains; others care for senior citizens, work as hotel housekeepers and as secretaries. The communal bank has undergone several cycles and, as the members state, they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings, and the training. They especially appreciate the accrued value that they can obtain by leaving their funds in a common account. Isabel is a member of the “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chimpahuaylla” communal bank. She lives with her life partner and has 6 children. Isabel is a hard-working, enterprising woman who devised a way to open her own business: she sells chicha (chicha D. jora is an ancestral Peruvian and American beverage maD. from jora, fermented corn). She has her own store, called Picantería, located in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood’s main square. Picantería is unique among the other businesses because a red flag is tied to a plant at the entrance. Isabel tells us how she does her work: she rises very early to prepare the chicha D. jora and then begins her sales around noon. Starting at three in the afternoon, she provides a free snack, called “picante” to her customers. She is open for business until 10pm. When she completes her work day, she goes home to rest in order to start all over the next day. She has been in this line of work for 16 years and has done well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. She needs funding to buy firewood, jora and beer. The group members, as a whole, are grateful for the opportunity offered and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, jora (alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn) and beer.

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La Señora Lucrecia Eduviges C. C., es comerciante desde hace 19 años tiene su negocio en su casa es repartidora de electrodomésticos para el hogar su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 5,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo   tiene dos hijos pero ninguno a su cargo su hija le ayuda a colocar productos con los compañeros de trabajo de ella.
El crédito lo solicito para comprar unas licuadoras que le habían encargado y así ella aprovechar comprar el producto al contado para aprovechar descuentos.
La señora Lucrecia C. tiene 6 años de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los créditos los ha invertido para comprar mercaderia y colocarlos en sus clientes les ha sacado ganancia y de estas a podido ir mejorando su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Lucrecia has been in business for 19 years. She runs a home appliance business out of her home. She started her business with C$5,000 which she got from her husband. She has two children but neither of them require her support. Her daughter, along with her co-workers, helps her put up products. She used the money from this loan to buy some blenders that were requested of her. In this way she can take advantage of being able to pay for her products in cash and get them at a discount. Lucrecia has been working with CEPRODEL for six years and she has used the money to invest in merchandise that she has resold to her customers for a profit. This has allowed her to better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small appliances for resale

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
El  Señor José Raúl V. Murillo, labora para el centro de insumos para la salud CIP-MINSA.
el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, y uno  de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, es el segundo crédito que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y pintura. Para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
José Raúl dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación por lo que a hora cuenta con mejores condiciones  en su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose works for CIP-MINSA, a medical supply center. He is married and has two school-aged children to care for. This is his second loan through CEPRODEL, which will be used to improve the condition of his home. He will use the money to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting and paint. He will use the materials to build a new roof because the current one is in bad shape and leaked during the winter rains. Jose tells us that thanks to the CEPRODEL loans, he has been able to improve his home and now has better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roger Antonio López, es un padre de familia de tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y
 Trabaja para el centro de insumo para la salud.
.
Es el primer crédito que trabaja con ceprodel, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y pintura para el techo de su casa de habitación.

Todo esto con el objetivo de tener una vivienda mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is the father of three school-aged children and works for a medical supply center. This will be his first loan through CEPRODEL, which he will use to buy building materials; such as zinc metal sheeting, beams, nails, and paint for his home's roof. He wants to have a more secure home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: FLOR TIENE 28 AÑOS, ELLA ES UN CLIENTE NUEVO SE DEDICA A EL ALQUILER DE SU AUTO TICO POR EL CUAL LE PAGAN S/.30 DIARIOS, CUENTA CON OTROS INGRESOS POR LA VENTA DE ROPA COMO RECORREDORA, Y SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UN FUNDO EN VILLACURI, ELLOS TIENEN DOS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, LA CASA DONDE VIVEN ES HUMILDE PERO PROPIA, A RAIZ DE SU ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO HAN LOGRADO ADQUIRIR SUS BIENES, SON PERSONAS EMPRENDEDORAS CON MUCHOS DESEOS DE SUPERACIÓN POR LO QUE  SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN EL PINTADO Y ARREGLO DE SU VEHICULO, ELLA CUENTA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES, VOLUNTAD Y CAPACIDAD DE PAGO.
texts.en:
Flor is a new client who is 28 years old and makes a living by renting out her car for S/.30 daily. In addition, she has income from the sale of clothing, and her husband works on a large farm in Villacuri. They have two small children, and the house where they live is humble, but it is their own. Through their efforts and sacrifices, they have managed to acquire their possessions. They are enterprising people with a lot of desire to succeed. For this reason, they are requesting a loan in order to invest in the painting and repair of their vehicle. Flor has good personal references, strong willpower, and the capacity to make her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Theany

texts.en:
Mrs. Theany D., age 31, (shown with her son) and her husband, Mr. Min Men, age 37, live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school and the other two are still too young. Besides her children, Theany also has her elderly parents living with her.

Theany has been selling coconuts for two years. She buys them from Kampong Thom province and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a fisherman since they married.

Theany hopes to start a new business selling rice and she will be able to generate more income as well. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of US$1,100 to purchase rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Ky

texts.en:
Mrs. Ky M., 45, and her husband, Mr. Boeun Ka, 47, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have ten children: seven sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home; three attend school, and the other three are still young.

Ky has been selling recycling materials for two years, while her husband has been raising pigs for the same amount of time. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children's transportation to school.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu A. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a specialized retail business selling fish ball, tempura and other street foods in the local community. Marichu has been doing this for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products for selling foods

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria es trabajadora  de un estudio fotográfico desempeñándose como ejecutiva de venta en Esteli.
Maria va usar el crédito para la compra de equipo fotográfico ya que ella trabaja con su esposo como fotógrafo.
Ella espera que con la compra de esto equipo le sean de mucha ayuda para tener su propio negocio.
Maria es casada y tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar  este es su segundo crédito que ha tenido con Ceprodel ha trabajado con Ceprodel por dos años .
Maria Dijo que su crédito anterior le han ayudado mucho a  obtener otros ingreso propio.
texts.en:
Maria works hard as a sales executive in a photography studio in Esteli. She will use the money from this loan to buy photography equipment, since she works as a photographer with her husband. She hopes that this equipment will help her start her own photography business. Maria is married and has one school-aged son. This will be her second loan within two years through CEPRODEL. Maria said that the previous loan helped her to obtain an income of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Photography equipment

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila M. is from the village of Yumbing Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Petronila is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Petronila owns and operates a business selling snacks in the local community. Petronila has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Petronila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petronila is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Petronila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Leybin Javier

texts.es:
El joven Leybin Javier es trabajador de un centro de serigrafía.
Leybin va usar este crédito para gasto universitario tales como pago de matricula y aranceles.
El espera que con el crédito pueda continuar con los estudios ya que esta  cursando el tercer año de ingeniería civil.
Leybin es soltero vive con sus padres. Este es su segundo crédito ha trabajado dos años con Ceprodel. El expreso que sus créditos le han ayudado mucho en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leybin works in a silk screening center. He will use the money from this loan to pay for university expenses, such as tuition and fees. He hopes that this loan will allow him to continue with his studies, as he is in his third year of his civil engineering studies. He is single and lives with his parents. This is his second loan and he has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. He says that the loans have helped him tremendously with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 56 years old and married, with one child. She lives in the province of Antique with her husband. To supply additional income for her family, Helen would like to take out a new loan of 25,000 PHP for her business of buying and selling native products and handicrafts.

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2003, Helen is grateful for access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Helen has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and timely loan repayments. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Helen hopes her venture will flourish, deliver steady income, and support the college education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase more native products and handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Rosesa

texts.en:
Rosesa L. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Rosesa owns and operates a variety store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and other daily used products in the local community. Rosesa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosesa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.
